889.title: Dept. of Wildlife; authorize to sell certain real property belonging to located in Claiborne County, MS, and part of the Canemount WMA.
889.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Sell And Convey A Certain Parcel Of State-owned Property And Any Improvements Located Thereon Located In Claiborne County, Mississippi, And Being A Part Of The Canemount Wildlife Management Area; And For Related Purposes.

890.title: Wildlife; prohibit commission from adopting certain restrictions on taking of white-tailed deer over feeders on private lands.
890.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-4-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Have The Authority To Place Certain Restrictions On Taking Of Deer With The Use Of Supplemental Feed On Private Lands; To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Assess An Annual Fee On The Landowner, Lessee Of The Hunting Rights Or A Hunting Club Leasing The Hunting Rights For Use Of Supplemental Feed To Take Deer; To Amend Section 49-7-33.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

892.title: Nursing; advanced practice RNs are not required to have collaborative/consultative relationship with physician or dentist.
892.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Advanced Practice Registered Nurses May, But Shall Not Be Required To, Practice In A Collaborative/consultative Relationship With A Physician Or Dentist; And For Related Purposes.

893.title: State-owned vehicles; MDOC Commissioner may request unmarked vehicle for use in official investigations.
893.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of The Department Of Corrections To Request Unmarked Vehicles Where The Presence Of Identifying Marks Would Hinder Official Investigations; And For Related Purposes.

894.title: Community service; require certain amount for those on probation or parole.
894.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Division Of Community Corrections Of The Department Of Corrections To Notify Those Who Are Released On Probation, Parole, Earned-release Suspension, Post-release Or Suspension Of Certain Community Service That Must Be Performed; To Specify The Number Of Hours That Must Be Performed By Those Under The Jurisdiction Of The Division; To Amend Section 47-5-1013, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

895.title: Utility districts; revise board of certain, and provide that designated member of certain has same voting power as mayor.
895.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-167, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Members Of The Board Of Commissioners Of The Water And Sewer District Of A Certain Municipality Shall Be Appointed By The Governing Authority Of A Certain Municipality; To Amend Section 49-17-737, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The President Of The Diamondhead Water And Sewer District From Membership On The Board Of The Hancock County Utility Authority; To Provide That A Person Designated To Be A Director On The Board Shall Have Same Voting Powers As Mayor; And For Related Purposes.

896.title: Medicaid; person receiving home- and community-based services may continue receiving while on hospice.
896.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Person Is Receiving Home- And Community-based Services Authorized Under The Medicaid Program And Later Becomes Eligible For And Receives Hospice Services, The Person May Continue To Receive Home- And Community-based Services While Receiving The Hospice Services; And For Related Purposes.

897.title: Acupuncture Practice Act; delete physician referral requirement and require recertification every four years.
897.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-71-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Practitioners Of Acupuncture May Perform Acupuncture For A Patient Only If The Patient Has Received A Written Referral Or Prescription From A Physician And That The Procedure Must Be Under The General Supervision Of The Patient's Referring Or Prescribing Physician; To Amend Section 73-71-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Acupuncture Practitioners To Be Recertified Once Every Four Years According To The Current Requirements And Standards Of The National Certification Commission; To Amend Section 73-71-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; To Bring Forward Section 73-71-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes Continuing Education Requirements For Acupuncturists, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Repeal Section 73-71-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Physician Referral And Supervision Of Acupuncture Practitioners; And For Related Purposes.

898.title: Medicaid; revise certain provisions of hospital assessment and the distribution methodology for DSH and UPL payments to hospitals.
898.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Hospital Assessment For Medicaid Funding Purposes Shall Not Be Applied To Non-medicare Hospital Inpatient Days For Inpatient Psychiatric Services Provided By Nonstate Government Hospitals Licensed By The State Department Of Health To Operate Inpatient Psychiatric Beds; To Provide That If A Hospital Subject To The Assessment Closes Or Ceases To Operate Inpatient Specialty Beds Or Services That Are Recognized By The State Department Of Health As A Separate Licensure Category Of Beds, Then That Hospital's Assessment For The State Fiscal Year In Which The Specialty Beds Or Services Are Closed Or Cease To Operate Shall Be Adjusted On A Pro Rata Basis To Reflect The Number Of Days The Specialty Service Was Not In Service During The State Fiscal Year For Which The Assessment Is Being Assessed; To Revise The Distribution Methodology For Disproportionate Share Hospital Payments And Upper Payment Limits Payments To Hospitals; And For Related Purposes.

899.title: Retail food establishment sanitation regulations; revise term "potentially hazardous food" to term used in FDA Food Code.
899.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Term "potentially Hazardous Food" To "time/temperature Control For Safety (tcs) Food" In The Powers Of The Commissioner Of Agriculture To Adopt Regulations Establishing Sanitation Requirements For Retail Food Establishments, To Update The Term As Used In The Current Fda Food Code; To Amend Section 75-29-951, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

900.title: Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Programs (SNAP); impose certain restrictions on DHS in administering.
900.description: An Act To Impose Certain Restrictions On The Department Of Human Services In Administering The Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (snap) In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

901.title: DHS; seek federal waivers to limit SNAP benefit purchases of low nutrition food and beverages.
901.description: An Act To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Human Services To Seek Federal Waivers Necessary To Allow The Department To Encourage A Healthy Diet For Recipients Of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (snap) Benefits By Limiting The Purchase Of Foods And Beverages That Are Low In Nutrients And Foods That Contribute To Diseases Such As Heart Disease And Diabetes; To Direct The Department To Seek Federal Waivers Necessary To Allow The Department To Establish A Pilot Program To Provide Incentives To Persons Who Are Recipients Of Benefits Or Services From The Department To Earn Their High School Equivalency Credential By Taking And Passing Ged Tests; To Direct The Department To Prepare A Video In An Appropriate Medium For Presentation In The Main Or Local Offices In Which Tanf And Snap Benefits Are Provided By The Department That Provides Information About Proper Nutrition, Healthy Eating Habits, And Preventing And Reducing Obesity; To Provide That Applicants For And Recipients Of Tanf And Snap Benefits May View The Video In The Main Or Local Office Of The Department; To Direct The State Department Of Health To Operate The Special Supplemental Nutrition Program For Women, Infants, And Children (wic) On An Electronic Benefits Transfer Basis From And After January 1, 2016; And For Related Purposes.

902.title: Ambulances; authorize to pick up patients at their request regardless of territorial boundaries of ambulance.
902.description: An Act To Authorize Licensed Ambulance Services That Receive Any Public Funding To Pick Up And Transport A Patient At The Patient's Request, Regardless Of Whether The Patient Is Located Outside Of The Territorial Boundaries Of The Ambulance Service; To Provide That The Ambulance Service Shall Be Eligible To Receive Any Third-party Reimbursement That It Would Otherwise Be Eligible To Receive If The Patient Had Been Located Within The Territorial Boundaries Of The Ambulance Service; And For Related Purposes.

903.title: CON; exempt relocation of certain nursing facilities within same long-term planning district from.
903.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Relocation Of Certain Existing Nursing Home Facilities To A New Facility Located Within The Same Long-term Care Planning District Without The Requirement Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need; And For Related Purposes.

904.title: Municipal Water, Sewer and Wastewater Systems Repair and Replacement Grant Program; create.
904.description: An Act To Establish A Municipal Water, Sewer And Wastewater Systems Repair And Replacement Grant Program To Be Administered By The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Assisting Municipalities With The Costs Of Repairing And Replacing Damaged, Outdated Or Inefficient Water And Sewer System Lines And Wastewater Treatment Facilities; To Provide That In Order For A Municipality To Be Eligible For A Grant Under The Provisions Of This Act, The Municipality Must Present To The State Department Of Health A Plan For Repairing And Replacing Water Or Sewer System Lines Or Wastewater Treatment Facilities In The Municipality, And Must Agree To Provide Matching Funds Equal To Ten Percent Of The Amount Of The Grant; To Create In The State Treasury A Special Fund To Be Known As The Municipal Water, Sewer And Wastewater Systems Repair And Replacement Grant Program Fund; To Provide That The Fund Will Consist Of Monies Appropriated By The Legislature For Funding The Program, And Any Other Monies That The Legislature May Designate For Deposit Into The Fund; To Provide That Monies In The Fund May Be Expended Upon Legislative Appropriation For Making Grants To Municipalities For The Purposes Specified In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

905.title: Regimented Inmate Discipline programs (RID); repeal.
905.description: An Act To Repeal The Authority Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Operate Regimented Inmate Discipline Programs And To Prohibit The Future Sentencing Of State Inmates To Such Programs; To Amend Section 47-5-110, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department To Implement Evidence-based Programs For The Benefit Of Inmates, Emphasizing Those Programs That Are Targeted To Reducing Recidivism; To Amend Sections 47-5-124, 47-5-940, 47-5-1205 And 99-15-26 In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

906.title: Mississippi Entertainment Investment Act; create.
906.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Entertainment Industry Investment Act; To Provide An Incentive For Sound Recording Production Companies That Produce Sound Recording Projects In This State; To Provide That A Sound Recording Production Company Shall Be Eligible For A Rebate Of A Percentage Of Certain Expenditures Made In Connection With A State-certified Sound Recording Production Project; To Provide An Incentive For Companies That Produce Musical And Theatrical Projects In This State; To Provide That A Company Shall Be Eligible For A Rebate Of A Percentage Of Expenditures Made In Connection With A State-certified Musical Or Theatrical Production Project; To Provide That The Rebate Programs Created In This Act Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of The Rebate Programs Created In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

907.title: Lodging; define for purposes of regulation by State Board of Health and for sales tax.
907.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-49-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "lodging" And To Delete The Term "hotel" For Purposes Of The Law Providing For Certain Regulation Of Hotels And Innkeepers By The State Board Of Health; To Bring Forward Sections 41-49-5, 41-49-7 And 41-49-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Law Providing For Certain Regulation Of Hotels And Innkeepers By The State Board Of Health, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 27-65-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides The Sales Tax Rate For Miscellaneous Business Activities, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

908.title: Public utilities; remove requirement that shall pay municipalities fee from gross revenue.
908.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Public Utilities Pay A Percentage Of Their Revenues To A Municipality That Is Within The Public Utility's Geographical Area; And For Related Purposes.

909.title: Infant Mortality Reduction Collaborative; create.
909.description: An Act To Create The Infant Mortality Reduction Collaborative And Provide For Its Membership; To Provide That The Collaborative Shall Be Assigned To The State Department Of Health For Administrative Purposes; To Provide That The Collaborative Shall Annually Make Policy Recommendations To The Legislature And Recommendations For Regulatory Changes To State Agencies On The Following Matters: Insuring The Availability, Accessibility And Affordability Of A Hormonal Supplement That Is Used To Prevent Preterm Deliveries In Pregnant Women, Insuring Access To Preconception Health Care, Reducing The Number Of Early Elective Deliveries, And The Development Of Perinatal Regions Of Care; And For Related Purposes.

910.title: Employment Security Law; create the Mississippi Works Fund to provide strategic workforce training needs.
910.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Mississippi Works Fund In The Mississippi Employment Security Law; To Provide That Contributions To Such Fund Shall Be Made In Calendar Years 2015 And 2016 And To Provide The Amount Of Contributions And The Payment Of Contributions To Such Fund; To Establish The Contribution Rate For Calendar Years 2015 And 2016; To Provide That Mississippi Works Funds Shall Be Transferred To A Treasury Fund For The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security; To Provide That All Funds Deposited Into The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security Treasury Fund From The Mississippi Works Contributions Shall Be Allocated Exclusively By The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security To Make Strategic And Targeted Investments In The Mississippi Workforce To Encourage The Growth Of Better Paying, Higher Skilled In-demand Jobs, With A Focus On High Growth Industries, Supplying Training Funds To Meet Immediate Training Needs; To Amend Section 71-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Experience Rate For Rate Years 2015 And 2016 Shall Be Zero; To Provide For An Increase In The General Experience Rate In 2015 And 2016 Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 71-5-453, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The State Workforce Investment Board; And For Related Purposes.

911.title: Municipal and county fire protection funds; increase annual amount paid to.
911.description: An Act To Amend Sections 83-1-37 And Section 83-1-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Amount Paid To The Municipal And County Fire Protection Funds; To Create Within The Fire Protection Fund A Separate Fund To Be Used For Training Personnel In Building Code Adoption And Compliance, And To Specify A Grant Process For The Distribution Of Such Monies; And For Related Purposes.

912.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Risk Pool; revise eligibility for coverage/clarify when association may close enrollment.
912.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-9-209, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility For Coverage Provided Under The Comprehensive Health Insurance Risk Pool Association Act; To Amend Section 83-9-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Association May Under Certain Circumstances And Upon Determination By The Board Close Enrollment In The Coverage Provided By The Plan; To Amend Section 83-9-221, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Coverage Offered By The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

913.title: Homeowners insurance companies; require to write policies on FORTIFIED homes certified by IBHS.
913.description: An Act To Provide That Any Insurance Company That Writes Policies Of Property And Casualty Insurance In The State Of Mississippi Must Write Policies On Homes With A Fortified Home Designation By The Institute For Business And Home Safety; And For Related Purposes.

914.title: Legislature's bill status website; authorize members to have website links to info about their introduced bills placed on.
914.description: An Act To Create New Section 5-1-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Members Of The Legislature To Have One Or More Links To Websites That Contain Information Related To Bills That They Have Introduced Placed On The Mississippi Legislature's Bill Status Website; To Provide That The Legislative Peer Committee Staff Shall Categorize The Information On The Websites To Which The Links Refer As "evidence Based," "research Based" "promising Practice," Or, In The Case Of Program Proposals That Are Not Intervention Programs, As To Standing As A "best Practice," And The Legislature's Information Technology Staff Shall Place The Links And The Categorization Of The Information On The Legislature's Bill Status Website; And For Related Purposes.

915.title: Newborn screening program; expand conditions included in.
915.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Conditions Included In The Comprehensive Newborn Screening Program; To Bring Forward Section 41-21-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

916.title: Prison Industries Corp.; may only sell its goods and services to the Dept. of Corrections.
916.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Legislative Findings Pertaining To The Mississippi Prison Industries Act Of 1990; To Amend Section 47-5-549, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation Shall Only Sell Its Goods And Services To The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; To Amend Section 47-5-555, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Inmate That Is Utilized By The Corporation Must Be Within Five Years Of His Or Her Release Date And That Such Inmate May Not Be Utilized By The Corporation For More Than Five Years; And For Related Purposes.

917.title: Minimum wage; authorize a statewide ballot initiative to determine state increase.
917.description: An Act To Provide For A Statewide Special Election For The Purpose Of Determining Whether Mississippi Will Have A State Minimum Wage; To Provide That The Special Election To Vote On This Issue Shall Be Held On The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November, 2015, And Conducted In The Same Manner As Regular General Elections Are Held; To Require The Secretary Of State To Provide Such Ballots To The Election Commissioners Of Each County; To Require That Any Political Committee Making Certain Contributions Or Expenditures In Support Or Opposition Must File Certain Reports Disclosing Those Contributions And Expenditures; To Amend Sections 23-15-351, 23-15-355, And 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; And For Related Purposes.

918.title: Candidate qualifying deadline; revise when such occurs on Saturday, Sunday or a legal holiday.
918.description: An Act To Amend Sections 23-15-299, 23-15-359, 23-15-853, 41-13-29 And 12-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Qualifying Deadline For An Elective Office Shall Be By 5:00 P.m. On The Last Business Day Immediately Preceding The Qualifying Deadline Date For The Office, If The Qualifying Deadline For An Elective Office Occurs On A Saturday, Sunday Or Legal Holiday; And For Related Purposes.

919.title: General election; change day to Saturday for state, county, municipal and certain school board officers.
919.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-193, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For Elected State, District And County Officials To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November; To Amend Section 9-9-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For County Judges To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November; To Amend Section 19-31-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For Members Of The Board Of Directors For A Public Improvement District To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November; To Amend Section 21-8-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For Mayors And Council Members For A Municipality Operating Under A Mayor-council Form Of Government To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November; To Amend Section 23-15-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Municipal Primaries To The First Saturday In May; To Amend Section 23-15-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of A General Municipal Election To The First Saturday After The First Monday In June; To Amend Section 23-15-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of The First Primaries To The First Saturday After The First Monday In August; To Amend Sections 23-15-637 And 23-15-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Time For Casting An Absentee Ballot To The Preceding Sections; To Amend Section 23-15-833, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of The Regular Special Election To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November Of Each Year; To Amend Section 23-15-1031, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of The First Primary Election For Congressmen To The First Saturday In June Of The Years In Which Congressmen Are Elected; To Amend Section 37-5-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For County Boards Of Education To The First Saturday After The First Monday In May; To Amend Section 37-7-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For School Board Trustees To The First Saturday After The First Monday In May; To Amend Sections 37-7-215, 37-7-223 And 37-7-227, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For School Board Trustees To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November; To Amend Section 65-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Day Of Election For Members Of The State Highway Commission To The First Saturday After The First Monday In May; To Bring Forward Section 9-4-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

920.title: Election commissioners; revise provisions regarding.
920.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions Of Law Regulating Election Commissioners; And For Related Purposes.

921.title: Election; require Secretary of State to authorize early voting for overseas military.
921.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-169.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Secretary Of State To Create Rules And Regulations That Allow Uniformed Services Voters To Vote Early For Elections, Special Elections And Run-offs; To Bring Forward Sections 23-15-677, 23-15-693 And 23-15-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Election Procedures For Uniformed Services And Overseas Voters; And For Related Purposes.

922.title: Elections; allow certain counties to opt out of printing requirements.
922.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-513, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Certain Counties To Opt Out The Provisions Regulating The Printing Of Paper Ballots; And For Related Purposes.

923.title: Resolution board; revise training requirements of members.
923.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-523, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Training Required By Resolution Board Members; And For Related Purposes.

924.title: Elections; require use of certain equipment to seal ballot boxes.
924.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-595, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Ballot Boxes Used In Political Elections Shall Have A Lock With A Metal Or Plastic Seal Engraved Or Permanently Stamped With A Unique Numeric Identifier; And For Related Purposes.

925.title: Polling places; prohibit use of cell phones in.
925.description: An Act To Prohibit Use Of Cell Phones In Polling Places During The Times That The Polls Are Open For Purposes Of Voting; And For Related Purposes.

926.title: Counties; authorize to pay poll workers mileage.
926.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-227, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Mileage Reimbursement For Any Manager, Clerk Or Other Person Who Was Present At The Voting Precinct And Is Required To Return To The Registrar's Office After The Polls Close On The Day Of The Election; And For Related Purposes.

927.title: Runoff elections; clarify when ballots should be printed.
927.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify When Ballots For Runoff Elections Are Required To Be Printed By Election Commissioners For A Runoff Election For A County Office; To Bring Forward Section 23-15-603, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Certification Of Votes Cast At An Election; And For Related Purposes.

928.title: Municipal annexation; require an election be held in the proposed annexed territory.
928.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That An Election Be Held In Any Part Of A County Which Is The Subject Of An Annexation Or Removal Ordinance; To Repeal Section 21-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires An Enlargement Or Contraction Petition To Be Filed In Chancery Court; To Amend Section 21-1-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Municipal Authorities To Pay Attorney's Fees And All Costs Of Court When Appealing The Election Results; To Amend Section 21-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Chancellor May Consider Election Results As Evidence; To Amend Sections 21-1-35 And 21-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

929.title: Voter rolls; clarify registrars and election commissioners respective duties to furnish and purge.
929.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise How The Commissioners Of Election Are Required To Purge The Voter Rolls; To Amend Section 23-15-161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Information Furnished By Registrars To Commissioners Of Election; And For Related Purposes.

930.title: Affidavit ballots; clarify procedures for accepting and handling.
930.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-573, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Affidavit Ballot Procedures; And For Related Purposes.

931.title: Voter Registration; require registrar to mail card to the address on the voter's application.
931.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Registrars To Mail A Voter Registration Card To The Mailing Address Provided On An Applicant's Voter Registration Form; And For Related Purposes.

932.title: Presidential preference primary; change date to the first Tuesday in March.
932.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-1081, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Presidential Preference Primary Shall Be Held On The First Tuesday In March; To Amend Sections 23-15-1083 And 23-15-1055, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

934.title: Open primaries; authorize statewide.
934.description: An Act To Abolish Partisan Primaries; To Provide The Time For Holding General And Preferential Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That A Preferential Election Shall Be Held Three Weeks Before The General Election And The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office Shall Have His Name And His Name Only Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, That The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Have Their Names Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Provide The Procedure To Follow In Case Of Ties; To Provide The Manner For Qualifying As A Candidate For Public Office; To Provide For The Printing Of Necessary Ballots; To Amend Sections 21-7-7, 21-8-7, 21-15-1, 23-15-21, 23-15-31, 23-15-129, 23-15-153, 23-15-173, 23-15-197, 23-15-313, 23-15-367, 23-15-375, 23-15-403, 23-15-411, 23-15-463, 23-15-465, 23-15-507, 23-15-511, 23-15-559, 23-15-561, 23-15-573, 23-15-593, 23-15-595, 23-15-601, 23-15-605, 23-15-673, 23-15-713, 23-15-755, 23-15-771, 23-15-801, 23-15-807, 23-15-811, 23-15-833, 23-15-859, 23-15-873, 23-15-881, 23-15-885, 23-15-891, 23-15-899, 23-15-911, 23-15-973, 23-15-1065, 23-15-1085 And 23-15-1087, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 23-15-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Preparation, Use And Revision Of Primary Election Pollbooks; To Repeal Section 23-15-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Dates Of Municipal Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of State, District And County Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-263, 23-15-265, 23-15-267, 23-15-291 Through 23-15-311, 23-15-317, 23-15-319, 23-15-331, 23-15-333 And 23-15-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Duties Of The State Executive Committee And County Executive Committees In Primary Elections, Provide For The Qualification Of Candidates For Party Primary Elections, And Provide For The Conduct Of Party Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-359, 23-15-361 And 23-15-363, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Contents Of General Election Ballots; To Repeal Sections 23-15-597 And 23-15-599, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Canvass Of Returns And Announcement Of Vote By The County Executive Committees In Primary Elections And Require The State Executive Committee To Transmit To The Secretary Of State A Tabulated Statement Of The Party Vote For Certain Offices; To Repeal Section 23-15-841, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Primary Elections For Nomination Of Candidates To Fill Vacancies In County And County District Offices; To Repeal Sections 23-15-921 Through 23-15-941, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Procedures For Contests Of Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1031, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of Primary Elections For Congressmen And United States Senators; To Repeal Section 23-15-1063, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Unregistered Political Parties From Conducting Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1083, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That Certain Congressional Primaries Be Held On The Same Day As The Presidential Preference Primary; And For Related Purposes.

935.title: Justice court judges; include in "Nonpartisan Judicial Election Act."
935.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-975, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Justice Court Judges Under The "nonpartisan Judicial Election Act"; To Amend Section 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; To Amend Section 23-15-297, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Justice Court Judges From Party Nominations; And For Related Purposes.

936.title: State of Mississippi Congressional and Legislative Redistricting Act; create.
936.description: An Act To Create The State Of Mississippi Congressional And Legislative Redistricting Act; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Require Certain Preparations For Redistricting; To Provide For A Certain Timetable For Preparation Of Redistricting Plan; To Require Certain Redistricting Standards; To Create The Temporary Redistricting Advisory Commission; To Provide For Certain Duties Of The Temporary Redistricting Advisory Commission; To Repeal Sections 5-3-91 Through 5-3-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

937.title: Municipal separate school districts; elect all trustees for 4-year terms at general municipal election in certain districts.
937.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Election Of All Members Of The Board Of Trustees Of Certain Municipal Separate School Districts At The Same Time The General Municipal Election Is Held And To Establish A Term Of Four Years For Such Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

938.title: Elections commissioners; increase per diem.
938.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Commissioners Of Election To Be Paid Per Diem In The Amount Of $100.00 For The Performance Of Their Duties On Nonelection Days; And For Related Purposes.

939.title: Elections; revise training requirements for resolution board members.
939.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-523, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement For Resolution Board Members To Attend Election Manager Training; To Require Resolution Board Members To Complete Training Of Up To Three Hours On Their Duties To Review, Handle And Count Damaged Or Defective Ballots; And For Related Purposes.

940.title: Election commissioners; require county executive committee to offer an annual training course.
940.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-239, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The County Executive Committee And The Commissioners Of Election To Offer An Annual Training Course Of Up To Eight Hours To Managers Of Election; And For Related Purposes.

941.title: Elected officials; require annual report to be filed with Secretary of State on certain gifts received by.
941.description: An Act To Require All Elected Officials To File An Annual Report On Certain Gifts With The Secretary Of State; To Exclude Gifts From Certain Relatives; To Require The Secretary Of State To Prepare And Make Available To Elected Officials A Form For The Gift Report; And For Related Purposes.

942.title: Direct Primary Care Act of 2015; create.
942.description: An Act To Create The Direct Primary Care Act Of 2015; To Provide Definitions; To Provide That A Direct Primary Care Agreement Shall Not Be Considered To Be An Insurance Product Nor Shall The Primary Care Provider Be Considered To Be Engaging In The Business Of Insurance; To Provide That A Primary Care Provider Or Agent Of A Primary Care Provider Is Not Required To Obtain A Certificate Of Authority Or License Under The Act To Market, Sell, Or Offer To Sell A Direct Primary Care Agreement; To Provide The Requirements For Offering A Direct Primary Care Service And Agreement; To Provide Certain Requirements On Primary Care Providers Who Offer Direct Primary Care Services; To Amend Section 83-1-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Act Shall Not Be Subject To The Jurisdiction Of The State Insurance Department; And For Related Purposes.

943.title: Mississippi Rural Veterinarians Scholarship Program; create.
943.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Rural Veterinarians Scholarship Program; To Create The Mississippi Rural Veterinarians Scholarship Commission; To Provide Certain Duties For The Scholarship Commission; To Require Scholarship Recipients To Practice Veterinary Medicine In Rural And Underserved Areas In Mississippi; To Provide For The Repayment Of All Scholarship Monies If The Recipient Does Not Practice In An Underserved Area Within Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

945.title: Public Safety Verification and Enforcement Act; revise.
945.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-16-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Safety Verification And Enforcement Act To Delete Certain Provisions Regarding The Department Of Revenue And Tax Collectors; To Revise The Date By Which The System Shall Be Installed And Operational; To Amend Section 63-16-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Safety Verification And Enforcement Act To Delete Certain Provisions' Application To Owners Of Motor Vehicles; To Amend Section 63-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Safety Verification And Enforcement Act To Delete Certain Provisions Regarding The Department Of Revenue And Tax Collectors; To Repeal Section 63-16-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Every Owner Of A Motor Vehicle To Be In Compliance With Mandatory Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Coverage To Receive Registration Or Renewal Of; To Amend Section 63-16-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Safety Verification And Enforcement Act To Delete Certain Provisions Regarding The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

946.title: Vocational education; provide additional funding to school districts demonstrating needed enhancements for.
946.description: An Act To Establish A Program In The State Department Of Education To Make Funding Available To School Districts For The Purpose Of Enhancing Vocational Education Programs In The Public School System; To Specify Certain Information That Must Be Included In A School District's Application For An Allocation Of Funds Under The Program; To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt Rules And Regulations Governing The Application Process; To Provide That The Establishment Of Such Program Shall Be Subject To Legislative Appropriation; And For Related Purposes.

947.title: Commission on Proprietary Sch. and College Registration; authorize to enter interstate reciprocity agreements for distance education.
947.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-60-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission On Proprietary School And College Registration To Enter Into Interstate Reciprocity Agreements That Allow Registrants To Offer Postsecondary Distance Education From An Approved Location In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

948.title: Licensed school employees; create exceptions to prohibition against using personal leave on certain days.
948.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Exception To The Prohibition Against Licensed Employees Of A School District Using Personal Leave The Day Before Or After A Holiday For Certain Educators Having Long-term Experience; To Authorize A Licensed School Employee To Use Personal Leave On The First And Last Day Of The School Term And The Day Before And After A Holiday If The Employee Is Summoned To Appear For Jury Duty Or As A Witness In Court On Those Days; And For Related Purposes.

949.title: MS Works Scholarship Pilot Program to assist Career and Technical Education (CTE) students at community colleges; create.
949.description: An Act To Establish The 2015 Mississippi Works Scholarship Pilot Program To Assist Career And Technical Education (cte) Students Who Enroll At Mississippi Community Colleges To Complete A Cte Certificate Or Degree; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Administered By The Financial Aid Office Of Ihl; To Prescribe Qualifications For The Program; To Provide That The Program Is Contingent On Appropriated Funds; And For Related Purposes.

950.title: Commission on College Accreditation; authorize to enter into certain interstate reciprocity agreements for distance education.
950.description: An Act To Authorize The Commission On College Accreditation To Administer Interstate Reciprocity Agreements That Will Allow Approved Institutions Of Higher Learning And Registered Proprietary Schools To Offer Postsecondary Distance Education; And For Related Purposes.

951.title: Health plans & policies; prohibit higher copayments for patient-administered anti-cancer medications.
951.description: An Act To Create New Section 83-9-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Health Plans And Policies, Including The State Health Insurance Plan, That Cover Injected, Intravenously Administered And Oral Anti-cancer Medications From Requiring A Higher Co-payment, Deductible Or Coinsurance Amount For Patient-administered Anti-cancer Medications Than They Require For Anti-cancer Medications Injected Or Intravenously Administered By A Health Care Provider, Regardless Of The Formulation Or Benefit Category Determination; To Provide That Health Plans And Policies May Not Comply With The Prohibition By Increasing The Co-payment, Deductible Or Coinsurance Amount For Injected Or Intravenous Anti-cancer Medications That Are Covered Under The Plan Or Policy Or By Reclassifying Benefits With Respect To Anti-cancer Medications; To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Authorize The State And School Employees Health Insurance Management Board To Accept Bids For The State Health Insurance Plan For Surgical Services That Include A Negotiated Single Case Rate Bundle And Payment For Orthopedic, Spine, Bariatric, Cardiovascular And General Surgeries; And For Related Purposes.

952.title: Health plans and policies; prohibit higher co-payments for patient-administered anti-cancer medications.
952.description: An Act To Create New Section 83-9-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Health Plans And Policies That Cover Injected, Intravenously Administered And Oral Anti-cancer Medications From Requiring A Higher Co-payment, Deductible Or Coinsurance Amount For Patient Administered Anti-cancer Medications Than They Require For Anti-cancer Medications Injected Or Intravenously Administered By A Health Care Provider, Regardless Of The Formulation Or Benefit Category Determination; To Provide That Health Plans And Policies May Not Comply With The Prohibition By Increasing The Co-payment, Deductible Or Coinsurance Amount For Injected Or Intravenous Anti-cancer Medications That Are Covered Under The Plan Or Policy Or By Reclassifying Benefits With Respect To Anti-cancer Medications; And For Related Purposes.

953.title: Constables; authorize to be paid after diligent search and inquiry upon unsuccessful service of process.
953.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Marshals And Constables To Be Paid For Civil Service Of Process After Diligent Search And Inquiry, Regardless Of Whether Service Of Process Is Successful; And For Related Purposes.

954.title: Election commissioner; remove requirement to resign one year before qualifying for other office.
954.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That An Election Commissioner Resign One Year Before Qualifying As A Candidate For Another Office; And For Related Purposes.

955.title: Common Core National Education Standards; require SBE to develop and implement new curriculum and assessment standards.
955.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Adopt And Implement New Mississippi College And Career Readiness Standards For The Public Schools Based On National And International Benchmarks With The Assistance Of The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb); To Provide That The State Board Of Education And The State Department Of Education Shall Take No Further Action To Implement Any Common Core Standards Developed By The Common Core State Standards Initiative; To Direct The State Superintendent Of Public Education To Take Immediate Action To Withdraw From The Partnership For Assessment Of Readiness For College And Careers (parcc); To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Adopt A Research-based Formative Assessment System Aligned With The Mississippi College And Career Readiness Standards And To Publish A List Of Approved Vendors; To Direct The State Board Of Education With The Assistance Of The Sreb To Make Certain Recommendations Regarding The Implementation Of Standardized Testing; To Prohibit The State Board And State Department Of Education From Distributing Certain Student Identifiable Information; To Amend Sections 37-16-7 And 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Discontinue Subject Area Testing Requirements (satp2) And Parcc Student Assessments On A Phased-in Basis; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That The State Department Of Education Combine The State School Accountability System With The Federal System; To Amend Section 37-177-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

956.title: Commission on Future of Medicaid and Health Care in Mississippi; create.
956.description: An Act To Create The Commission On The Future Of Medicaid And Health Care In Mississippi; To Provide For The Membership Of The Commission; To Specify The Medicaid And Other Health Topics And Matters For The Commission To Study And Make Recommendations; To Provide That The Commission Shall Prepare And Submit Its Initial Report With A Detailed Statement Of Findings, Conclusions And Recommendations To The Legislature And The Governor Not Later Than September 1, 2016; To Provide That The Commission Shall Continue In Existence And Shall Prepare And Submit A Follow-up Report Annually Not Later Than September 1 Of The Year; To Repeal Sections 41-95-1 Through 41-95-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Health Policy Act Of 1994; And For Related Purposes.

957.title: The "Municipal and County Street Reconstruction Fund"; create.
957.description: An Act To Create A Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "municipal And County Street Reconstruction Fund"; To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Shall Promulgate Rules And Regulations For Distribution Of Monies Into The Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Consist Of Monies Appropriated By Line Item In The Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation And Monies From Any Other Sources; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Utilized To Provide Certain Grants To Municipalities And Counties That Adopt Ordinances, Policies And Procedures To Construct Or Reconstruct Streets And Transportation Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

958.title: Minors; clarify appointment of guardian ad litem, enact protections for child witnesses.
958.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That When A County Court Is Serving As A Youth Court Then The County Court May Appoint A Suitable Attorney Or Layman As A Guardian Ad Litem; To Create New Section 99-43-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Child Witness Standards Of Protection In Order To Grant Appropriate Accommodations To Children Testifying In Court To Lessen The Effect Of Mental And Emotional Suffering Upon The Child And To Ensure An Environment In The Legal Or Criminal Proceeding That Is Conducive To The Search For The Truth; And For Related Purposes.

959.title: Burial spaces; establish procedure for-profit cemeteries with abandoned spaces to terminate owner's right to spaces.
959.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-43-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Procedure For For-profit Cemeteries With Burial Spaces And Entombment Rights That Have Been Abandoned For A Certain Period Of Time To Terminate The Owner's Rights To The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If A Burial Space Or Entombment Right Issued By A Cemetery Has Remained Unused For A Period Of At Least Ninety-nine Years From The Date Of Sale Or Last Recorded Designation Or Transfer And Has No Improvements On The Burial Space Or Entombment Right, The Current Owner Of The Cemetery May Terminate The Rights And Interests Of The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Desires To Terminate The Rights And Interests Of The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right And Determines That The Required Conditions Have Been Met, The Cemetery Owner Must First Send The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right A Notice Of The Intent To Terminate And Declare Abandoned The Owner's Rights To The Burial Space Or Entombment Right By Certified Mail With Return Receipt Requested; To Provide That A Person Who Has Received A Termination Notice May Inform The Cemetery Owner Of Their Continued Intent To Claim The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Has Been Informed Of That Intent, The Cemetery Owner Shall Not Terminate The Rights And Interests Of The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Has Not Received A Response From The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Within Ninety Days After Sending The Required Notice, The Cemetery Owner Shall Advertise In A Newspaper Of General Circulation In The County Of The Owner's Last Known Address Seeking The Owner's Current Address; To Provide That If The Cemetery Owner Has Not Received A Response Regarding The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Within Ninety Days After Placing The Required Advertisement, The Owner's Rights And Interests In The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Are Terminated, And The Cemetery Owner May Sell The Burial Space Or Entombment Right To A New Owner; To Provide That If The Owner Of A Burial Space Or Entombment Right Contacts The Cemetery Owner After The Rights And Interests In The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Are Terminated, The Owner Of The Burial Space Or Entombment Right Is Entitled To Certain Remedies; To Provide That Persons Who Violate The Provisions Of This Act Are Subject To Certain Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

960.title: Public accountants; require to have certain amount of errors and omissions coverage.
960.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-33-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Every Firm Engaging In The Practice Of Public Accounting In The State Of Mississippi To Carry Errors And Omissions Insurance Coverage In An Amount Of At Least One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000.00) Per Occurrence That Covers Every Person Associated Or Registered With The Firm Engaging In The Practice Of Public Accounting In The State Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 73-33-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Public Accountancy To Adopt Rules And Regulations Requiring Proof Of Such Errors And Omissions Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

961.title: Children's Justice Center; change the name to Children's Safe Center.
961.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-115-43, 41-111-1 And 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Name Of The Children's Justice Center To Children's Safe Center; And For Related Purposes.

962.title: Toll roads and bridges; increase maximum maturity of bonds for from 30 years to 40 years.
962.description: An Act To Amend Sections 65-43-7 And 65-43-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Number Of Years That Bonds Issued To Build Toll Roads And Toll Bridges May Mature From 30 Years To 40 Years; And For Related Purposes.

963.title: Highways; provide any removed from State Highway System are immediately in State Aid Program.
963.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-9-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Aid Engineer To Immediately Place All Roads That Are Removed From The State Highway System Into The State Aid Road Program; To Amend Section 65-1-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

964.title: Coroners/county medical examiners; establish reused salary scale for based on county population.
964.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe For The Revised Salary Scale Increase That Shall Be Provided To Chief County Medical Examiner Or Chief County Medical Examiner Investigator Based On The Population Of The County Of Service Based On The Most Recent Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

965.title: Counties; clarify authority to collect fees for rubbish and garbage disposal.
965.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The County Has The Authority To Collect Fees To Contract With A Collection Agency For Disposal And Collection Of Garbage, Rubbish And Solid Waste; And For Related Purposes.

966.title: County budget expenses; require state to fully fund state services being subsidized by counties.
966.description: An Act To Require The Legislature To Appropriate Sufficient Funds Each Year To Fully Fund The District Attorneys' Offices And Staff, The Circuit Court Reporters, The Circuit Court Administrators, The Chancery Court Reporters, The Chancery Court Administrators, The Juvenile Drug Courts, The County Offices Of The State Department Of Health And The Department Of Human Services, And The Costs Of Audit Services, So That The State Of Mississippi Is Fully Funding The Expenses Of The State Services Provided By Those Entities And The Counties Are Not Having To Subsidize The Expenses Of Those State Services; To Amend Section 9-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Bring Forward Section 9-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 9-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Bring Forward Sections 9-13-21 And 9-13-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Sections 7-7-211 And 7-7-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Require The Legislature To Appropriate Sufficient Funds Each Year To Support The Capital Defense Counsel Division Of The Office Of State Public Defender And The Office Of Post-conviction Counsel So That The Attorneys And Staff Have The Necessary Resources To Represent Or Pay For The Cost Of All Post-capital Conviction Appeals And The Counties Will Not Be Burdened With Expenses Related To Indigent Capital Defense; To Amend Sections 99-15-18 And 99-39-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

967.title: Counties; authorize to repair private driveways that are damaged during replacement of culverts.
967.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-92.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors Of Any County To Incur Costs And Pay Necessary Expenses For The Repair Of A Private Driveway Due To It Being Damaged During The Replacement Of A Culvert; And For Related Purposes.

968.title: Proclamation of a local emergency; allow boards of supervisors to authorize certain county officials to declare.
968.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Certain County Official, Who Is Authorized By The Board Of Supervisors, To Proclaim A Local Emergency With Ratification Of Such Proclamation By The Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

969.title: County vehicles and road equipment; authorize boards of supervisors to allow use between county departments.
969.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors To Allow The Use Of County Vehicles And Road Equipment Between The Various Departments Of The County In The Performance Of Such Offices' Duties And Responsibilities Without The Necessity Of Reimbursement; To Authorize The Transfer Of County Vehicles Or Road Equipment Between Various Departments Of The County For A Nominal Fee Or Without The Necessity Of Reimbursement As Determined By The Board To Be In The Best Interest Of The County's Taxpayers; To Require The Board To Spread Upon Its Minutes Any Decision To Permit The Use Or Transfer Of Vehicles Or Road Equipment In The County's Fleet Of Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

970.title: Governing authorities of counties and cities; authorize to adopt rules that provide authority to prepay certain expenses.
970.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Counties And Municipalities To Adopt Rules And Regulations For Offices, Departments, Agencies, Divisions Or Boards, Under Their Governance, For The Waiver Of Certification That Goods Or Services Have Been Received Or Performed; And For Related Purposes.

971.title: Governing authorities of counties and cities; authorize to recover actual costs of enforcing ordinance, zoning law or regulation.
971.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-1-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Recover Any Actual Costs To The Governing Authority Incurred In Enforcing A Zoning Law, Ordinance Or Regulation And To Recover Any Actual Costs Incurred In Bringing A Violator In Compliance With A Court Order, If Such Violator Fails Or Refuses Attorney's Fees And Costs Of Litigation; And For Related Purposes.

972.title: Municipal Workforce Development Fund; create.
972.description: An Act To Create A Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "municipal Workforce Fund"; To Provide That The Department Of Employment Security Shall Promulgate Regulations For The Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Consist Of Monies Appropriated By The Legislature And Other Sources; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Utilized To Provide Certain Grants To Municipalities That Implement Programs That Create Opportunities For Employment; And For Related Purposes.

973.title: Interlocal agreements; authorize state to enter in with cities for certain reimbursement purposes.
973.description: An Act To Authorize The State Of Mississippi To Enter Into Interlocal Agreements With The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality In Order To Create A Vehicle For Providing Certain Reimbursement For Police And Fire Protection Services That Are Offered On State Properties Or At State Events; And For Related Purposes.

974.title: Municipal Fire Truck and Police Vehicle Acquisition Assistance Program; establish.
974.description: An Act To Establish The Municipal Fire Truck And Police Vehicle Acquisition Assistance Program; To Create A Special Fund To Be Designated As The Municipal Fire Truck And Police Vehicle Assistance Program Fund; To Provide Certain Appropriation For Such Fund; To Provide That A Certain Committee Shall Accept Applications From Governing Authorities Of Municipalities Which Apply For Funds To Obtain A New Fire Tuck Or Police Vehicle; To Require The Department Of Insurance To Maintain An Accurate Record Of All Monies Distributed Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

975.title: Local Municipal Youth Programs Fund; create.
975.description: An Act To Create A Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "local Municipal Youth Programs Fund"; To Provide That The Department Of Public Safety Shall Promulgate Regulations For The Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Consist Of Monies Appropriated By The Legislature And Other Sources; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Utilized To Provide Certain Grants To Municipalities That Implement Programs Or Award Grants To Programs That Provide Prevention And Intervention Services For At-risk Youth And Their Families; And For Related Purposes.

976.title: Municipalities; authorize to regulate and prohibit placement and continued use of private water wells within municipal utility service area.
976.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Any Municipality That Has A Municipally Owned Waterworks, The Governing Authorities Of Municipality Or The Municipal Public Utility Commission Is Authorized To Regulate And Prohibit The Placement And Continued Use Of Private Water Wells Within The Boundaries Of The Municipal Utility Service Area; And For Related Purposes.

977.title: County and Municipal Fire and Emergency Management Safety Fund; create.
977.description: An Act To Create A Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "county And Municipal Fire And Emergency Management Safety Fund"; To Provide That The Department Of Insurance Shall Promulgate Regulations For The Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Consist Of Monies Appropriated By The Legislature And Other Sources; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Utilized To Provide Certain Grants To Counties And Municipalities That Implement Emergency Response And Fire Safety Programs Within Their Communities; And For Related Purposes.

978.title: Interlocal agreements; authorize state to enter into with cities for reimbursement of protection offered at state events/properties.
978.description: An Act To Authorize The State Of Mississippi To Enter Into Interlocal Agreements With The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality In Order To Create A Vehicle For Providing Certain Reimbursement For Police And Fire Protection Services That Are Offered On State Properties Or At State Events; And For Related Purposes.

979.title: Cities and counties; establish procedure for collection of certain debts through setoff against debtor's MS income tax refund.
979.description: An Act To Establish A Procedure By Which A Municipality Or County That Has Money Owed To It As A Result Of An Administrative Or Judicial Proceeding May Collect The Debt Through Setoff Against The Debtor's Mississippi Income Tax Refund; And For Related Purposes.

980.title: Mississippi Municipal Poverty Task Force; create.
980.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Municipal Poverty Task Force; To Provide That The Task Force Shall Study The Rate And Levels Of Poverty In Municipalities Within This State That Have Persistent Poverty Levels Of Twenty Percent Or Greater; To Provide The Composition Of The Task Force; To Require The Task Force To Make Certain Recommendations To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

981.title: Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; repeal, provide for inspection of tinted windshields.
981.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; To Require The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Annually Issue Permits For, And Furnish Instructions And All Necessary Forms To, Official Tint Inspection Stations For The Inspection Of Windshields And Issuance Of Labels As Required By Section 63-7-59; To Provide That A Fee Of $10.00 Shall Be Charged For Such Permits; To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Suspend Or Revoke Permits Issued To A Station That Is Not Properly Equipped Or Conducted; To Amend Sections 63-7-59, 37-41-53 And 63-1-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

982.title: MS Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; use fees from to pay for trooper schools.
982.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-13-11 And 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Motor Vehicle Inspection Fees Shall Be Deposited In The Motor Vehicle Inspections Highway Patrol Training School Fund To Be Administered By The Department Of Public Safety; To Provide That The Fund May Be Used To Conduct A Highway Patrol Training School For New Highway Patrolmen; And For Related Purposes.

983.title: Marc Lee Whatley Memorial Highway; designate a certain segment of highway 15 in Jones County as.
983.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Highway In Jones County, Mississippi, As The "marc Lee Whatley Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

984.title: Motor vehicles; authorize the operation of low-speed electric vehicles on certain public roads.
984.description: An Act To Authorize The Operation Of Certain Low-speed Four-wheeled Electric Vehicles On Public Roads And Streets On Which The Posted Speed Limit Is 35 Miles Per Hour Or Less; To Provide That Such Vehicles May Be Operated On Such Public Roads And Streets Only By The Holder Of A Valid Driver's License; To Authorize Counties, Municipalities And The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Prohibit The Operation Of Such Vehicles Upon Streets Under Their Jurisdiction If Such Prohibition Is In The Interest Of Safety; To Amend Sections 63-1-7, 63-3-103, 27-19-3, 27-19-48, 27-19-56 And 27-51-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

985.title: Additional highways; reconstruct a portion of Highway 315.
985.description: An Act To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Construct, Reconstruct, Straighten And Realign A Certain Segment Of Highway 315 In Panola County, To Designate Such Highway Segment As A Part Of The State Highway System And To Place Such Highway Under The Jurisdiction Of The Transportation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

986.title: Memorial highway; designate certain segment of MS Highway 24 in Amite County as the "Agent Kimbrough "Kim" Sterling Memorial Highway."
986.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Highway In Amite County, Mississippi, As The "agent Kimbrough 'kim' Sterling Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

987.title: Memorial highway; designate certain segment of MS Highway 2 in Alcorn County as "Agent Harold Lane Caldwell Memorial Highway."
987.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Highway 2 In Alcorn County, Mississippi, As The "agent Harold Lane Caldwell Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

988.title: Traffic signal lights; direct MDOT to install and operate at highway intersection in Hinds County.
988.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Have The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Install, Operate, Maintain, Control And Have Full Jurisdiction Over Traffic Signal Lights At The Intersection Of Mississippi Highway 18 And Mississippi Highway 27 In Hinds County; And For Related Purposes.

989.title: U.S. Highway 61; designate as the "Military Order of the Purple Heart Trail".
989.description: An Act To Designate All Of U.s. Highway 61 That Lies In The State Of Mississippi As The "military Order Of The Purple Heart Trail"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 51 In Montgomery County As The "dewey Townsend Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 57 In Jackson County As The "james Donovan Gautier Jr. Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of Highway 27 In Copiah County As The "don Linzy Dixon Gospel Memorial Highway";and For Related Purposes.

990.title: Traffic signal lights; direct MDOT to install and operate at certain intersection in Hinds County.
990.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Have The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Install, Operate, Maintain, Control And Have Full Jurisdiction Over Traffic Signal Lights At The Intersection Of Mississippi Highway 18 And Main Drive In Copiah County; And For Related Purposes.

991.title: Mississippi Highway 42; require MDOT to reconstruct a portion in Forrest and Perry Counties to four lanes.
991.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Construct To Four Lanes For Highway Traffic A Certain Portion Of Mississippi Highway 42 In Forrest And Perry Counties; And For Related Purposes.

992.title: Driver's licenses; authorize designation of certain disabilities on.
992.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Designation Of Certain Disabilities On Driver's Licenses And Identification Cards Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Training For Law Enforcement Officers In Recognizing Certain Mental Or Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

994.title: Culverts; make placement of guide or warning posts on a discretionary function.
994.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-21-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make The Placement Of Guide Or Warning Posts On Culverts A Discretionary Duty Of The Mississippi Transportation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

995.title: Commercial motor vehicle inspection program; create.
995.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Public Safety To Certify Inspection Stations For The Inspection Of Commercial Vehicles; To Require That If The Department Certifies Any Such Stations, It Must Certify At Least One Such Station In Each County; To Authorize The Department To Certify A Vehicle Maintenance Facility Owned And Operated By A Political Subdivision Or Agency Of This State As An Inspection Station; To Specify Which Vehicles This Inspection Program Applies To; To Authorize The Department To Provide Serially Numbered Inspection Certificates And Verification Forms To The Inspection Stations; To Make Certain Requirements Of Inspectors Or Owners Of Inspection Stations; To Set The Application Requirements For An Inspection Station; To Set The Application Requirements For An Inspector; To Set The Fee For Inspections Of A Commercial Motor Vehicle; To Set The Fee For Certification As An Inspector; To Set The Fee For Certification As An Inspection Station; To Make Certain Offenses And Penalties For Such Regarding Inspections; To Set A Fine And State Assessment For Offenses Under The Act; And For Related Purposes.

996.title: Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; repeal and amend statutes to conform.
996.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code 1972, Which Provide For Annual Safety Inspections Of Motor Vehicles And For The Issuance Of Certificates Of Inspection; To Amend Section 63-1-33, Mississippi Code 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

997.title: Railroad authorities; authorize to accept donated property and to oversee excursion lines.
997.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-29-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Railroad Authorities Are Authorized To Accept Donated Property And Oversee Any Property Within Their Possession; And For Related Purposes.

998.title: Fuel taxes; allocate a portion to the City of Jackson to defray costs incurred as a result of being the seat of state government.
998.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From The Proceeds Of Gasoline, Diesel Fuel Or Kerosene Taxes, An Amount Equal To 1% Of The Revenue From Gasoline And Diesel Fuel Taxes On Gasoline, Diesel Fuel And Kerosene Sold Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The City Of Jackson And Paid To The City; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

999.title: Motor vehicle dealers; provide for certain application requirements, and allow wholesalers to purchase tags and be designated agents.
999.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-21-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Wholesale Motor Vehicle Dealers To Be Designated Agents, Of The Department Of Revenue For Purposes Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle And Manufactured Housing Title Law; To Amend Section 27-19-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Wholesale Motor Vehicle Dealers To Purchase And Use Distinguishing Tags; To Amend Section 63-17-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Used And Wholesale Motor Vehicle Dealers To Submit A Bond With License Application, And To Require New, Used And Wholesale Motor Vehicle Dealers To Purchase Blanket Liability Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

1000.title: Memorial highway; designate segment of U.S. Highway 42 in Forrest County as the "Sheriff Eugene Lamar 'Gene' Walters Memorial Highway."
1000.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 42 In Forrest County As The "sheriff Eugene Lamar 'gene' Walters Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

1001.title: Memorial highway; designate certain segment of MS Highway 371 in Prentiss County as the "James 'Jimmy' C. Pharr Memorial Highway."
1001.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 371 In Prentiss County As The "james 'jimmy' C. Pharr Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

1002.title: Memorial bridge; designate certain in Marshall County as the "Charles Foster Memorial Bridge."
1002.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Bridge On Highway 309 In Marshall County As The "charles Foster Memorial Bridge"; And For Related Purposes.

1003.title: Mississippi Highway 24; require MDOT to reconstruct a portion in Pike and Amite Counties to four lanes.
1003.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Construct To Four Lanes For Highway Traffic A Certain Portion Of Mississippi Highway 24 In Pike And Amite Counties; And For Related Purposes.

1004.title: Handicapped parking; delete requirement for physician's certification annually upon renewing special tag.
1004.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Disabled Person To Whom A Special Motor Vehicle License Plate Is Issued For The Purpose Of Allowing Such Person Special Parking Privileges May Retain The Special License Plate And Renew It Annually Without Being Required To Submit An Additional Certification Of A Physician That The Applicant Meets The Definition Of Persons With Disabilities; And For Related Purposes.

1005.title: Chickasa-Leaf Barn Quilt Trail; authorize the Transportation Commission to allow for markers designating.
1005.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Allow For The Construction Of Certain Markers Designating The Chickasa-leaf Barn Quilt Trail; To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Allow For The Construction Of Certain Markers Recognizing The Military Order Of The Purple Heart At The Entrances Of State Highways In The Counties Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1006.title: Traffic signal lights; direct MDOT to install and operate at highway in DeSoto County.
1006.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Have The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Install, Operate, Maintain, Control And Have Full Jurisdiction Over Traffic Signal Lights At The Intersection Of Mississippi Highway 305 And Bethel Road In Desoto County; And For Related Purposes.

1007.title: MDOT; require legislature to fund in an amount that would match 20% of federal funds for highway projects.
1007.description: An Act To Require The Legislature To Fund Mississippi Department Of Transportation In An Amount At Least Equal To The Funding Required To Match Twenty Percent Of Federal Funds For Road And Highway Projects; And For Related Purposes.

1008.title: Motor vehicle; increase inspection fee for.
1008.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-13-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Inspection Fee For Motor Vehicles Registered In This State; And For Related Purposes.

1009.title: Window tint law; authorize sheriffs and deputy sheriffs to enforce.
1009.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Sheriffs And Deputy Sheriffs To Enforce Window Tint Law; And For Related Purposes.

1010.title: Chief William "Bill" Lott Memorial Highway; designate segment of Highway 49 in Sunflower County as.
1010.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 49 West In Sunflower County, Mississippi, As The "chief William 'bill' Lott Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

1011.title: Memorial highway; bring forward section designating certain segment of Interstate Highway 59 for purpose of possible amendment.
1011.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 65-3-71.204, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Designates A Certain Segment Of Interstate Highway 59 In Jones County, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1012.title: Scenic byway; designate certain segment in Union and Lafayette Counties as "William Faulkner Scenic Byway."
1012.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Road In Union And Lafayette Counties As An Official Scenic Byway To Be Known As The "william Faulkner Scenic Byway"; To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Allow For The Construction Of Certain Markers Designating The Chickasa-leaf Barn Quilt Trail; To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Allow For The Construction Of Certain Markers Recognizing The Military Order Of The Purple Heart At The Entrances Of State Highways In The Counties Of Mississippi; To Amend Section 65-41-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Certain Segments Of Road In Desoto County As Part Of The Delta Bluffs Scenic Byway; And For Related Purposes.

1013.title: LSBP and State Aid Roads; revise allocation of monies to.
1013.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Counties That Have Replaced Their Structurally Deficient Bridges To Use Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program Funds To Match Federal Funds On The State Aid System And To Revise The Distribution Of Monies Forfeited By Counties For Not Spending Their Lsbp Funds; To Amend Section 65-9-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Federal Funds For The State Aid System Be Allocated In Accordance With The State Aid System Formula; And For Related Purposes.

1014.title: Transportation; transfer law enforcement duties of MDOT to the Department of Public Safety.
1014.description: An Act To Transfer Law Enforcement Personnel And Law Enforcement Duties Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Related To The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law To The Motor Carrier Division Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Within The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety; To Amend Sections 77-7-16 And 45-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 25-13-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Transferred Personnel From The Highway Safety Patrol Retirement System; To Repeal Section 77-1-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Employment Of Personnel By The Public Service Commission To Enforce The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law; To Repeal Section 77-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Transfer Of Law Enforcement Personnel Of Motor Carrier Regulatory Law To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation From The Public Service Commission; To Repeal Section 77-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Public Service Commission To Provide For The Payment Of Employees Enforcing The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law; And For Related Purposes.

1015.title: Highways; add segments of certain roads within the corporate limits of the City of Jackson to the state highway system.
1015.description: An Act To Add U.s. Highway 49 Within The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Jackson To The State Highway System; And For Related Purposes.
