1246.description: An Act To Require The Attorney General To Create A Standard Petition For Dismissal Form That Is To Be Used By Any Person Who Desires To Have A Conviction Expunged; To Provide The Procedure For Review Of Such Petition By A Judge In The Appropriate Court; To Bring Forward Sections 99-19-71, 99-15-59, 99-15-123, 99-15-57 And 21-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Expungement, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Fee Related To Petitions For Expungement; And For Related Purposes.

1247.title: Court education and training cost; increase amount and provide funds for Public Defenders Education Fund.
1247.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-26-1, 37-26-3 And 37-26-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of The Court Education And Training Cost That Is Charged In Civil Cases In The Chancery, Circuit, County, Justice And Municipal Courts Of This State; To Provide That Twenty-five Percent Of The Funds Collected From Such Costs Shall Be Deposited Into The Public Defenders Education Fund And To Revise The Percentage Of Such Funds That Are Deposited Into The State Court Education Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1248.title: Easement; may not be extinguished if granted over railroad crossing at specific location even when ownership changes.
1248.description: An Act To Provide That A Permissive Easement Over A Railroad Crossing At A Specific Location May Not Be Extinguished And Shall Continue To Be Effective At That Location; To Provide That The Easement Shall Continue To Be Valid Notwithstanding Any Changes In Ownership Of The Crossing; And For Related Purposes.

1249.title: Automobiles; provide relief to purchaser from payments after repossession of.
1249.description: An Act To Relieve The Purchaser Of An Automobile From Financial Obligation On The Automobile If The Purchaser Can No Longer Afford To Make Payments; To Require The Purchaser To Contact The Seller Or Financing Company To Make Arrangements To Have The Automobile Returned; To Cease Future Financial Obligation Of The Purchaser At The Time Contact Is Made With The Seller Or Finance Company To Retake Possession Of The Automobile; To Stipulate The Conditions Upon Which The Purchaser Must Make Payments On The Repossessed Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1250.title: Motor scooters; provide for operation of without motorcycle endorsement under certain circumstances.
1250.description: An Act To Allow Motor Scooters To Be Operated On Public Roads Located In Or Near A University Without Obtaining A Motorcycle Endorsement For A Rental Period Of Forty-eight Hours; To Provide Certain Requirements For The Operation Of Motor Scooters Without A Motorcycle Endorsement; To Provide That Municipalities And Universities May Prohibit Operation Of Scooters On Certain Roads If In The Interest Of Public Safety; To Amend Section 63-3-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For A Definition Of Motor Scooter And To Conform To House Bill 111, 2015 Regular Session; To Amend Section 63-1-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform With This Act And House Bill 111, 2015 Regular Session; And For Related Purposes.

1251.title: All-terrain vehicles; require retailers to maintain certain records of.
1251.description: An Act To Require Retailers To Maintain Certain Records On All-terrain And Off-road Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

1252.title: All-terrain vehicles; clarify inclusion in chop shop act to prohibit altering of VIN.
1252.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-25-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That All-terrain Vehicles And Off-road Vehicles Are Motor Vehicles For The Purposes Of The Motor Vehicle Chop Shop, Stolen And Altered Property Act, Which Makes It Illegal To Alter A Vehicle Identification Number; And For Related Purposes.

1253.title: Over dimensional loads; authorize MHSP and MDOT to enter into a MOU for the purposes of escorting.
1253.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Transportation And The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol To Enter Into A Memorandum Of Understanding For The Purpose Of Providing Resources To Escort Over Dimensional Loads On Highways; And For Related Purposes.

1254.title: Escorts; super over dimensional loads; authorize MDOT and MHSP to enter into MOU for purpose of.
1254.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Transportation And The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol To Enter Into A Memorandum Of Understanding For The Purpose Of Providing Resources To Escort Super Over Dimensional Loads On Highways; And For Related Purposes.

1255.title: Motor Vehicle Warranty Enforcement Act; revise mileage accrual for consumer's reasonable use.
1255.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-17-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner In Which A Consumer's Reasonable Allowance For Use Of The Motor Vehicle Is Calculated; And For Related Purposes.

1256.title: Caffeine pills and powder; prohibit use and sale to juveniles.
1256.description: An Act To Prohibit The Sale Or Transfer Of Certain Caffeine Products To Persons Under 18 Years Of Age; To Provide Definitions; To Provide Regulations For Retail Sales Clerks, Procedures To Notify The Public And Penalties For Violation; To Prohibit Juvenile Possession And Consumption Of Certain Caffeine Products; To Require Point Of Sale Warnings; To Provide Penalties For Juveniles Who Misrepresent Their Age; To Prohibit Sales Of Certain Caffeine Products In Vending Machines; To Prohibit The Distribution Of Certain Caffeine Products Other Than In Sealed Packages; To Prohibit Transfers Of Certain Caffeine Products From Distributors And Wholesalers; To Authorize Unannounced Inspections; To Require Confidentiality Of Juveniles Who Violate This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1257.title: Driver's license; remove requirement that commissioner, assistant commissioner, or authorized deputy sign driver's license.
1257.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That The Commissioner Or Assistant Commissioner Or An Authorized Deputy Sign A Driver's License Before It Will Be Valid; And For Related Purposes.

1258.title: Motor vehicle manufactures; clarify regulations for.
1258.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-17-55 And 63-17-118, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Regulations Regarding Motor Vehicle Manufacturers; And For Related Purposes.

1259.title: Unmanned aircraft system; use of can constitute trespass or invasion of privacy under certain circumstances.
1259.description: An Act To Provide That Causing An Unmanned Aircraft System To Enter The Lands Of Another Without Permission Constitutes A Trespass, And That Reproducing The Image Of Another Using An Unmanned Aircraft System Can Constitute An Invasion Of Privacy; And For Related Purposes.

1260.title: Crimes; create penalties for failing to meet certain requirements designed to protect the public from dangerous dogs.
1260.description: An Act To Create Criminal And Civil Penalties For Failing To Keep Dangerous Dogs Securely Confined And Under Restraint, And For Failing To Meet Certain Requirements Designed To Protect The Public; To Define "dangerous Dog" For Purposes Of This Act; To Provide Exceptions To The Definition Of "dangerous Dog" In Instances Of Willful Trespassing Or Committing A Tort Or Crime On The Premises Of The Dog's Owner, Of Teasing, Tormenting Or Abusing The Dog, Or Of Protecting Or Defending A Person From Unjustified Attack; To Set Forth Other Definitions Used In This Act And Levels Of Offenses; To Provide That If A Dangerous Dog's Bite Or Attack Results In The Death Of A Person, Or In The Serious Bodily Injury Of A Child, The Owner Of The Dog May Not Claim That He Did Not Know That The Dog Was Dangerous As A Defense In A Criminal Prosecution, Or As The Basis For Immunity From Liability In A Civil Action For Damages; To Require The Owner Of A Dangerous Dog That Has Injured A Person Without Provocation, Or Killed A Domestic Animal, To Possess Certain Liability Insurance Coverage; To Provide That This Act Shall Not Apply If The Dog Is Assisting In The Performance Of Law Enforcement Or Military Duties; To Provide That This Act Shall Not Be Construed As Prohibiting A Person From Engaging In Certain Lawful Activities Or From Defending Or Protecting A Person Or Property; To Amend Sections 41-53-11, 97-41-3, 97-41-16 And 97-41-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1261.title: Durable legal guardianship; clarify in law.
1261.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-21-105, 43-15-13, 43-21-609 And 43-21-613, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Existence Of Durable Legal Guardianships; And For Related Purposes.

1262.title: Cargo theft; provide for crime and penalties of.
1262.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Crime Of Cargo Theft; To Provide For Certain Definitions; To Provide Penalties; To Provide For The Crime Of Unlawful Possession Or Use Of A Fifth Wheel; To Amend Section 97-25-25, In Conformity With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1263.title: Bails Agents; clarify service area.
1263.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-39-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Service Area Of A Bail Agent Or Bail Enforcement Agent To Write Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

1264.title: Trucks; remove the requirement that visibility must be bad from the requirement to reduce speed during inclement weather.
1264.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Visibility Must Be Bad From The Requirement That All Trucks, Or Truck-trailer Combinations, And Passenger Buses Shall Be Required To Reduce Speed To Forty-five Miles Per Hour During Inclement Weather; And For Related Purposes.

1266.title: Parole Board; revise powers and duties.
1266.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Parole Board; To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of A Felony Record Under Certain Limited Circumstances; To Clarify Authority Of The Court To Revoke Probation; And For Related Purposes.

1267.title: Investigative Consumer Report; require to be given to person investigated.
1267.description: An Act To Require Any Person Who Obtains An Investigative Consumer Report Or Any Report Relating To A Consumer's Background To Provide A Copy Of Each Report That The Person Has Obtained Relating To The Consumer, Upon Request By The Consumer; To Provide A Penalty For Failure To Provide; And For Related Purposes.

1268.title: Technical violations for offender; require sentence to run concurrently for each violation report.
1268.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-7-27, And 47-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Whenever An Offender Is Placed In A Technical Violation Center For A Violation Report, The Term Of Imprisonment For The Offender In The Center Shall Run Concurrently And Not Consecutively; And For Related Purposes.

1269.title: MS Legal Services; provide criminal assessments for.
1269.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Assessment On Certain Criminal Violations To Fund Mississippi Legal Services; And For Related Purposes.

1270.title: Minors; allow sentencing discretion in capital cases.
1270.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Eligibility Of Minors For Parole For Capital Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

1271.title: Mississippi Second Amendment Task Force; create.
1271.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Second Amendment Task Force; To Provide For The Members Of The Task Force; To Provide Duties Of The Task Force; To Provide That The Task Force Shall Submit A Report Of Its Findings To The Legislature By December 31, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

1272.title: Concealed carry permit fees; lower.
1272.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce Fees For Permits To Carry Concealed Weapons; And For Related Purposes.

1273.title: Meth lab; require disclosure of existence when selling real property.
1273.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-1-509, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Disclosure Of The Existence Of Methamphetamine Labs On Real Property Before Such Property May Be Sold; And For Related Purposes.

1274.title: Habitual offenders; revise provision to include age requirements.
1274.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sentencing Requirements For Habitual Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

1275.title: Habitual offenders; clarify who qualifies as.
1275.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Provision Of Law Regulating Habitual Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

1276.title: Alcohol; create civil offense for open container violations.
1276.description: An Act To Prohibit The Possession Of An Open Alcoholic Beverage, Light Wine Or Beer Container Or The Consumption Of Alcoholic Beverages, Light Wine Or Beer, Within The Passenger Compartment Of A Motor Vehicle; To Prescribe Civil Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1277.title: Expunction; allow for certain felony convictions by first-time offenders.
1277.description: An Act To Provide A Procedure To Expunge Certain Convictions; To Amend Sections 41-29-150, 99-15-57 And 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1278.title: Police Officer; require to wear body cameras.
1278.description: An Act To Create The Law Enforcement Body-worn Camera Act; To Provide The Procedures For Use Of Body-worn Cameras By Law Enforcement Officers; To Describe How Video From The Cameras Shall Be Retained By Law Enforcement Agencies; To Describe The List Of Persons Who May Obtain A Copy Of A Recording; To Provide Remedies For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1279.title: Firearms license; exempt requirement of for law enforcement officer when outside of jurisdiction of employment in the state.
1279.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From Licensure Requirements To Carry Concealed Weapons To Law Enforcement Officers And Professional Bondsmen Within Or Outside The Jurisdiction Of Respective Employment In The State, Without Regard To Whether Such Individual Is Acting In The Performance And Scope Of His Or Her Official Duties; To Require Any Law Enforcement Officer Or Professional Bondsmen To Present Proof Of Employment For Which The Exemption Applies Upon Request When Outside Of The Jurisdiction Of Employment; And For Related Purposes.

1280.title: Concealed carry permit; revise fees.
1280.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce Fees For Permits To Carry Concealed Weapons; And For Related Purposes.

1281.title: Felony record; revise under certain circumstances.
1281.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of A Felony Record Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

1282.title: Drug courts; revise requirements for participation.
1282.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-23-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Qualifications For Participation In Drug Court; And For Related Purposes.

1283.title: Police officer; authorize next of kin to get personal sidearm.
1283.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Next Of Kin Of A Law Enforcement Officer May Be Allowed To Purchase The Personal Sidearm Used By The Officer; And For Related Purposes.

1284.title: Drug-free zones; revise penalties.
1284.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions Of Law Regulating The Drug-free Enhancements Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

1285.title: Habitual offenders; clarify prison sentence requirements of.
1285.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sentencing Requirements Of Habitual Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

1286.title: Habitual offenders; revise sentencing provisions for.
1286.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing Requirements For Habitual Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

1287.title: Habitual offender sentencing; revise to include crimes of violence.
1287.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Habitual Offender Sentencing By Including Crimes Of Violence; And For Related Purposes.

1288.title: Habitual offenders; revise requirements by adding time line for prior felony convictions.
1288.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirements For Sentencing Habitual Offenders By Providing A Time Line For Prior Felony Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

1289.title: Justice Information Center; require law enforcement agencies to report crimes committed that are subject to enhanced penalty.
1289.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-27-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Law Enforcement Agencies To Report To The Mississippi Justice Information Center All Persons Involved And Crimes Committed, Regardless Of Conviction, That Are Subject To An Enhanced Penalty; And For Related Purposes.

1290.title: Commercial burglary; remove from list of crimes ineligible for expunction.
1290.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Commercial Burglary From The List Of Crimes Ineligible For Expunction For Persons Under The Age Of 18 At The Time Of The Offense; And For Related Purposes.

1291.title: Vulnerable person; abuse of is felony not misdemeanor, and reckless abuse is also included.
1291.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-47-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Abuse Of A Vulnerable Person Is A Felony Instead Of A Misdemeanor; To Provide That A Person Is Guilty Of Abusing A Vulnerable Person If The Act Or Omission That Causes The Abuse Was Done Recklessly, Not Just Willfully; And For Related Purposes.

1292.title: Crimes; create for unauthorized use of minor's name and social security number as dependent on income tax return.
1292.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of A Minor's Name And Social Security Number On An Income Tax Form By A Person Who Is Not Legally Entitled To Use Such Name And Number; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1293.title: Simple and aggravated assault; revise list of protected personnel.
1293.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Protected Personnel Triggering An Enhanced Penalty Under The Offenses Of Simple And Aggravated Assault; And For Related Purposes.

1294.title: Death sentence; authorize life imprisonment if sentence unconstitutional.
1294.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Person Whose Death Sentence Has Been Held To Have Been Unconstitutional Shall Be Sentenced To Imprisonment For Life And Is Not Eligible For Parole; And For Related Purposes.

1295.title: Implied Consent Law; bring forward provisions regulating.
1295.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 63-11-5, 63-11-7, 63-11-8, 63-11-9, 63-11-11, 63-11-13, 63-11-17, 63-11-19, 63-11-21, 63-11-23, 63-11-25, 63-11-26, 63-11-27, 63-11-30, 63-11-31, 63-11-32 And 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Provisions Of The Implied Consent Law; And For Related Purposes.

1296.title: Mississippi Second Amendment Preservation Act; create.
1296.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Second Amendment Preservation Act"; To Prevent Federal Infringement On The Right To Keep And Bear Arms; Nullifying All Federal Acts In Violation Of The Second Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States; And For Related Purposes.

1297.title: Capital murder; include murder of uniformed security guard as.
1297.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Killing Of A Uniformed Security Guard Shall Be Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

1298.title: Witness protection program; create.
1298.description: An Act To Create A Witness Protection Program In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Appointment Of The Witness Protection Board; To Require Witness Protection Agreements; To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Exclusion Of Witness Protection From Public Meetings; And For Related Purposes.

1299.title: Human Trafficking; increase penalty for.
1299.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Penalty For Human Trafficking; And For Related Purposes.

1300.title: Law enforcement; require pursuit policy of alleged crime perpetrator.
1300.description: An Act To Require County And Local Law Enforcement Agencies That Conduct Vehicular Pursuits To Adopt Written Policies That Set Forth The Manner In Which These Operations Shall Be Conducted; And For Related Purposes.

1301.title: Vulnerable Persons Act; delete exemption from for certain adult day services program.
1301.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-47-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Exemption From The Vulnerable Persons Act For Certain Adult Day Services Programs; And For Related Purposes.

1302.title: Bond; authorize posting as condition of parole or early release.
1302.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Posting Of Bond As A Condition Of Parole Or Early Release To Secure The Appearance Of A Defendant For A Subsequent Parole Or Court Proceeding; To Amend Section 47-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1303.title: Crimes; prohibit owning vicious animal or dog unless requirements designed to protect public are met.
1303.description: An Act Making It A Crime To Own, Possess Or Have Custody Of Certain Vicious Animals Or Dogs, Unless Certain Requirements Designed To Protect The Public Are Met; To Amend Sections 41-53-11 And 97-41-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1304.title: Execution team; create and provide exemptions for drugs.
1304.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Protect The Identities Of All Individuals And Entities Who Comprise The Execution Including, But Not Limited To, Any Supplier Of Lethal Injection Drugs; And For Related Purposes.

1305.title: Pregnancy; provide for crime of felonious child abuse for women testing positive for controlled substances during.
1305.description: An Act To Require Drug Testing Of Pregnant Women Arrested For Violations Of The Uniform Controlled Substances Law; To Provide That A Positive Test By A Pregnant Woman Shall Constitute Felonious Child Abuse; To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1306.title: Sex offender propensity; chancery court may order custody in mental health facility.
1306.description: An Act To Authorize Chancery Courts To Order Persons With Sexual Offender Propensities To Be Held Pending Evaluation; And For Related Purposes.

1307.title: Central Office of the Department of Corrections; exempt from State Personnel Board procedures.
1307.description: An Act To Provide That Department Of Corrections Employees Who Are Employed Within The Central Office Of The Department Shall Be Exempt From State Personnel Board Procedures For A Period Of Two Years; To Require The Department Of Corrections To Provide Cash Overtime Pay Instead Of Compensatory Time To All Corrections Officers, Other Law Enforcement Staff And Other Employees Who Work In The Correctional Facilities Under The Jurisdiction Of The Department For All Time Worked By The Officer Or Employee That Is Considered To Be Overtime For The Position Involved Under The Federal Fair Labor Standards Act; To Provide That Upon The Termination Of Employment Or Death Of Any Corrections Officer, Other Law Enforcement Staff Or Other Employee Who Works In Any Of The Correctional Facilities Under The Jurisdiction Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections, The Department Shall Pay The Officer Or Employee Or His Or Her Estate, As Appropriate, For All Compensatory Leave Accumulated By The Officer Or Employee; And For Related Purposes.

1308.title: Person; clarify that unborn children are included in the meaning of.
1308.description: An Act To Amend Section 1-3-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Every Human Being From The Moment Of Fertilization, Thereof, Is A Person; And For Related Purposes.

1309.title: Death by law enforcement officer; require independent investigations of.
1309.description: An Act To Require Each Local Law Enforcement Agency To Adopt A Policy Regarding The Investigation Process Of Any Death Resulting From An Officer's Involvement Employed By The Law Enforcement Agency; To Provide That Such Policy Shall Be Provided To And Signed By All Law Enforcement Officers Employed By The Law Enforcement Agency To Acknowledge Receipt Of The Policy; To Provide That The Investigation Process Shall Be Conducted By Internal Affairs In Transparent Manner That Avoids Any Appearance Of Any Conflict Of Interest; To Prescribe The Minimum Criteria To Be Contained In The Policy; To Provide That Occurrence Of Certain Acts Shall Necessitate An Immediate Response To The Scene Of Incident And An Investigation Conducted By Internal Affairs; To Require The Investigator Conducting The Investigation To Provide A Complete Written Report To The Attorney General And The District Attorney Of The County In Which The Officer-involved Death Or Injury Occurred; To Provide That The Investigation Of Such Incidents Shall Not Exceed Six Months; And For Related Purposes.

1310.title: Contributing to the neglect or delinquency of a child and abuse of a child; revise penalties for.
1310.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Contributing To The Neglect Or Delinquency Of Any Child, Abuse Of A Child, Aiding In The Escape Of A Child Under Certain Circumstances Or Aiding In The Harboring Or Concealing Of A Child Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

1311.title: Individual driving a stolen vehicle causing an accident; provide penalty for.
1311.description: An Act To Create A Criminal Offense For Causing An Accident While Using A Motor Vehicle Unlawfully Taken; And For Related Purposes.

1312.title: Trespassing; provide penalty for violation while engaged in certain outdoor activities.
1312.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Specific Penalties For Trespassing While Engaged In Certain Outdoor Activities; To Amend Sections 97-17-93 And 97-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1313.title: Concealed carry permit; revise qualifications for enhanced.
1313.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualification Necessary For An Enhanced Concealed-carry Permit; To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Definition Of Armed Services Member For Purposes Of Eligibility Of A Minor For A Concealed-carry Permit; And For Related Purposes.

1314.title: Crimes; revise penalties for attempted capital offenses.
1314.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For Attempted Capital Offenses; And For Related Purposes.

1315.title: Rape; death penalty for conviction if victim is age 13 or under.
1315.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Death Penalty In Statutory Rape Cases Where The Victim Is 13 Years Of Age Or Under And The Defendant Is 18 Years Of Age Or Older; And For Related Purposes.

1316.title: Crimes; revise penalties for fraudulent use of identity of another.
1316.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-19-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For The Fraudulent Use Of The Identity Of Another; And For Related Purposes.

1317.title: Municipal courts; prohibit requirement that individuals have a photo I.D. to enter into such courts.
1317.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Municipal Court From Requiring Photo Identification From Any Individual Before The Individual May Enter Such Court; And For Related Purposes.

1318.title: Marshals and constables; revise fees charged for service of process.
1318.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Which May Be Charged By Marshals And Constables For Service Of Process; And For Related Purposes.

1319.title: Wireless interactive communication; prohibit use of by motor vehicle operator and make secondary offense.
1319.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Telephones Or Electronic Communication Devices To Engage In Wireless Interactive Communication By A Person Operating A Motor Vehicle; To Provide Penalties; To Provide That A Conviction Under This Act Must Occur As A Secondary Offense; And For Related Purposes.

1320.title: Electronic citation; allow for traffic, misdemeanor or other citations.
1320.description: An Act To Provide A Fee For The Use Of Electronic Citations For Certain Offenses; To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1321.title: Crime of endangerment; revise for knowing exposure.
1321.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-27-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Endangerment For Knowing Exposure To Body Fluids; And For Related Purposes.

1322.title: Traffic violations; provide that moving violations may be amended to nonmoving violation.
1322.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Moving Traffic Violations May Be Reduced To Nonmoving Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1327.title: Nathan's Law; revise distribution of fines and require school districts to establish separate fund for receipt of allocations for.
1327.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-615, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is A Provision Of "nathan's Law," To Revise The Distribution Of Fines Assessed For Violation Of Overtaking A School Bus That Has Stopped On A Public Roadway For The Purpose Of Receiving Or Discharging School Children; To Provide That Twenty-five Dollars Of Each Fine Assessed Shall Be Allocated To The Local School District Wherein The Violation Occurred To Be Used By The Superintendent Of Schools And Local School Board For The Purchase And Installation Of Automated School Bus Safety Cameras; To Require The Superintendent, In Consultation With The Board To Establish A Separate Fund In The District's Accounts For The Deposit Of Allocated Assessments; To Amend Section 37-41-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1328.title: Concealed weapon license; courts/mental health treatment facilities notify Dept. of Public Safety of incompetency/committment acts.
1328.description: An Act To Provide That If A Court Adjudicates A Person As Mentally Incompetent Or Orders That A Person Be Committed To A Hospital, Mental Health Treatment Facility Or Other Institution Qualified To Provide Care And Treatment For Persons With Mental Illness, Then The Clerk Of Court Shall Notify The Department Of Public Safety Of Such Order; To Provide That If A Person Voluntarily Commits Himself Or Herself To Such A Hospital, Facility Or Institution, Then The Hospital, Facility Or Institution Shall Notify The Department Of Public Safety; To Provide That The Department May Use The Information Contained In The Notification Solely For Purposes Associated With Issuing, Denying, Suspending Or Revoking Such Person's License, Or Application For A License To Carry A Stun Gun, Concealed Pistol Or Concealed Revolver; To Provide That Records Associated With This Information Are Not Public; To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Require That The Department Maintain An Automated Listing Of Persons Who Are The Subject Of Such Notifications And Review The Listing As Necessary; And For Related Purposes.

1329.title: MS Task Force on Open Adoptions; create and require the task force to submit a report on its findings.
1329.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Task Force On Open Adoptions; To Describe The Purpose Of Such Task Force; To List The Members Of The Task Force; To Provide The Duties And Responsibilities Of The Task Force; To Require The Task Force To Submit A Report Of Its Findings To The Legislature And The Governor; To Provide A Dissolution Date For The Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

1330.title: Adoption; revise home study and residency requirements.
1330.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-17-3 And 93-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Judge To Determine If A Home Study Is Necessary In An Adoption; To Clarify Residency Requirements; To Amend Section 93-17-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Who Disclose Information Received During Closed Adoption Hearings Or From Records Pertaining To Adoption Proceedings Are Guilty Of A Misdemeanor, Subject To Being Fined Or Imprisoned, And May Be Held In Contempt Of Court; And For Related Purposes.

1331.title: Controlled substances laws; made additions and revised schedules.
1331.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-29-113 Through 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Additions To And Revise The Schedules Of Controlled Substances; And For Related Purposes.

1332.title: MHP; provide for allocation of funds to from assessment of funds for certain violations to defray expenses of.
1332.description: An Act To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Designated As The "mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Fund" For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Associated With The Purchase Of Necessary Uniforms, Automobiles And Other Equipment For Members Of The Highway Safety Patrol And To Defray The Expenses Of Providing The Necessary Training To Qualifying Officers Recruited To Attend Trooper School; Amend Section 45-1-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Schedule For Payment Of Funds Collected From Assessments On Certain Violations; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Overall State Assessment For Each Infraction Provided Thereunder By Ten Percent For The Purpose Of Funding The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1333.title: Chancellor; provide one additional for the Tenth Chancery Court District.
1333.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-5-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide One Additional Chancellor For The Tenth Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

1334.title: Identity theft; establish procedure for victim to have debt forgiven and credit reports purged.
1334.description: An Act To Establish A Procedure For A Victim Of Identity Theft To Have The Debt Forgiven And Credit Reports Purged; And For Related Purposes.

1335.title: Administrative Office of Courts; require to maintain state central registry concerning youth court cases.
1335.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-257, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Administrative Office Of Courts, Rather Than The Office Of Youth Services Of The Department Of Human Services, To Maintain A State Central Registry That Contains Certain Information From Cases That Is Obtainable From Records Of The Youth Court; To Provide That Youth Courts Shall Furnish Through The Use Of The Mississippi Youth Court Information Delivery System (mycids) Or Other Forms, Information That Is Needed By The Administrative Office Of Courts; And For Related Purposes.

1336.title: Crimes; require specification of degree of mental culpability required for commission of.
1336.description: An Act To Prescribe Conditions Under Which Strict Criminal Liability Shall Be Imposed And For Which A Degree Of Mental Culpability Is Required For Commission Of An Offense; To Define Terms Related To Determining The Level Of Mental Culpability To Be Imposed For Criminal Offenses; To Provide That The Requirement For The Specification Of The Requisite Degree Of Culpability Shall Not Apply Retroactively To Criminal Offenses Established Before July 1, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

1337.title: Wrongful death; include unborn child.
1337.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Cause Of Action For Wrongful Death Includes An Unborn Child; And For Related Purposes.

1338.title: Administrative Procedures Law of 2015; consolidate administrative procedures, public records and open meetings laws into single act.
1338.description: An Act To Consolidate The Mississippi Administrative Procedures Law, The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983 And The Open Meetings Law Into A Single New Act To Be Known As The "mississippi Administrative Procedures Law Of 2015"; To Define Certain Terms; To Require Certain Information To Be Published By State Agencies With The Secretary Of State And Made Available To The Public; To Authorize The Charging Of Fees For Information Provided To The Public; To Provide Procedures For Obtaining Records; To Require Agencies To Promulgate Rules And Regulations And To Prescribe The Procedure To Be Followed In The Promulgation Of Rules And Regulations; To Require Reporting Of Proposed Rules To The Legislature; To Prescribe The Manner In Which Agencies Are To Maintain A System Of Records; To Require The Disclosure Of And Access To Public Records; To Exempt Certain Agency Records From Public Disclosure; To Require Detailed Annual Reports To The Legislature From Agencies Providing Information On Requests For Records And Appeals Made When Record Requests Have Been Denied; To Require Publication Regarding Rules And Regulations Promulgated Under This Act; To Provide Civil Remedies; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Provide Rules For Conducting Agency Business; To Prohibit Members Of Agencies From Conducting Meetings That Are Not Open To The Public; To Prescribe The Manner In Which Agencies May Close Meetings Or Portions Of A Meeting To The Public Under Prescribed Circumstances; To Provide Jurisdiction For Actions And Proceedings Under This Act; To Require Agencies To Make Certain Annual Reports To The Legislature; To Allow Interested Persons An Opportunity To Participate In Rulemaking; To Provide For Agency Hearings; To Compel Attendance; To Provide For The Taking Of Evidence; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of Judges At Hearings; To Authorize A Cause Of Action For Aggrieved Parties; To Provide For Judicial Review; To Provide The Duties And Powers Of Reviewing Courts; To Require The Legislature To Accept Or Disapprove Of Rules And To Prescribe The Rules To Be Followed In The House And Senate In The Consideration Of Joint Resolutions Proposing Agency Rules And Rule Changes; To Bring Forward Sections 25-43-1.101 Through 25-43-3.114, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Administrative Procedures Law, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 25-61-1 Through 25-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 25-41-1 Through 25-41-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require Public Business To Be Conducted In Open Meetings, Subject To Prescribed Exceptions, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1339.title: Victim assistance coordinators; authorize DA of 14th Circuit Court District to appoint one additional.
1339.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-36-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The District Attorney Of The Fourteenth Circuit Court District To Appoint One Additional Victim Assistance Coordinator For A Total Of Two Victim Assistance Coordinators; And For Related Purposes.

1340.title: State cause of action for sexual harassment; create.
1340.description: An Act To Create A Cause Of Action For Sexual Harassment In State Court; And For Related Purposes.

1341.title: Juvenile Detention Facilities Licensing Act; create and require interpretation services and certain girls facility.
1341.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Juvenile Detention Facilities Licensing Act; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Create An Advisory Council Whose Purpose Is To Assist The Juvenile Facilities Monitoring Unit Of The Department Of Public Safety, Which Is The Licensing Agency For Juvenile Detention Facilities Under This Act; To Prescribe Certain Duties Of The Juvenile Facilities Monitoring Unit In Its Role As A Licensing Agency; To Require The Department Of Education To Promulgate Certain Rules As They Pertain To The Education Of Children Housed In Juvenile Detention Facilities; To Provide That Juvenile Detention Facilities Must Have A License To Operate As Of October Of 2016; To Require The Licensing Agency To Make Certain Inspections; To Provide A Certain Hearing And Appeals Process If A Juvenile Detention Facility's License Is Suspended, Revoked Or Restricted; To Amend Section 43-21-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Certain Minimum Standards For The Juvenile Detention Center; To Amend Section 43-21-323, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Create A New Code Section To Provide That The Juvenile Facilities Monitoring Unit Shall Train Juvenile Detention Officers; To Provide That No Statements, Admissions Or Confessions Or Incriminating Information Obtained From A Youth During A Screening Or Assessment Shall Be Admitted Into Evidence Against The Child On The Issue Of Whether The Child Committed A Delinquent Act; To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Terms "assessment" And "screening" Under The Youth Court Law; To Amend Section 43-21-559, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Such Statements, Admissions Or Confessions From Being Admitted Into Evidence To Determine The Finding Of Delinquency; To Amend Sections 43-21-561 And 43-21-603, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Require That Language And Sign Language Interpretation Services Be Provided For Certain Youth At Juvenile Detention Centers; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Require Juvenile Detention Centers To Adopt A Policy Providing For Interpretation Services For Certain Youth At Such Centers; To Provide That Interpreters Shall Be Made Available 24 Hours A Day To Assist The Centers; To Require The Centers To Post Notices Advertising The Interpretation Services Within The Detention Centers; To Provide Certain Funding For Such Services; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Personal Service Contract Board To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Governing The Solicitation And Selection Of A Single Statewide Contract For The Interpretation Services At The Centers; To Amend Section 43-21-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Such Centers To Provide Interpretation Services; To Amend Sections 45-4-1 And 45-4-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Certain References To "youth Detention Facilities" As They Relate To The County Jail Officers Training Program; And For Related Purposes.

1342.title: Parent Representation Pilot Projects; require Dept. of Human Services and AOC to coordinate certain efforts of.
1342.description: An Act To Require The Administrative Office Of Courts And The Department Of Human Services To Coordinate The Efforts Of The Parent Representation Pilot Projects; To Provide A Certain Definition; To Require The Department Of Human Services And Certain Counties That Participate In The Projects, To Collect Certain Data Pertaining To Abuse And Neglect Cases And To Require The Information Be Provided To The Administrative Office Of Courts; To And For Related Purposes.

1343.title: Intake unit for youth court division, require certain appointees to be employed by county or municipality.
1343.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When A Youth Court Judge Appoints An Individual To The Intake Unit Of The Youth Court Division, Such Individual Shall Be An Employee Of The County Or Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1344.title: Youth court jurisdiction; revise age that court has jurisdiction over a child who commits an offense.
1344.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Youth Court Shall Not Have Jurisdiction Over Offenses Committed By A Child That Is 19 Years Of Age Rather Than 18 Years Of Age; To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "child" And "youth" In The Youth Court Act; And For Related Purposes.

1345.title: Definition of "child" and "youth"; revise under Youth Court Law.
1345.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Terms "youth" And "child", As Utilized Under The Youth Court Law, Shall Mean A Child Who Is 19 Years Of Age, Rather Than 18 Years Of Age, When Such Child Commits A Delinquent Act; And For Related Purposes.

1346.title: Minimum age that a child may be placed in the state training school; revise.
1346.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Child Is Under The Age Of 12 Then Such Child Cannot Be Committed To The State Training School Or Be Held In Secure Detention As A Disposition; And For Related Purposes.

1347.title: Jurist-in-residence; create position to bring attention to youth court issues.
1347.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Position Of Jurist-in-residence To Bring Attention To Youth Court Issues; To Amend Section 9-21-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1348.title: Division of Youth Services; require to operate Adolescent Opportunity Programs rather than Adolescent Offender Programs.
1348.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-27-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Division Of Youth Services To Operate Adolescent Opportunity Programs Rather Than Adolescent Offender Programs, Which Supplement Existing Community Based Programs That Are Used By Youth Courts As Alternatives To Detention; To Remove Other Outdated Language Within The Section; To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1349.title: Youth court; prohibit admissions made during screenings or assessments from being utilized in determining whether youth committed delinquent act.
1349.description: An Act To Provide That No Statements, Admissions Or Confessions Or Incriminating Information Obtained From A Youth During A Screening Or Assessment Shall Be Admitted Into Evidence Against The Child On The Issue Of Whether The Child Committed A Delinquent Act; To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Terms "assessment" And "screening" Under The Youth Court Law; To Amend Section 43-21-559, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohbit Such Statements, Admissions Or Confessions From Being Admitted Into Evidence To Determine The Finding Of Delinquency; To Amend Sections 43-21-561 And 43-21-603, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1350.title: Mississippi Juvenile Detention Facilities Licensing Act; create.
1350.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Juvenile Detention Facilities Licensing Act; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Create An Advisory Council Whose Purpose Is To Assist The Juvenile Facilities Monitoring Unit Of The Department Of Public Safety, Which Is The Licensing Agency For Juvenile Detention Facilities Under This Act; To Prescribe Certain Duties Of The Juvenile Facilities Monitoring Unit In Its Role As A Licensing Agency; To Require The Department Of Education To Promulgate Certain Rules As They Pertain To The Education Of Children Housed In Juvenile Detention Facilities; To Provide That Juvenile Detention Facilities Must Have A License To Operate As Of October 2016; To Require The Licensing Agency To Make Certain Inspections; To Provide A Certain Hearing And Appeals Process If A Juvenile Detention Facility's License Is Suspended, Revoked Or Restricted; And For Related Purposes.

1352.title: Interpretation language assistance services; provide for certain youth at juvenile detention centers.
1352.description: An Act To Require That Language And Sign Language Interpretation Services Be Provided For Certain Youth At Juvenile Detention Centers; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Require Juvenile Detention Centers To Adopt A Policy Providing For Interpretation Services For Certain Youth At Such Centers; To Provide That Interpreters Shall Be Made Available 24 Hours A Day To Assist The Centers; To Require The Centers To Post Notices Advertising The Interpretation Services Within The Detention Centers; To Provide Certain Funding For Such Services; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Personal Service Contract Board To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Governing The Solicitation And Selection Of A Single Statewide Contract For The Interpretation Services At The Centers; To Amend Section 43-21-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Such Centers To Provide Interpretation Services; And For Related Purposes.

1353.title: Mandatory Risk Assessment Instrument; require AOC to develop and use in all youth courts.
1353.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-21-309 And 37-13-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Prior To Disposing A Youth For A Delinquent Offense, The Court Shall Be Provided The Results Of A Validated Juvenile Risk Assessment Instrument In Order To Determine The Risk Of The Youth To Reoffend; To Provide That Any Compulsory-school-age Child That Has Been Referred To Youth Court By A School Official Shall Be Subject To A Juvenile Risk Assessment Instrument Completed By The Intake Unit Prior To Detention; To Authorize And Direct The Administrative Office Of Courts To Develop The Form And Scale For The Statewide Mandatory Juvenile Risk Assessment Instrument To Be Used By The Youth Court; To Provide That Any Compulsory-school-age Child That Indicates A Low Risk On The Risk Assessment Instrument Shall Be Referred To The School District Alternative School Program And Not Taken Into The Custody Of A Detention Center; To Establish The Juvenile Risk Assessment Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1354.title: Youth court; prohibit wearing of restraints by child appearing before court unless certain findings are made by court.
1354.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Instruments Of Restraint Upon Any Child Who Appears Before Youth Court Unless Certain Findings Are Made By The Youth Court Judge; To Provide, Whenever Practicable, That All Parties May Be Heard By The Youth Court On The Proposed Use Of Such Restraints; To Require That If Instruments Of Restraints Are Used, Then The Youth Court Judge Must Make A Written Findings Of Fact In Support Of The Order; And For Related Purposes.

1355.title: MS Highway 550; revise posted speed limit on certain portion of in honor of the late Peyton Flowers.
1355.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 550 In Lincoln County As The "peyton Coleman Flowers Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

1356.title: Life jackets; increase minimum age of person required to wear on certain vessels.
1356.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-21-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From Twelve To Eighteen The Minimum Age For A Person Who Is Required To Wear A Coast Guard Approved Personal Flotation Device While On Board Certain Motorboats, Sailboats Or Vessels; To Amend Section 59-21-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $250.00 To $500.00 The Maximum Penalty For Violations Of The Mississippi Boating Law; And For Related Purposes.

1357.title: Texting; prohibit while driving and make civil offense.
1357.description: An Act To Prohibit Persons From Operating A Motor Vehicle While Using A Hand-held Mobile Telephone To Write, Send Or Read A Text Message And From Using A Social Networking Site While The Motor Vehicle Is Moving; To Provide A Violation Is A Civil Violation With A Civil Penalty Of One Hundred Dollars; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving Under Certain Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

1358.title: Motorcycles; allow to proceed through red light if green light is not triggered.
1358.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Motorcycles To Proceed Through Intersections Or Make A Turn When Stopped At A Red Light And It Does Not Trigger The Sensor For A Green Light; And For Related Purposes.

1360.title: Wireless interactive communication; prohibit use of for purposes of written communication by a person operating a motor vehicle.
1360.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Communication Devices Without Using Hands-free Accessories To Engage In Wireless Interactive Written Communications By A Person Operating A Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1362.title: Motor vehicles; prohibit texting by operator of and make secondary offense until January 1, 2017.
1362.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Wireless Telephones Or Electronic Communication Devices To Engage In Wireless Interactive Communication By A Person Operating A Motor Vehicle; To Provide Exemptions From Compliance With The Requirements Of This Act; To Provide That From July 1, 2015, Through December 31, 2016, A Conviction Under This Act Must Occur As A Secondary Offense And Shall Not Be Entered On The Driving Record Of The Convicted Person; To Provide That From And After January 1, 2017, A Conviction Under This Act May Occur As A Primary Offense And Shall Be Entered On The Driving Record Of The Convicted Person; To Provide That A Law Enforcement Officer May Not Seize Or Examine The Wireless Telephone Or Electronic Communication Device Of A Person For The Purpose Of Determining A Violation Of Section 63-1-73; To Amend Section 63-1-216, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Shall Be Disqualified From Driving A Commercial Motor Vehicle For Certain Amounts Of Time For Violations Under Section 63-1-73; And For Related Purposes.

1363.title: Safe Transportation of Railroad Employees by Contract Carriers Act; create.
1363.description: An Act To Create The Safe Transportation Of Railroad Employees By Contract Carriers Act; To Regulate The Transportation Of Railroad Employees By Contract Carriers By Establishing Standards For Drivers Employed By The Contract Carriers And The Motor Vehicles Used By The Contract Carriers; And For Related Purposes.

1364.title: Motor vehicles; require to remove from public roads after certain accidents.
1364.description: An Act To Require The Driver Or Other Occupant Of A Motor Vehicle To Remove The Vehicle From The Immediate Confines Of A Public Roadway After A Traffic Accident; To Provide That The Driver Or Any Other Person Shall Not Be Considered Liable For Causing An Accident Solely By Reason Of Moving The Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1365.title: City of Jackson; remove condition imposed by the state upon certain real property sold to creating a reversionary interest.
1365.description: An Act To Amend Section 2, Chapter 442, Local And Private Laws Of 1944, For The Purpose Of Removing The Condition On Certain Real Property Sold By The State Mineral Lease Commission To The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, For Park Purposes And Purposes Incident Thereto Which Causes The Property To Revert Back To The State Of Mississippi For Failure Of The City To Use The Property For The Purpose For Which It Was Originally Sold And Conveyed; To Bring Forward Section 1, Chapter 395, Laws Of 1946, Which Authorized The Commission To Execute A Corrected Deed To Correct A Discrepancy In The Description Of The Property Sold To The City Of Jackson Pursuant To Chapter 442, Laws Of 1944; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Execute A Corrected Deed To Reflect The Removal Of The Condition Of Use Of Such Property; And For Related Purposes.

1366.title: Cooperative; provide for incorporation of.
1366.description: An Act To Provide For The Incorporation Of Cooperative Associations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Requisites For The Articles Of Association Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Adoptions Of Bylaws By Cooperatives; To Specify The Membership Of Cooperatives And The Requisites For Voting By Members; To Provide For The Organization Of Meetings And The Notification Of Members Of Meetings; To Provide For The Authorization Of, Control And Use Of Stock By Cooperatives; To Provide For The Number, Election And Removal Of Directors; To Provide For The Meetings Of Directors; To Authorize Executive Committees; To Provide For The Officers Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Compensation And Benefits To Directors, Officers And Employees Of A Cooperative; To Provide For The Liability Of Directors, Members, Stockholders And Patrons Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Dispose Of Assets; To Provide Rules That Govern Contracts By Cooperatives; To Provide That The Directors Shall Determine And Distribute Net Assets At Least Once Annually; To Provide For Annual Reports; To Provide The Manner In Which Articles Of Association May Be Amended; To Provide The Manner In Which Cooperatives May Merge And Consolidate; To Provide The Manner In Which A Corporation May Convert Itself Into A Cooperative; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Voluntarily Dissolve Itself; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Be Involuntarily Dissolved; To Provide For The Liquidation Of The Assets And Business Of A Cooperative Under Court Supervision; To Provide For Derivative Actions By Members And Stockholders; To Limit The Use Of The Term "cooperative" To Associations Organized Under This Act And To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Such Term; To Provide For Administrative Dissolution; To Amend Section 79-35-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1367.title: Children; provide immunity from civil liability to those who break into cars to save.
1367.description: An Act To Provide Immunity From Civil Liability For Any Person Who Forcibly Enters A Motor Vehicle To Remove A Minor From Such Vehicle; To Provide The Requirements Necessary To Receive Civil Immunity Under The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1368.title: County courts; authorize in each county.
1368.description: An Act To Create A County Court In And For Every County; To Amend Section 9-9-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create County Court Districts; To Amend Section 9-9-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth The Qualifications Of Judges Of The County Courts; To Amend Section 9-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth The Salary Of The County Court Judges; To Amend Section 9-9-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Terms Of Court; To Amend Section 9-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Forth The Jurisdiction Of The County Court; To Amend Sections 9-9-23, 9-1-19, 9-1-23, 9-1-25 And 9-1-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 9-1-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Office Allowance And Support Staff For County Court Judges; To Amend Section 43-21-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Youth Court Jurisdiction; To Amend Section 43-21-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Funding For The County Courts; To Amend Section 23-15-975, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 9-13-1, 9-13-17 And 9-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Court Reporter And Conform Provisions Concerning Court Reporters; To Designate The Clerk Of The County Court And The Clerk Of The Youth Court; To Bring Forward Sections 9-13-31, 43-21-45, 43-21-111, 43-21-123, 43-21-125 And 43-21-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Repeal Section 9-9-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows For Establishment Of A County Court By Agreement Of Two Or More Counties; To Repeal Section 9-9-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Restricts The Practice Of Law By County Court Judges; To Repeal Section 9-9-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows Municipalities To Supplement County Court Judge Salaries; To Repeal Section 9-9-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional County Court Judge For Harrison County; To Repeal Section 9-9-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows Additional County Court Judges For Hinds County; To Repeal Section 9-9-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional County Court Judge For Washington County; To Repeal Section 9-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional Judge For Jackson County; To Repeal Section 9-9-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional County Court Judge For Rankin County; To Repeal Section 9-9-18.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional County Court Judge For Madison County; To Repeal Section 9-9-18.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows A County Court Judge For Pearl River County; To Repeal Section 9-9-18.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional County Court Judge For Lauderdale County; To Repeal Section 9-9-18.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allows An Additional County Court Judge For Desoto County; To Repeal Sections 9-9-37, 9-9-39, 9-9-41, 9-9-43 And 9-9-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Allow Counties To Establish Or Abolish A County Court; To Repeal Section 9-13-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes Salaries For Court Reporters Of The County And Youth Courts; And For Related Purposes.

1369.title: Termination of Parental Rights; clarify.
1369.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-15-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Grounds For Termination Of Parental Rights; To Clarify That Returning The Child To The Care Of A Natural Parent Who Could Cause Great Harm To The Child Is A Ground For Termination Of Parental Rights; And For Related Purposes.

1370.title: Judicial discretion; clarify for persons declared insane.
1370.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-21-88, 99-13-7 And 41-21-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction Of The Committing Court For A Person Who Is Indicted For An Offense And Acquitted On The Ground Of Insanity; To Clarify Under What Circumstances And How A Person Acquitted By Reason Of Insanity May Be Released From Confinement; To Require The Court From Which The Person Was Committed To Approve Any Release Of Such Person; And For Related Purposes.

1371.title: Minimum wage; establish, provide for future increases and provide for exemption and overtime requirements.
1371.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Minimum Wage Act"; To Establish The State Minimum Wage And Provide For Future Increases; To Provide That Employers With Tipped Employees Are Exempt From The Requirement To Pay The State Minimum Wage; To Establish Guidelines For Employees Entitled To Overtime Pay; To Bring Forward Sections 7-7-204, 17-1-51, 23-15-239, 25-3-40, 37-7-307, 57-34-5 And 85-3-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1372.title: Fireworks; require to be sold in a permanent structure.
1372.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Fireworks Be Sold In A Permanent Structure; And For Related Purposes.

1373.title: Fireworks; allow for sale at retail year-round.
1373.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Permit The Sale Of Fireworks Year-round; And For Related Purposes.

1374.title: Adverse possession; repeal.
1374.description: An Act To Repeal Section 15-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That Ten Years' Adverse Possession Of Land Gives Title; And For Related Purposes.

1375.title: Property exempt from seizure; expand exemption for cash on hand to include funds in a financial institution account.
1375.description: An Act To Amend Section 85-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Exemption From Seizure Under Execution Or Attachment For Cash On Hand To Include Funds Contained In A Checking Or Savings Account With A Bank, Saving And Loan Association, Savings Bank, Credit Union Or Other Financial Institution; And For Related Purposes.

1376.title: Child Witness Bill of Rights; enact.
1376.description: An Act To Create New Section 99-43-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Child Witness Bill Of Rights In Order To Grant Appropriate Accommodations To Children Testifying In Court; And For Related Purposes.

1377.title: Elections Contests; clarify jurisdiction of circuit court.
1377.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-961, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Which Provision Of Law Regulates Election Contests Of Party Nominees.

1378.title: Municipal ordinance regulating or restricting parking; remove certain signage requirement.
1378.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Prohibition Against Municipalities Enforcing An Ordinance Regulating Or Restricting Parking Unless Signage Is Adequately Posted Within 250 Feet Of The Street Where Parking Is Regulated Or Restricted; And For Related Purposes.

1379.title: Transient vendors; delete exemption for certain sales from requirement for licensure as.
1379.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-85-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Exemption For Sales Of Goods, Wares, Services Or Merchandise By Sample, Catalogue Or Brochure For Future Delivery From The Requirement For Licensure As A Transient Vendor; And For Related Purposes.

1380.title: Engineering and traffic investigation; remove requirement that local governing authorities conduct investigation before establishment of speed limit.
1380.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That An Engineering And Traffic Investigation Be Completed Before The Governing Authorities Of Municipalities And Counties May Establish Speed Limits Within Their Respective Jurisdictions; And For Related Purposes.

1381.title: Municipalities; authorize adoption of ordinance for certain system to issue citations and summons to violators of certain municipal ordinances.
1381.description: An Act To Authorize Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Adopt An Ordinance Establishing A System By Which Municipal Law Enforcement Officers, Municipal Law Enforcement Employees And Other Municipal Employees May, By Issuance Of Citation, Summon Alleged Violators Of Certain Municipal Codes To Appear In Municipal Court; To Provide For A Procedure If Alleged Violators Fail To Appear In Response To Such Summons; And For Related Purposes.

1382.title: Limited Liability Company Fees; extend repealer on provision regulating.
1382.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-29-1203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Provides For The Registration Of Limited Liability Companies; And For Related Purposes.

1383.title: Limited liability company; remove repealer on.
1383.description: An Act To Amend Section 79-29-1203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repeal Clause On Limited Liability Company Fees; And For Related Purposes.

1384.title: Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship for Students with Dyslexia Program; delete repealer on.
1384.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 37-173-1, 37-173-3, 37-173-5, 37-173-7, 37-173-9, 37-173-11, 37-173-13, 37-173-15, 37-173-17, 37-173-19, 37-173-21, 37-173-23, 37-173-25, 37-173-27 And 37-173-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship For Students With Dyslexia Program; To Repeal Section 37-173-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Repeal Of The Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship For Students With Dyslexia Program; And For Related Purposes.

1385.title: Medical radiation technologists; delete repealers on registration statutes.
1385.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-58-1, 41-58-3 And 41-58-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealers On Those Statutes Providing For The Registration Of Medical Radiation Technologists; And For Related Purposes.

1386.title: Division of Community Services; revise duties to require development of a standardize risk assessment tool and to delete repealer on.
1386.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-27-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Division Of Community Services Within The Department Of Youth Services To Require The Implementation Of A Standardized Risk Assessment Tool And The Development Of A Graduated Sanctions Policy For Use Within The Community By Supporting Community Agencies; To Delete The Repealer On This Provision Of Law; And For Related Purposes.

1387.title: American Civil War; delete repealer on State Commission regarding.
1387.description: An Act To Amend Section 39-35-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer Date Of July 1, 2015, On The Provision Of Law Creating The Mississippi Sesquicentennial Of The American Civil War Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1388.title: Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; extend repealer on MDA authority to use certain funds for expenses.
1388.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Mississippi Development Authority To Use Certain Monies In The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Fund For Ordinary And Necessary General Support Of The Authority; And For Related Purposes.

1389.title: Department of Human Services; extend repealers on establishment of.
1389.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-1-1 Through 43-1-5 And 43-27-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Statutes That Establish The Mississippi Department Of Human Services; To Further Amend Section 43-27-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Division Of Community Services Of The Department Of Youth Services To Require The Implementation Of A Standardized Risk Assessment Tool And The Development Of A Graduated Sanctions Policy For Use Within The Community By Supporting Community Agencies; To Amend Sections 43-1-55 And 43-27-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Duty Of The Department Of Human Services To Establish Employment Standards For Family Protection Specialists And Family Protection Workers; And For Related Purposes.

1390.title: Medical radiation technologists; extend repealers on registration statutes.
1390.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-58-1, 41-58-3 And 41-58-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972,to Extend The Date Of The Repealers On Those Statutes Providing For The Registration Of Medical Radiation Technologists; And For Related Purposes.

1391.title: State employees health insurance plan; delete repealer on requirement that state pay certain amounts toward cost of.
1391.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Requirement That The State Of Mississippi Pay Certain Amounts Toward The Cost Of The State Employees Health Insurance Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1392.title: Nursing home administrators; extend repealer on licensure requirements for.
1392.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Licensure Requirements For Nursing Home Administrators; To Exempt Certain Licensees Of The State Department Of Mental Health As A Mental Health/intellectual Disability Program Administrator From The Requirement Of Licensure As A Nursing Home Administrator; And For Related Purposes.

1393.title: Hospices; extend repealer on moratorium on processing new applications for licensure.
1393.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-85-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Prohibits The State Department Of Health From Processing New Applications For Hospice Licensure Or Issuing Any New Hospice Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

1394.title: Hospices; extend repealer on prohibition on issuance of new licenses for.
1394.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-85-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Prohibits The State Department Of Health From Processing New Applications For Hospice Licensure Or Issuing Any New Hospice Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

1395.title: Hospices licensure; extend repealer on moratorium on processing new applications for licensure.
1395.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-85-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Prohibits The State Department Of Health From Processing New Applications For Hospice Licensure Or Issuing Any New Hospice Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

1396.title: Drug forfeiture laws; extend repealer on administrative forfeiture provisions.
1396.description: An Act To Reenact Section 41-29-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Drug Forfeiture Laws; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 484, Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Section 5, Chapter 501, Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On Section 41-29-176; And For Related Purposes.

1397.title: State Board of Contractors and Residential Builders and Remodelers; extend repealer.
1397.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-59-1 Through 73-59-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Licensing And Regulation Of Residential Builders And Remodelers; To Reenact Sections 31-3-3 And 31-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The State Board Of Contractors And Provide For The Organization And Administration Of The Board; To Amend Section 14, Chapter 345, Laws Of 2000, As Amended By Section 13, Chapter 375, Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Section 13, Chapter 556, Laws Of 2009, As Amended By Section 13, Chapter 433, Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Repealer Regarding The Licensing And Regulation Of Residential Builders And Remodelers And The State Board Of Contractors; And For Related Purposes.

1398.title: Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission; extend repealer on.
1398.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 55-15-51 Through 55-15-62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission; To Amend Reenacted Section 55-15-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Funds In The Shiloh Confederate Memorial Trust Fund May Be Used For The Dedication Of The Mississippi Confederate Memorial At The Shiloh National Military Park; To Amend Section 55-15-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Sections Of Law Providing For The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1399.title: Mississippi Veterans Monument commission; extend repealer on.
1399.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 55-15-51 Through 55-15-62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission; To Amend Section 55-15-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Sections Of Law Providing For The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1400.title: Mississippi Debt Management Services Act; extend repealer.
1400.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-22-1 Through 81-22-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Debt Management Services Act; To Amend Section 81-22-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Act; And For Related Purposes.

1401.title: Alcoholic beverages; delete repealer on statute authorizing holder of package retailer's permit to conduct tasting/sampling events.
1401.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-52, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealer On The Section That Authorizes The Holder Of A Package Retailer's Permit Issued Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, With Prior Written Approval From The Department Of Revenue, To Conduct Tasting Or Sampling Events At The Package Retailer's Permitted Place Of Business During Which Tastes Or Samples Of Alcoholic Beverages May Be Offered Or Served To Consumers At No Cost Subject To Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

1402.title: Ignition Interlock Device Fund; extend repealer on provision requiring transfer of all funds from Drug Court Fund.
1402.description: An Act To Amend Section 5, Chapter Law 512, Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law Requiring Transfer Of All Funds From The Drug Court Fund To The Ignition Interlock Device; And For Related Purposes.

1403.title: Income tax; extend repeal date on tax credit for new cut and sew jobs in upholstered household furniture manufacturing industry.
1403.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Enterprises That Own Or Operate Upholstered Household Furniture Manufacturing Facilities For Each Full-time Employee Employed By Such Enterprise In A New Cut And Sew Job, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Such Section; And For Related Purposes.

1404.title: Juvenile Detention and Alternatives Task Force; extend repealer on.
1404.description: An Act To Amend Section 4, Chapter 564, Laws Of 2012, As Amended By Section 1, Chapter 471, Laws Of 2014, Is Amended To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Juvenile Detention And Alternatives Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

1405.title: Ad valorem tax; extend repealer on authority of local governing authorities to exempt vehicles of certain military personnel.
1405.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-51-42.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Governing Authorities To Grant An Exemption From A Certain Amount Of Ad Valorem Taxes On Motor Vehicles Owned By Residents Of This State Who, As Members Of The Mississippi National Guard, The Armed Forces Of The United States Or Any Reserve Component Of The Armed Forces Of The United States, Are Serving On Active Duty And Receiving Special Pay For Duty Subject To Hostile Fire Or Imminent Danger Under 37 Usc 310, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Such Section; And For Related Purposes.

1406.title: Comprehensive Hurricane Damage Mitigation Program; extend repealer on.
1406.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-1-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Comprehensive Hurricane Damage Mitigation Program; And For Related Purposes.

1407.title: Auto club memberships; extend repealer on authority of small loan licensees to sell to borrowers.
1407.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provision Of Law Authorizing Small Loan Licensees To Offer Borrowers The Opportunity To Purchase Auto Club Memberships; And For Related Purposes.

1408.title: School district maintenance fund; extend repealer on requirement that districts with low ending balance file budget cuts plan.
