1614.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Installing New Alternative Fueling Infrastructure For Certain Alternative Fuels; To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Installing A Residential Compressed Natural Gas Fueling System; To Define Certain Terms Used In This Act; To Prescribe The Maximum Amount Of The One-time Credit, Based On The Type Of Qualified Clean-burning Motor Vehicle Fuel Property, Which May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; And For Related Purposes.

1615.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for portion of cost of new alternative fuel vehicle or alternative fuel conversion equipment.
1615.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Purchasing A New Alternative Fuel Vehicle; To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Equipment Installed On A Gasoline Or Diesel Propelled Vehicle To Convert The Vehicle To Operate On An Alternative Fuel; To Define Certain Terms Used In This Act; To Prescribe The Maximum Amount Of The One-time Credit Which May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; And For Related Purposes.

1616.title: Income tax; allow credit to venison processors for part of costs of processing venison for MS Hunter's Harvest Program.
1616.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-7-22.38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A State Income Tax Credit To Venison Processers For A Percentage Of The Production Cost Of Processing Venison Donated By Hunters For The Mississippi Hunter's Harvest Program Of The Mississippi Wildlife Federation For Which The Processer Has Not Been Paid Or Otherwise Received Reimbursement; And For Related Purposes.

1617.title: Mississippi Main Street Investment Act; create.
1617.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Main Street Investment Act; To Provide Definitions For This Act; To Create The Mississippi Main Street Investment Loan Fund; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Program To Make Loans To Municipalities To Assist With Maintaining And Improving The Viability Of Revitalization Zones; To Require A Municipality Desiring A Loan Under This Act To Submit An Application To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Review The Application Of A Municipality In Order To Confirm That The Revitalization Zone Meets The Requirements Of This Act; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish A Deadline For The Submission Of Applications During A State Fiscal Year; To Provide That If A Municipality In Which A Revitalization Zone Is Located Receives A Loan Under This Section, Then The Sales Tax Revenue Collected Within A Revitalization Zone Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The Municipality In Which The Revitalization Zone Is Located And Paid To The Municipality; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority With All Powers Necessary To Implement And Administer The Program Authorized By This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 And Provide That The Proceeds Of Such Bonds Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Main Street Investment Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1618.title: Homestead exemption; increase.
1618.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes For Homesteads; And For Related Purposes.

1619.title: Homestead exemption; increase for persons 65 years of age or older or totally disabled.
1619.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Homestead Exemption For Persons Who Are Sixty-five Years Of Age Or Older Or Who Are Totally Disabled; And For Related Purposes.

1620.title: Alcoholic beverages; revise amount of license tax for certain permits issued under the Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law.
1620.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount Of The License Tax For Certain Permits Issued Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law By Eliminating The Additional Tax That Is Currently Retained By The State For Purchases Exceeding $5,000.00 While Maintaining The Additional Tax For Such Purposes That Is Paid To Local Governments; And For Related Purposes.

1621.title: Facilitating Business Rapid Response to State Declared Disasters Act of 2015; create.
1621.description: An Act To Enact The "facilitating Business Rapid Response To State Declared Disasters Act Of 2015"; To Provide That An Out-of-state Business That Conducts Operations Within The State For Purposes Of Performing Work Or Services Related To A Declared State Disaster Or Emergency During The Disaster Response Period Shall Not Be Considered To Have Established A Level Of Presence That Would Require That Business To Register, File And/or Remit State Or Local Taxes Or That Would Require, That Business Or Its Out-of-state Employees To Be Subject To Certain State Licensing Or Registration Requirements; To Provide That An Employee Of Such A Business Shall Not Be Considered To Have Established Residency Or A Presence In The State That Would Require That Person Or That Person's Employer To File And Pay Income Taxes Or To Be Subjected To Tax Withholdings Or To File And Pay Any Other State Or Local Tax Or Fee During The Disaster Response Period; To Require That Certain Information Regarding An Out-of-state Business Shall, Upon Request, Be Provided To The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Sections 27-7-15, 27-7-37, 27-7-305, 27-7-333, 27-17-9, 27-31-1, 27-65-101, 27-65-107 And 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1622.title: Special local improvement assessments district; authorize municipalities to create.
1622.description: An Act To Authorize Municipalities To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By A Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By A Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By A Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; To Amend Section 21-33-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1623.title: Special local improvement assessment district; authorize municipalities to create.
1623.description: An Act To Authorize Municipalities To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By A Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By A Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By A Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; To Amend Section 21-33-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1624.title: Appropriation; City of Booneville for improving pedestrian travel in the Historic District in Downtown Booneville.
1624.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The City Of Booneville, Mississippi, For The Purpose Of Improving Pedestrian Travel In The Historic District In Downtown Booneville For The Fiscal Year 2016.

1625.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements at state parks.
1625.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For Repairs, Renovations And Capital Improvements At State Parks; And For Related Purposes.

1626.title: Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; increase the amount of investment tax credits that may be allocated under.
1626.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-115-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $50,000,000.00 The Aggregate Amount Of Investment Tax Credits That May Be Allocated To Participating Investors Of Mississippi Small Business Investment Companies Under The Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; To Provide The Taxable Years In Which A Participating Investor May Claim The Additional Credits So Allocated Against His Premium Tax Liability; And For Related Purposes.

1627.title: Bonds; increase amount that may be issued to provide funds for the Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund.
1627.description: An Act To Amend Section 45, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Section 9, Chapter 569, Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Section 16, Chapter 530, Laws Of 2014, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund And To Extend The Time Within Which Such Bonds May Be Issued; And For Related Purposes.

1628.title: Income tax; phase out for individuals.
1628.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The State Income Tax On Individuals; And For Related Purposes.

1629.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for repair of deficient bridges on state maintained highways.
1629.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $200,000,000.00 Of State Revenue Bonds To Provide Funds For The Repair, Rehabilitation, Replacement, Construction And Reconstruction Of Deficient Bridges On State Maintained Highways And To Provide Funds For The State Aid Road Fund; To Create A Special Bond Sinking Fund For The Purpose Of Paying The Debt Service Of Bonds Issued Under This Act; To Provide That The Special Bond Sinking Fund Shall Consist Of A Portion Of The State Gaming Revenue Deposited Into The Fund And Other Amounts As May Be Paid By Appropriation Or Other Authorization Of The Legislature; To Provide That If The Special Bond Sinking Fund Has A Balance In Excess Of The Amount Needed To Pay The Next Maximum Annual Debt Service Requirement Of The Bonds Issued Under This Act, The Excess Monies May Be Transferred Into The Gaming Counties State Assisted Infrastructure Fund; To Create The "2015-2016 City Of Gulfport Aquarium Construction Fund" As A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide That Monies In The Fund Will Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Assist The City Of Gulfport In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction Of An Aquarium Facility; To Create The "2015 Vicksburg Interpretive Center, Catfish Row Museum Fund" As A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide That Monies In The Fund Will Be Used By The Department Of Finance And Administration To Assist The City Of Vicksburg In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To The Vicksburg Interpretive Center, Catfish Row Museum; To Amend Section 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The State Gaming Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The Special Bond Sinking Fund Created In This Act And Into The Other Special Funds Created In This Act; To Discontinue The Deposit Of A Portion Of The State Gaming Revenue Into The Gaming Counties Bond Sinking Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1630.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements at the state-owned shipyard in Jackson county.
1630.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; And For Related Purposes.

1631.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to repair, renovate and refurbish Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center.
1631.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

1632.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Natchez with the construction of a river landing dock along riverfront.
1632.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Natchez, Mississippi,

1633.title: Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Act; create to provide certain incentives for certain health care facilities.
1633.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Act; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority (mda) To Certify A Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Community If Certain Requirements Are Met; To Provide That Municipalities That Have Health Care Master Plans Meeting The Requirements Of This Act May Acquire, Own And Lease Projects For The Purpose Of Targeting The Health Care And Life Science Industry; To Authorize Municipalities To Issue Bonds For The Purposes Of Defraying The Cost Of Acquiring Or Constructing Buildings For Such Projects Or Acquiring Land For Such Projects; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Fund; To Provide That The Purpose Of The Fund Is To Assist In Maximizing Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Economic Development Opportunities Related To Any New Or Expanded Health Care Or Life Science Related Business Or Industry; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Used By Mississippi Development Authority To Make Grants To Local Economic Development Entities To Assist Any New Or Expanding Health Care Or Life Science Related Business Or Industry That Meets The Criteria Provided In This Section When The Assistance Aids The Consummation Of A Project Within A Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Community; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Revolving Loan Fund; To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Disbursed By Mississippi Development Authority As Loans To Qualified Health Care Facilities Or Businesses Located In A Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Community By The Mississippi Development Authority For Costs Associated With Architectural Services, Engineering Services, Project Management Services, And Other Pre-construction And Post-construction Expenses And Construction Costs For Public, Private, For-profit And Nonprofit Entities To Initiate New Ventures Or Expand Existing Ventures; To Provide That To Be Eligible For A Loan Under This Section, The Mississippi Development Authority Must Certify That The Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business For Which The Loan Is Sought Will Create A Minimum Of 25 New Full-time Jobs And/or Have $10,000,000.00 Of Capital Investment; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Job Training Grant Fund; To Provide That The Money In The Fund Shall Be Used For The Purpose Of Making Job Training Grants To Community And Junior Colleges, Public Universities And Local Workforce Investment Areas To Pay A Portion Of The Costs Of Providing Training Or Retraining For Employees Of Qualified Health Care Industry Facilities Or Businesses Locating In A Community That Has A Certified Health Care Zone Master Plan; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Administer The Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Funded By A Diversion Of Sales Tax Revenue; To Provide For The Amount Of The Grants; To Create The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Advantage Jobs Fund; To Provide That The Money In The Fund Shall Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Making The Incentive Payments To Qualified Health Care Facilities Or Businesses; To Provide That A Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business That Provides An Average Annual Salary, Excluding Benefits Which Are Not Subject To Mississippi Income Taxes, Of At Least 100% Of The Most Recently Published State Average Annual Wage Or The Most Recently Published Average Annual Wage Of The County In Which The Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business Is Located As Determined By The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security, Whichever Is The Lesser, And Creates At Least 25 New Direct Jobs, Is Eligible For Incentive Payments; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Funded By A Diversion Of The Withholding Tax Payments Made By The Qualified Health Care Facility Or Business; To Provide The Amount Of The Incentive Payments; To Provide For An Income Tax And Insurance Premium Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Pay A Qualified Community Development Entity For Qualified Equity Investments In A Certified Health Care Zone Master Plan Community; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Shall Be Equal To A Certain Percentage Of The Adjusted Purchase Price Paid To The Qualified Community Development Entity For The Qualified Equity Investment; To Provide That The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of The Credits That May Be Allocated To All Taxpayers In Any One State Fiscal Year Shall Not Exceed $5,000,000.00 And That The Credits Shall Be Allocated By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide For The Recapture Of All Or A Portion Of The Credit Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 27-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Investments That May Reduce A Taxpayer's Insurance Premium Tax Liability Under Such Section Shall Not Include Any Investment For Which Such A Credit Is Allocated Under This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Master Plan Revolving Loan Fund; To Amend Sections 27-7-312, 21-33-303 And 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1634.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Marty Stuart Center for Country Music.
1634.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Marty Stuart Center For Country Music In Philadelphia, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1635.title: Gas severance tax; include carbon dioxide within definition of gas and remove certain exemptions.
1635.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-25-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Carbon Dioxide Within The Definition Of The Term "gas" For Purposes Of The Gas Severance Tax Laws; To Amend Section 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Gas Severance Tax Exemption Provided For Gas Lawfully Injected Into The Earth For Cycling, Repressuring, Lifting Or Enhancing The Recovery Of Oil; To Amend Section 27-25-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Credit Against The Oil Severance Tax Levied On The Value Of Oil At The Point Of Production On Oil Produced By An Enhanced Oil Recovery Method In Which Carbon Dioxide Is Used; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Shall Be The Amount Of Gas Severance Tax Paid On The Carbon Dioxide Used In The Enhanced Oil Recovery Method To Produce The Oil; To Bring Forward Section 27-25-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Defines Certain Terms Under The Oil Severance Tax Laws, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1636.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements at the state-owned shipyard in Jackson County.
1636.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; And For Related Purposes.

1637.title: Income tax credit; allow for businesses that develop or contract for development of mobile apps to promote the business.
1637.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-7-22.39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Businesses That Develop Their Own Mobile Apps For Mobile Computing Devices To Help Promote The Business Or Contract With Mississippi-based Mobile App Developers To Develop Mobile Apps To Help Promote The Business; To Provide That The Income Tax Credit Shall Be Available To The Business Only One Time And For Only One Mobile App, Regardless Of How Many Mobile Apps The Business Develops Or Contracts For The Development Of; And For Related Purposes.

1638.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for IHL and state agencies capital improvements.
1638.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning And State Agencies; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Completion Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Mississippi Civil Rights Museum And The New Museum Of Mississippi History; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building And Related Facilities To House The Center For Manufacturing Technology Excellence At The East Mississippi Community College Golden Triangle Campus In Lowndes County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Constructing And Making Improvements To The Long Leaf Trace And Gordon Creek; And For Related Purposes.

1639.title: Industrial Development Authority of Marshall County; authorize to create Spring Economic Development Area.
1639.description: An Act To Authorize The Industrial Development Authority Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Create The Springs Economic Development Area In Marshall County, Mississippi, And In The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi; To Authorize The Industrial Development Authority Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Develop Public And Private Partnerships To Facilitate The Economic Growth Of The Area By Providing Developed Sites For The Location And Construction Of Manufacturing Plants, Distribution Facilities, Research Facilities, Regional And National Offices With Supportive Services And Facilities; To Grant The Economic Development Authority Certain Powers And Duties Related Thereto; To Authorize The Authority To Issue Bonds In Amounts Necessary To Achieve The Purposes Of This Act; To Authorize The Authority To Make Temporary Borrowings And Issue Refunding Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

1640.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Pat Harrison Waterway District improvements.
1640.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Pat Harrison Waterway District In Paying Costs Associated With Capital Improvements To District Properties; To Amend Chapter 464, Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Section 2, Chapter 553, Laws Of 2010, To Revise The Purposes For Which Bond Proceeds Deposited Into The Pat Harrison Waterway District Lake Improvements Fund May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

1641.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Wayne County with construction of justice court building.
1641.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Wayne County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Justice Court Building And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1642.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for MS Community Heritage Preservation Grant Funds, disburse grants to repair and renovate Greene County Courthouse.
1642.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $5,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Disbursement Of Grant Funds To Greene County, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Greene County Courthouse; And For Related Purposes.

1643.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Booneville with certain improvements in downtown historic district.
1643.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Booneville, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To And Upgrades Of Sidewalks, Streets, Parking Areas And Other Facilities In The Historic District Of Downtown Booneville; And For Related Purposes.

1644.title: Appropriation; Health Dept. for funding the Municipal Water, Sewer and Wastewater Systems Repair and Replacement Grant Program.
1644.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Municipal Water, Sewer And Wastewater Systems Repair And Replacement Grant Program For The Fiscal Year 2016.

1645.title: Motor fuel taxes; increase.
1645.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Gasoline And Aviation Gasoline Excise Taxes; To Amend Sections 27-55-519 And 27-55-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Special Fuel Excise Tax; To Amend Section 27-59-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Compressed Gas, Compressed Natural Gas, Liquefied Natural Gas And Natural Gas Taxes; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Distribution Of Fuel Taxes, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1646.title: Taxes; phase out income tax and increase motor fuel taxes.
1646.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The State Income Tax; To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Gasoline And Aviation Gasoline Excise Taxes; To Amend Sections 27-55-519 And 27-55-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Special Fuel Excise Tax; To Amend Section 27-59-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Compressed Gas, Compressed Natural Gas, Liquefied Natural Gas And Natural Gas Taxes; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Distribution Of Fuel Taxes, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1647.title: Workforce Training Mitigation Act of 2015; authorize issuance of bonds for construction of workforce training facility in certain area of state.
1647.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Of Construction Of A Workforce Training Facility For An Industrial Site In The State; To Provide That Such A Facility Shall Be Located In An Area Of The State That Has Access To Multimodal Rail Transportation And New Highways, Close Proximity To Major Air Transportation And A Deficiency In A Trained Workforce; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Select The Location Of The Facility Based On Such Criteria And Where The Authority Determines Will Best Maximize The Industrial Opportunities Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

1648.title: City of Pascagoula; remove repeal date on tourism tax authorized to be levied on prepared foods sold at restaurants.
1648.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 923, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Delete The Date Of Repeal Of July 1, 2017, On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From The Sale Of Prepared Foods By Restaurants In The City And Provides That The City May Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Implement A Comprehensive Parks And Recreation Master Plan Adopted By The City; And For Related Purposes.

1649.title: City of Ridgeland; authorize the city to levy an additional sales tax for certain purposes.
1649.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; And For Related Purposes.

1650.title: City of Charleston; authorize Tallahatchie County to assist in the acquisition, building, construction and equipping of rec. facility.
1650.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Assist The Board Of Commissioners Of The City Of Charleston, Mississippi, In The Acquisition, Building, Construction And Equipping Of A Recreational Facility Or Recreational Facilities Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

1651.title: Lee county; authorize annual contributions to Sanctuary Hospice House.
1651.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Sanctuary Hospice House; And For Related Purposes.

1652.title: Lowndes County; authorize construction of multi-purpose horse/livestock pavilion and its appurtenances on certain property.
1652.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County, Mississippi, To Construct A Multi-purpose Horse/livestock Pavilion/arena Which Shall Be Utilized As A Public Facility; And For Related Purposes.

1653.title: City of Jackson; authorize to regulate and prohibit placement and continued use of private water wells in municipal utility service area.
1653.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Regulate And Prohibit The Placement And Continued Use Of Private Water Wells Within The Boundaries Of The Municipal Utility Service Area; And For Related Purposes.

1654.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize tax on hotels, motels and restaurants for recreation and tourism venues and facilities.
1654.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Sales Tax Of Not More Than Two Percent On The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Recreation And Tourism Facilities; To Authorize Such Governing Authorities To Issue Bonds For The Purpose Of Purchasing Property, Constructing Or Leasing A Sports Complex And To Authorize The Governing Authorities To Lease City-owned Property For A Term Not To Exceed 20 Years For A Nominal Fee; And For Related Purposes.

1655.title: City of Jackson; extend repeal date on Jackson Convention and Visitors Bureau.
1655.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 941, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 954, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2015, To July 1, 2018, On The Provisions Of Law Which Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Impose A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; To Require An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1656.title: City of Morton; authorize imposition of local sales tax to fund the repair, rehabilitation and reconstruction of roadways in.
1656.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Morton, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than One Percent On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of Seven Percent Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 70% Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City Solely To Fund The Repair, Rehabilitation And Reconstruction Of Roadways Within The Corporate Limits Of The City; To Provide That The Imposition Of The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Repealed On A Date Certain; And For Related Purposes.

1657.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize contribution to Mid-State Opportunity, Inc.
1657.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To Mid-state Opportunity, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1658.title: City of New Albany; authorize to extend its natural gas distribution system to certain areas of Union and Marshall Counties.
1658.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of New Albany, Mississippi, To Extend Its Natural Gas Distribution System To All Areas Of Union County, Mississippi, Not Certificated To Or Otherwise Served By Any Other Natural Gas Utility And To Certain Areas Of Marshall County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1659.title: City of Quitman; authorize imposition of local sales tax to fund additions/improvements at sports complex.
1659.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Quitman, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide The Purpose For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; To Provide A Certain Date Of Repeal For The Authority Of The Imposition Of The Special Sales Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1660.title: Madison County; authorize hiring of an assistant county prosecuting attorney.
1660.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Madison County, Mississippi, To Employ An Assistant County Prosecuting Attorney And To Prescribe The Compensation For Such Attorney; And For Related Purposes.

1661.title: Harrison County; authorize to clean blighted property.
1661.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County To Conduct Hearings To Determine Whether Certain Property Within The County Is Blighted Property; To Require The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Notice To The Owners Of "blighted" Property; To Provide The Form And Manner Of The Notice; To Authorize The County To Charge The Actual Costs Of Correcting The Blighted Property; To Authorize The County To Assess Penalties Against The Property; And For Related Purposes.

1662.title: Bolivar County; authorize to enter into road and bridge improvement contracts regardless if contracts are 30 days beyond board's term.
1662.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Bolivar County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Certain Road And Bridge Improvement Contracts Regardless Of Whether The Contracts May Extend Beyond 30 Days From The Termination And End Of The Term Of Office Of The Members Of The Board Of Supervisors Awarding The Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

1663.title: City of Starkville; extend repeal date on economic development, tourism/convention tax.
1663.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 950, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, As Amended By Chapter 1014, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of The Tax Collected Under This Act Shall Be Allocated To Starkville Parks Rather Than The Starkville Park Commission; To Extend The Repeal Date From June 30, 2015, To June 30, 2018, On The City Of Starkville's Economic Development, Tourism And Convention Tax; To Provide An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of The Levying Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1664.title: DeSoto County; authorize contribution to Historic DeSoto Foundation, Inc.
1664.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Historic Desoto Foundation, Inc., Through Calendar Year 2016; And For Related Purposes.

1665.title: Sebastopol Natural Gas District; correct the description of the district.
1665.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 998, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Last Amended By Chapter 943, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Correct The Description Of The Boundaries Of The Sebastopol Natural Gas District; To Reenact The Provision That Grants The Board Of Commissioners Of The Sebastopol Natural Gas District The Discretion To Sell Bonds Issued By The Board On Sealed Bids At Public Sale Or At Private Sale; And For Related Purposes.

1666.title: City of Laurel; revise purpose for which "recreation and public improvement tax" may be used once current bond issues are paid off for project.
1666.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 983, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Amended By Chapter 957, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, To Provide That When Current Bond Issues For The City Of Laurel, Mississippi, For A Certain Project Are Completely Satisfied And Paid In Full, Then The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Laurel, Mississippi, May Utilize The Proceeds Of The Tourism Tax To Pay For The Maintenance Cost Of The Project As Well As To Support Parks And Recreation And Tourism Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

1667.title: Cities of Pascagoula; authorize the creation of community redevelopment areas within existing urban renewal areas in the city.
1667.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Establish Community Redevelopment Areas Within Existing Urban Renewal Areas In The City; To Require Redevelopment Trust Funds To Be Created For Such Areas; To Provide The Purposes For Which Funds In Such Trust Funds May Be Utilized, Including The Awarding Of Grants To Private Real Property Owners To Pay The Cost Of Exterior And Interior Improvements To Property In The Community Redevelopment Area That Will Result In The Improved Appearance And Functionality Of The Property; To Provide That Any Increase In The Sales Taxes Collected In The Community Redevelopment Area And Diverted To The City Shall Be Deposited Into The Redevelopment Trust Fund For The Community Redevelopment Area To Fund The Grants Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1668.title: City of Gautier; authorize the creation of community redevelopment areas within existing urban renewal areas in the city.
1668.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Establish Community Redevelopment Areas Within Existing Urban Renewal Areas In The City; To Require Redevelopment Trust Funds To Be Created For Such Areas; To Provide The Purposes For Which Funds In Such Trust Funds May Be Utilized, Including The Awarding Of Grants To Private Real Property Owners To Pay The Cost Of Exterior And Interior Improvements To Property In The Community Redevelopment Area That Will Result In The Improved Appearance And Functionality Of The Property; To Provide That Any Increase In The Sales Taxes Collected In The Community Redevelopment Area And Diverted To The City Shall Be Deposited Into The Redevelopment Trust Fund For The Community Redevelopment Area To Fund The Grants Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1669.title: Humphreys County; authorize issuance of bonds to refund certain taxes erroneously collected.
1669.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Humphreys County, Mississippi, To Issue Bonds To Satisfy A Certain Court Judgment Directing The Refund Of An Overpayment Of Taxes; To Provide For The Issuance, Sale And Payment Of Principal And Interest On Such Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

1670.title: Northeast MS Planning and Development District; authorize various counties and cities within district to receive loans or grants for certain purposes.
1670.description: An Act To Authorize The Boards Of Supervisors Of Alcorn County, Benton County, Marshall County, Prentiss County, Tippah County And Tishomingo County And The Governing Authorities Of The Municipalities Of Ashland, Baldwyn, Belmont, Blue Mountain, Booneville, Burnsville, Byhalia, Corinth, Dumas, Falkner, Farmington, Glen, Golden, Hickory Flat, Holly Springs, Iuka, Jumperton, Kossuth, Marietta, Paden, Potts Camp, Rienzi, Ripley, Snow Lake Shores, Tishomingo And Walnut To Apply For And Receive Loans Or Grant Funds Made Available By The Northeast Mississippi Planning And Development District For Economic And Community Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1671.title: Jackson County; authorize tax on hotels and motels with revenue paid to the Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention and Visitors Bureau.
1671.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In Jackson County If The Levy Of The Tax Is Approved By 60% Of The Qualified Electors Of The County Voting At An Election Called For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Paid To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau To Be Used For The Promotion Of Tourism On The Mississippi Gulf Coast; And For Related Purposes.

1672.title: Sunflower County; authorize to borrow money to pay certain ad valorem tax refund for taxes collected in error.
1672.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Sunflower County, Mississippi, To Borrow Money Evidenced By Negotiable Notes Or Certificates Of Indebtedness To Pay Refunds Of Ad Valorem Tax Payments Collected In Error If The Aggregate Amount Collected Erroneously Is In Excess Of $100,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

1673.title: Alcorn County; may enter into certain road and bridge maintenance and/or construction contracts even if they extend 30 days beyond board's term.
1673.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Alcorn County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Certain Road And Bridge Improvement Contracts Regardless Of Whether The Contracts May Extend Beyond 30 Days From The Termination And End Of The Term Of Office Of The Members Of The Board Of Supervisors Awarding The Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

1674.title: City of Oxford; authorize use of dual-phase design-build method of construction contracting for parking facilities.
1674.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Utilize The Dual-phase Design-build Method Of Construction Contracting For The Construction Of Parking Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1675.title: City of Corinth; authorize imposition of local sales tax.
1675.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Corinth, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Business In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide For An Election On The Question Of Imposing The Special Sales Tax; To Authorize The City To Incur Indebtedness In An Amount Not Greater Than An Amount Whose Debt Service Is Capable Of Being Funded By The Proceeds Of The Special Sales Tax; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Revenue Collected Pursuant To Such Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City Only To Fund Infrastructure Projects And Economic Development Projects; And For Related Purposes.

1676.title: City of Hattiesburg; authorize annual contributions to Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Inc.
1676.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hattiesburg To Contribute Funds Through Calendar Year 2017 To The Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Incorporated, For The Purpose Of Revitalizing Downtown Hattiesburg; And For Related Purposes.

1677.title: North Tunica Fire Protection District; authorize increase in mills on real and personal property for support of district.
1677.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Increase By Three (3) Mills The Maximum Amount The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County May Levy Upon Both Real And Personal Property Within The North Tunica Fire Protection District For The Operation, Maintenance And Support Of Such District; To Provide That The Levy Shall Not Be Imposed Upon Certain Utilities; And For Related Purposes.

1678.title: Washington County; extend date of repeal on hotel/motel tax for purposes of funding a sports complex for youth.
1678.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 951, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2015, To July 1, 2018, On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Washington County, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Of Up To Two Percent On The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals Within The County To Fund The Establishment Of A Sports Complex For Youth Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1679.title: Tishomingo County Water District; revise method in which commissioners are selected.
1679.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Provide For The Election Of The Board Of Commissioners Of The Tishomingo County Water District, Inc., Rather Than The Appointment Of Such Commissioners By The Board Of Supervisors; To Provide When The Initial Election Is To Be Held And When Such Commissioners Are To Take Office After Their Election; To Provide That Any Measures That Are Passed And Business That Is Conducted By Such Commissioners Shall Require A Majority Vote Of The Commissioners Rather Than A Unanimous Vote; And For Related Purposes.

1680.title: Claiborne County; authorize transfer of certain building.
1680.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Claiborne County, Mississippi, And The Commissioners Of The Claiborne County Port Commission To Transfer And Convey To Theater Plus, Inc., Also Known As The Blue Barn Theater, A Certain Building Located In The Industrial Park Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1681.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create special local improvement assessments district.
1681.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By The Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

1682.title: Hinds County; authorize to create the Hinds County Utility Authority.
1682.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County, Mississippi, To Create The Hinds County Utility Authority; To Provide That The Authority Shall Be Governed By A Board Of Directors; To Provide For The Membership Of The Board Of Directors; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Authority; To Authorize The Authority To Acquire, Construct, Maintain, Operate, Expand And/or Decommission Water Systems And/or Wastewater Systems Within The Designated Area Of Hinds County; To Authorize Political Subdivisions And/or Other Persons That Provide Water And/or Wastewater Services To Contract With The Authority; To Authorize The Hinds County Utility Authority To Issue Revenue Bonds To Provide Funds Necessary To Achieve The Purposes Of This Act; To Authorize The Hinds County Utility Authority, With The Approval Of The Affected Political Subdivisions And/or Persons Providing Water, And/or Wastewater To Enter Into Contracts With The Owners Of Property To Provide Improvements Necessary To Provide Services Related To Water And/or Wastewater; To Authorize The Authority To Request That The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County Or Any Political Subdivision Utilize Eminent Domain On Behalf Of The Authority; To Provide That The Authority May Issue Special Assessment Bonds To Finance Such Improvements And To Authorize The Authority To Levy And Collect Special Assessments Against The Property Benefited Thereby To Retire Such Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

1683.title: Suffrage; restore to Marilyn S. Watkins of Pike County, MS.
1683.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Marilyn S. Watkins Of Pike County, Mississippi.

1684.title: Suffrage; restore to June L. Carraway-Bourne of Lamar County.
1684.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To June Carraway-bourne Of Lamar County, Mississippi.

1685.title: Suffrage; restore to Timothy Wilson of Tishomingo County.
1685.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Timothy Wilson Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi.

1686.title: City of Hattiesburg; may enter into certain contracts concerning its wastewater system.
1686.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts For The Design, Construction, Collection, Storage, Transportation, Treatment And/or Disposal Of Wastewater; To Authorize The City To Enter Into Operating Agreements For The Operation Of All Or Any Portions Of The City's Wastewater Collection, Storage, Transportation, Treatment Or Other Systems; To Authorize Such Contracts Or Agreements To Be For A Term Not To Exceed 30 Years; To Provide The Manner Of Awarding Such Contracts Or Operating Agreements That Involve The Expenditure By The City Of More Than $50,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

1687.title: Suffrage; restore to Kenneth King of Noxubee, County.
1687.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Kenneth King Of Noxubee County, Mississippi.

1688.title: Suffrage;restore to Orlando Robinson of Noxubee County.
1688.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Orlando Robinson Of Noxubee County, Mississippi.

1689.title: Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame; Jim Brewer, board of directors; commend.
1689.description: A Resolution Commending The Mississippi Musicians Hall Of Fame, Its Founder Jim Brewer, And Board Of Directors, For Honoring Great Mississippi Musicians.

1690.title: Mrs. Ruby Jefferson Worsham; commend upon the passing of.
1690.description: A Resolution Commending The Outstanding Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Mrs. Ruby Jefferson Worsham And Expressing Deepest Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1691.title: Andre Keith Griffin; commend the life upon the passing of.
1691.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Andre Keith Griffin And Expressing Deepest Sympathy Upon His Passing.

1692.title: Father Louis "Louie" Lohan; commend upon retirement from Diocese of Biloxi and pastor of St. Thomas.
1692.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Father Louis "louie" Lohan Upon The Special Occasion Of His Retirement From The Diocese Of Biloxi And As Pastor Of St. Thomas The Apostle Catholic Church.

1693.title: House Rules; provide procedures for member to speak at podium when House is not convened and for speech to be telecasted.
1693.description: A Resolution To Amend House Rule 18c, 2012-2016 Rules Of The House Of Representatives, To Provide A Procedure For A Member To Speak At The Podium When The House Is Not Convened And For The Member's Speech To Be Telecasted.

1694.title: Patricia Neely-Dorsey; commend her works as a poet.
1694.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Talented Poet And Native Mississippian, Patricia Neely-dorsey, For Her Many Achievements As A Writer, And Extend Best Wishes For Many More Years Of Success.

1695.title: Mississippi State Medical Association Alliance; congratulate on 10th anniversary of the Capitol Screening Initiative.
1695.description: A Resolution Saluting And Congratulating The Mississippi State Medical Association Alliance On The 10th Anniversary Of The Capitol Screening Initiative (csi) And Its Focus On The Importance Of Medical Screenings In The Preservation Of The Lives Of Mississippians On January 15, 2015.

1696.title: Clara Jean Richardson Sizer; commending the life and legacy upon the passing of.
1696.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Clara Jean Richardson Sizer And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1697.title: Magnolia Heights School; commend and congratulate for Apple Distinguished School recognition.
1697.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Magnolia Heights School For Being Recognized As An Apple Distinguished School For Its Unique Implementation Of Apple Technology.

1698.title: Pearl River Community College; commend men and women's soccer teams for championship.
1698.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl River Community College Wildcat Men's And Women's Soccer Teams On Earning The Title Of 2014 Region 23 Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior College Championship.

1699.title: "Adopt a Shelter Pet Week"; recognize week of October 18-24, 2015, as in Mississippi.
1699.description: A Resolution Declaring The Week Of October 18-24, 2015, As "adopt A Shelter Pet Week" In Mississippi.

1700.title: Alcorn State University Braves Football Team; commend and congratulate on winning the 2014 SWAC Championship.
1700.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Alcorn State University Braves Football Team On Their Outstanding 2014 Season, Finishing With A 10-3 Overall Record, Winning The 2014 Southwestern Athletic Conference Championship, And Being Ranked No. 1 In The Fcs As The 2014 Black College National Champions.

1701.title: Betty Faye Brunt McGrath; commend life and legacy of.
1701.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of Betty Faye Brunt Mcgrath, And Expressing Deepest Heartfelt Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1702.title: Chief Deputy Otha V. Jones; commend life and service of upon his passing.
1702.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life, Legacy And Contributions Of Chief Deputy Otha V. Jones, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1703.title: Mr. Tommie Lee Williams, Sr.; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1703.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Tommie Lee Williams, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1704.title: Philadelphia High School "Lady Tornadoes" Slow-pitch Softball Team; commend for winning MHSAA Class 3A State Championship.
1704.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Philadelphia High School "lady Tornadoes" Slow-pitch Softball Team And Coach Austin Mcnair For Winning The 2014 Mhsaa Class 3a State Championship.

1705.title: Neshoba Central Lady Rockets; commend upon winning 2014 MHSAA Class 5A-6A slow-pitch softball championship.
1705.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central High School Lady Rockets Slow-pitch Softball Team And Head Coach Trae Embry For Winning The 2014 Mhsaa Class 5a-6a State Championship.

1706.title: Deaconess Marguerite Varnado Pittman; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
1706.description: A Resolution Commending The Outstanding Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Deaconess Marguerite Varnado Pittman And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1707.title: Mrs. Johnnie Mae Tyson; commend and congratulate on the occasion of her 80th birthday.
1707.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Johnnie Mae Tyson On Celebrating The Most Auspicious Occasion Of The 80th Anniversary Of Her Birth On February 16, 2015.

1708.title: Malcolm Butler; commend and congratulate outstanding performance in Super Bowl XLIX.
1708.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Malcolm Butler For His Outstanding Performance In Helping The New England Patriots Win Super Bowl Xlix.

1709.title: Kossuth High School Cheerleading Team; commend and congratulate upon winning State Championship.

1827.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending Mr. Cayce Depoyster For Providing 34 Years Of Exceptional Service To The Students In Prentiss County, Mississippi.

1828.title: Masters Quartet; congratulate upon occasion of its 25th anniversary.
1828.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Masters Quartet Upon The Occasion Of Their 25th Anniversary.

1829.title: Mr. John M. Hairston; commend upon many accomplishments with the Gaming Commission and financial industry.
1829.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. John M. Hairston Upon His Retirement As An Outstanding Member Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission And Honoring His Impressive Leadership As President And Chief Executive Officer Of Hancock Holding Company, Hancock Bank And Whitney Bank.

1830.title: Barbara Dunn; commend distinguished service as Hinds County Circuit Clerk upon her retirement.
1830.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished Legacy Of Public Service And Esteemed Career Of Mrs. Barbara Dunn As Hinds County Circuit Clerk Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement.

1831.title: Honorable Judge Henry W. Palmer; commend life and legacy of public service upon his passing.
1831.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of The Honorable Judge Henry W. Palmer, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1832.title: Slavery; issue apology for state's role in.
1832.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, And Expressing Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, And Urging Reconciliation.

1833.title: Mack A. Jordan; commend the life of Medal of Honor recipient.
1833.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Courageous Life And Extraordinary Legacy Of Posthumous Korean War Medal Of Honor Recipient Private First Class Mack A. Jordan.

1834.title: Constitution; amend to authorize the Legislature to grant certain authority for metropolitan governmental creation.
1834.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Law Which Grants Authority To The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Law Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1835.title: Biggert-Waters Act of 2012; request Congress to repeal certain provisions and declare certain effects of as a taking.
1835.description: A Concurrent Resolution Opposing The Biggert-waters Flood Insurance Reform Act Of 2012 And Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Repeal Provisions Of The Act That Result In An Increase Of Flood Insurance Rates And Request That Dramatic Increases In Flood Insurance Rates Due To The Act Be Considered A Regulatory Or Constructive Taking Requiring Just Compensation To The Property Owner.

1836.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1836.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Sections 140 And 142 And Repealing Section 141 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1837.title: Mrs. Ruby Jefferson Worsham; commend the life and legacy of.
1837.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Outstanding Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Mrs. Ruby Jefferson Worsham And Expressing Deepest Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1838.title: Father Louis "Louie" Lohan; commend upon retirement after 43 years of service to Diocese of Biloxi.
1838.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Father Louis "louie" Lohan Upon The Special Occasion Of His Retirement From The Diocese Of Biloxi And As Pastor Of St. Thomas The Apostle Catholic Church.

1839.title: Constitution; legislative alternative to Initiative No. 42 regarding public schools funding.
1839.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 201 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Offered By The Mississippi Legislature As An Alternative To Initiative Measure No. 42, To Require The Legislature To Provide, By General Law, For The Establishment, Maintenance And Support Of An Effective System Of Free Public Schools; And For Related Purposes.

1840.title: Constitution; amend to change day of general election for state and county officers from Tuesday to Saturday.
1840.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day Of The General Election For State And County Elected Officers From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1841.title: Constitution; amend to provide that minimum age to serve in the Mississippi House of Representatives is 18 years.
1841.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From 21 Years To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1842.title: State of Mississippi; urge to take critical and fundamental actions to improve the state's economic and social rankings.
1842.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Economic And Social Rankings And Encouraging Mississippi Agencies, And Public And Private Entities To Take Critical And Fundamental Actions To Improve Mississippi's Economic And Social Rankings.

1843.title: State appointments, certain; urge to reflect more of the demographics and diversity of the state.
1843.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging That State Appointments For Agency Directors, Commissioners And Boards Be More Reflective Of The Demographics And Diversity Of The State Of Mississippi.

1844.title: State of poverty in Mississippi; acknowledge need for improved economic viability and increased awareness.
1844.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The State Of Poverty In The State Of Mississippi, Recognizing The State's 20 Poorest Counties And Their Impact On The Overall Status Of Our State, And Encouraging The Improvement Of Their Economic Viability Through Increased Awareness And Creation Of Opportunity By Emphasizing The Importance Of The Inter-relationship With All 82 Counties As It Relates To The Social And Economic Rankings In The State Of Mississippi.

1845.title: Alvin Max Juchheim, Jr.; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1845.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Captain Alwin Max Juchheim, Jr., Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1846.title: Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame; commend.
1846.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Mississippi Musicians Hall Of Fame, Its Founder, Jim Brewer, And The Board Of Directors, For Honoring Great Mississippi Musicians.

1847.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the minimum age to serve in Mississippi State Senate is 18 years.
1847.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From 25 To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1848.title: South Panola Tigers; commend for winning the MHSAA 6A State Championship.
1848.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2014 South Panola High School Tigers Football Team And Veteran Head Coach Lance Pogue For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Championship.

1849.title: Jasmine Murray; commend and congratulate on being crowned Miss Mississippi 2014.
1849.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Columbus, Mississippi, Native Jasmine Murray Upon Being Crowned Miss Mississippi 2014 And Successful Top 10 Finish In The 2014 Miss America Pageant.

1850.title: Honorable Terry W. Brown, Sr.; commend life and legacy of public service upon his passing.
1850.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of The Honorable Terry W. Brown, Sr., President Pro Tempore Of The Mississippi Senate, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family, Colleagues And Friends Upon His Passing.

1851.title: Joint session; call to hear State of the State address of Governor Phil Bryant.
1851.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1852.title: Constitution; amend to require Legislature to enact a balanced budget for each fiscal year.
1852.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 69a To Require The Legislature To Enact A Balanced Budget Of The Entire Expenditures And Revenues Of The State For Each Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

1853.title: Constitution; provide that defense of double jeopardy shall not be available to person accused of killing unarmed person.
1853.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 22, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Defense Of Double Jeopardy, Which Protects A Person Against A Second Prosecution For The Same Offense After Acquittal Or Conviction And Against Multiple Punishments For The Same Offense, Shall Not Be An Available Defense To Any Person Who Is Accused Of Killing An Unarmed Person; And For Related Purposes.

1854.title: Taylor Renee Harris; commend and congratulate upon being named a royal court debutante for the Original Illinois Club.
1854.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ms. Taylor Renee Harris Upon Being Selected As A Royal Court Debutante For The Original Illinois Club; And For Related Purposes.

1856.title: Constitution; revise voter initiative procedure to conform signature requirements to number of exiting congressional districts.
1856.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 273, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Relates To The Power Of The People To Enact Constitutional Amendments By Initiative, To Conform The Maximum Percentage Of The Number Of Signatures Of Qualified Electors Allowed From Any Single Congressional District To The Percentage That The District Represents In Relation To The Total Number Of Congressional Districts; And For Related Purposes.

1857.title: Constitution; establish legal holidays of African American Day and of Women's Day.
1857.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Establish Two Legal Holidays In The Constitution, In Addition To Those Which May Be Provided By The Legislature In General Law; To Designate The Last Day Of February As "african American Day" And August 26 As "women's Day"; And For Related Purposes.

1858.title: Constitution; amend to provide that Legislature shall meet in regular session only once every two years.
1858.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2020, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; And For Related Purposes.

1859.title: Constitution; amend to enact state minimum wage and provide for future increases.
1859.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact A State Minimum Wage Law For Employees Not Receiving Tips That Will Increase From Seven Dollars Twenty-five Cents To Ten Dollars Ten Cents In The Next Two Years And Enact A State Minimum Wage For Tipped Employees That Will Increase From Three Dollars To Seventy Percent Of The Wage For Employees Not Receiving Tips In The Next Two Years; And For Related Purposes.

1860.title: Pearl Street African Methodist Episcopal Church; commend on celebrating 150th anniversary.
1860.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Pearl Street African Methodist Episcopal Church Upon The Occasion Of Its Historic Anniversary, Acknowledging The Celebration Of 150 Years Of Devout Faith And Spiritual Excellence.

1861.title: Alcorn State University Braves Football Team; commend and congratulate upon winning the 2014 SWAC Championship.
1861.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Alcorn State University Braves Football Team On Their Outstanding 2014 Season, Finishing With A 10-3 Overall Record, Winning The 2014 Southwestern Athletic Conference Championship, And Being Ranked No. 1 In The Fcs As The 2014 Black College National Champions.

1862.title: Mr. Cayle "Casey" Coleman; commend life, legacy and service of upon his passing.
1862.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mr. Cayle "casey" Coleman, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1863.title: Dyslexia; urge all schools and state and local educational entities to recognize the educational implications of.
1863.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging All Schools And State And Local Educational Agencies To Recognize Significant Educational Implications Of Dyslexia And To Take The Necessary Actions To Address The Learning Needs And Quality Of Services Provided To Those Affected.

1864.title: Mr. David Abney; commend on being named 11th CEO of the United Parcel Service (UPS).
1864.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. David Abney Upon Being Named The 11th Chief Executive Officer Of The United Parcel Service (ups).

1865.title: U.S. Congress; urge to hold a constitutional convention of states to impose fiscal restraints on federal government.
1865.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States To Require That In The Absence Of A National Emergency The Total Of All Federal Outlays Made By The Congress For Any Fiscal Year May Not Exceed The Total Of All Estimated Federal Revenues For That Fiscal Year.

1866.title: U.S. Constitution; application to Congress for calling a convention to propose amendments that require a balanced federal budget.
1866.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A Convention Of The States Under Article V Of The Constitution Of The United States For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing Amendments To The Constitution Of The United States To Require The Federal Government To Adopt A Balanced Budget.

1867.title: U.S. Constitution; application to Congress for calling a convention to propose amendments that address concerns raised by Citizens United.
1867.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A Convention Of The States Under Article V Of The Constitution Of The United States For The Purpose Of Proposing Amendments To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To The Regulation Of Campaign Spending By Organization.

1868.title: U.S. Constitution; application to Congress for calling a convention to propose amendments that address concerns raised by Citizens United v. FEC.
1868.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A Convention Of The States Under Article V Of The Constitution Of The United States For The Purpose Of Proposing Amendments To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To The Regulation Of Campaign Spending By Organization.

1869.title: Laurel High School football team; commend and congratulate for winning MHSAA 5A State Championship.
1869.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2014 Laurel High School Tornadoes Football Team And Head Coach Todd Breland For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 5a State Championship.

1870.title: Newton County Academy Generals; commend and congratulate for winning the MAIS Class A State Football Championship.
1870.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2014 Newton County Academy Generals Football Team And Veteran Head Coach Robert Roberts For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Class A State Championship.

1871.title: Mrs. Ruby Buckley Bines Barnes; commend and congratulate on the occasion of her 100th birthday.
1871.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Longevity Of Mrs. Ruby Buckley Bines Barnes And Congratulating Her On Celebrating The Occasion Of Her 100th Birthday On January 11, 2015.

1872.title: Dr. Glenda B. Glover; commend and congratulate for selection as 1st Supreme Anti-Basileus for AKA Sorority, Inc.
1872.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Glenda B. Glover Upon Her Selection As First Supreme Anti-basileus For Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.

1873.title: Terry W. Straughter; commend his life and legacy upon passing.
1873.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Terry William Slaughter, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1874.title: Mr. Sipp, "The Mississippi Blues Child"; commend and congratulate on winning the 30th International Blues Challenge.
1874.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Vicksburg Blues Society Musician, Mr. Castro Coleman, Also Known As Mr. Sipp, "the Mississippi Blues Child" Upon Being Crowned The 2014 Champion Of The 30th Annual International Blues Challenge Presented By The Blues Foundation In Memphis, Tennessee.

1875.title: Ole Miss Football Team; commend on outstanding season and impressive 9-4 record.
1875.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2014 Ole Miss Rebels Football Team For An Outstanding Season Finishing With An Impressive 9-4 Record.

1876.title: Coach Morris Brown; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1876.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Coach Morris Brown, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1877.title: Agent Marc Lee Whatley,Sr.; commend life, legacy and public service of upon his passing.
1877.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Public Service Of Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics Agent Marc Lee Whatley, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing While Honoring His Legacy With Legislation Proposing The Designation Of A Segment Of Mississippi Highway 15 In Jones County, Mississippi, Beginning At Its Intersection With Trace Road And Extending Northerly To Its Intersection With Mississippi Highway 537 As The "marc Lee Whatley Memorial Highway."

1878.title: Mrs. Lena Bell Darby; commend life, legacy and heritage upon her passing.
1878.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Mrs. Lena Bell Darby And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1879.title: Mr. Johnny Louis Perkins; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1879.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mr. Johnny Louis Perkins And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1880.title: Billy J. Orr; recognize distinguished career of as Exec. Dir. of the Mississippi Fair Commission upon his retirement.
1880.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Mr. Billy J. Orr Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The Executive Director Of The Mississippi State Fair Commission And Expressing To Him The Gratitude Of The Mississippi Legislature For His Exemplification Of Leadership During His Unparalleled And Distinguished Career.

1881.title: Congress; urge to engage in communications and express support to western states, regarding the transfer of certain lands.
