1881.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing Support To The Western States Of The United States Of America And The Federal Transfer Of Public Lands To The Western States And Urging The Congress Of The United States To Engage In Good Faith Communication And Cooperation To Coordinate The Transfer Of Title To Such Lands To The Western States.

1882.title: Slavery; acknowledge and observe February 7, 2013, as "Mississippi Day of Freedom and Abolishment of Slavery for African Americans."
1882.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging February 7, 2013, As "mississippi Day Of Freedom And Abolishment Of Slavery" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On February 7, 2015, And Each Year Thereafter.

1883.title: Louwill E. Davis, III; commend upon his retirement as Mississippi's Corrections Auditor.
1883.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of Mr. Louwill E. Davis, Iii, Provided As Mississippi's Corrections Auditor Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1884.title: Hinds Community College Eagles Baseball Team; commend and congratulate upon winning the NJCAA 2014 Region XXIII Title and impressive 2014 season.
1884.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Hinds Community College 2014 Eagle Baseball Team Upon Winning The National Junior College Athletic Association 2014 Region Xxiii Title, Placing Second At The Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior Colleges 2014 State Championship, And Having A Spectacular Season.

1885.title: Ricky Ford; commend upon induction into NJCAA Women's Basketball Hall of Fame.
1885.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Ricky Ford On His Induction Into The National Junior College Athletic Association, (njcaa) Women's Basketball Hall Of Fame.

1886.title: Bethani Grace Alman; commend upon being crowned Miss Mississippi Junior High 2015.
1886.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Bethani Grace Alman Upon Being Crowned Miss Mississippi Junior High 2015.

1887.title: Home of Grace; commend upon celebrating 50th anniversary.
1887.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Home Of Grace Upon Celebrating Its 50th Anniversary Of Positively Changing Lives.

1888.title: William M. "Mitch" Stennett; commend and congratulate upon his retirement as the president of the Economic Development Authority of Jones County.
1888.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating William M. "mitch" Stennett Upon His Retirement After Serving 25 Years As The President Of The Economic Development Authority Of Jones County.

1889.title: Bassfield High School Yellowjackets Football Team; commend and congratulate for winning MHSAA Class 2A State championship.
1889.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Bassfield High School "yellowjackets" Football Team And Head Coach Lance Mancuso For Winning Their Third Consecutive Mhsaa Class 2a State Championship.

1890.title: Second Lieutenant Wellington G. Irving; commend for service during World War II.
1890.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Extraordinary Legacy Of Second Lieutenant Wellington G. Irving For Courageously Sacrificing His Life For The United States Of America And Recognizing Him For His Service And Bravery To This Great Nation.

1891.title: Madison Central High School Boys Jaguars Soccer Team; commend and congratulate for winning MHSAA 6A State Championship.
1891.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison Central High School Boys Jaguars Soccer Team For Winning The Mississippi High School Athletic Association Class 6a State Championship.

1892.title: Minister W.L. Holman; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1892.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Minister W.l. Holman, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1893.title: Nurse Donnis Harris; commend on being named the 2014 Nationally Certified School Nurse of the Year.
1893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Nurse Donnis Harris On Being Named The 2014 Nationally Certified School Nurse Of The Year.

1894.title: James Ervin Dees; commemorate his life upon his passing.
1894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of James Ervin Dees Of Ripley, Mississippi.

1895.title: Ripley Middle School Cheerleaders; commend for winning the 2014 MHSAA Junior High and Junior Varsity Cheer and Dance State Championship.
1895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ripley Middle School Tigers Cheerleading Team And Sponsor Gidget Barkley For Winning The 2014 Mississippi High School Activities Association Junior High And Junior Varsity Cheer And Dance State Championship.

1896.title: Eddie Cotton, Jr.; commend upon winning 1st place in the Band Division at the 2015 International Blues Challenge.
1896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Vicksburg Blues Society Musician, Eddie Cotton, Jr., Upon Being Crowned The 2015 Band Division Champion Of The 31st Annual International Blues Challenge Presented By The Blues Foundation In Memphis, Tennessee.

1897.title: Collins High School Football Team; commend and congratulate upon winning the MHSAA 3A State Championship.
1897.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2014 Collins High School Tigers Football Team And Head Coach Ryan Earnest For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 3a State Championship.

1898.title: Florence High School Army JROTC Drill Team; commend upon winning 2014-2015 Army JROTC Drill Team State Championship.
1898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Florence High School Army Jrotc Drill Team And Master Sergeant Todd Norris For Winning The 2014-2015 Army Jrotc Drill Team State Championship.

1899.title: East MS Community College; commend for winning the National Junior College Athletic Association National Championship.
1899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The East Mississippi Community College Lions Football Team And Veteran Head Coach Buddy Stephens For Winning The National Junior College Athletic Association National Championship.

1900.title: Mississippi State Bulldogs; commend and congratulate on outstanding season.
1900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating The Mississippi State University Bulldogs Football Team And Head Coach Dan Mullen For Its Outstanding And Successful 2014 Season.

1901.title: Dr. Wayne Blansett; commend upon retirement as Vice-President of Student Affairs at Delta State University.
1901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of Dr. Wayne Blansett, Provided As Vice President For Student Affairs And Associate Professor Of Education At Delta State University Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1902.title: St. Joseph Catholic School Lady Bruins Soccer Team; commend upon winning the 2015 MHSAA Class 1A/2A/3A Girls Soccer State Championship.
1902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Joseph Catholic School Lady Bruins Soccer Team And Head Coach Dwayne Demmin Upon Winning The 2015 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 1a/2a/3a Girls Soccer State Championship.

1903.title: Reverend Jerry Young; commend and congratulate upon election as president of the National Baptist Convention.
1903.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Reverend Jerry Young As The First Mississippi Pastor Chosen As President Of The National Baptist Convention, Usa.

1904.title: 2014 Ole Miss Rebels baseball team; commend and congratulate for SEC West Title and CWS appearance.
1904.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating The 2014 Ole Miss Rebels Baseball Team And Head Coach Mike Bianco For Their Outstanding Sec West Title Regular Season, Their Regional And Super-regional Postseason Victories, And For Their Final-four Tournament Appearance In The Ncaa College World Series.

1905.title: Norman Smith; commend his life upon passing.
1905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Norman Smith.

1906.title: Suspend deadlines for further consideration on HB 388; create Eminent Domain Intrastate Pipeline Clarification Act.
1906.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 388, Regular Session Of 2015, Entitled "an Act To Create The Eminent Domain Intrastate Pipeline Clarification Act; To Codify New Sections 77-11-401, 77-11-403, 77-11-405, 77-11-407, 77-11-409 And 77-11-411, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Open Access Of Intrastate Gas Pipelines And Intrastate Gas Gathering Systems To Encourage And Facilitate The Gathering, Transportation, Sale And Use Of Carbon Dioxide In Mississippi; To Provide Certain Definitions Under This Newly Created Article; To Provide That Intrastate Gas Pipelines Constructed Using Eminent Domain Shall Be Deemed A Common Carrier Of Gas For Certain Purposes; To Provide That Gas Gatherers Shall Be Subject To This Article For Certain Purposes; To Provide The State Oil And Gas Board With Jurisdiction And Certain Rulemaking Powers And Duties Under This Article; To Prescribe Proceedings For The Board As They Relate To This Article; To Provide That Certain Entities Shall Not Be Subject To This Article; To Bring Forward Sections 11-27-47 And 53-3-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes."

1907.title: Mrs. Stephanie Lee; honor life and express sympathy upon passing.
1907.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Life And Legacy Of Ms. Stephanie Lee And Expressing Deep Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1909.title: CSM Adelchi Pilutti (RET); commend for being awarded prestigious French Legion of Honor.
1909.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Command Sergeant Adelchi Pilutti (ret) For Being Awarded The Prestigious French Legion Of Honor And Recognizing Him For His Service And Bravery.

1910.title: Edwin C. LeGrand, III; commend upon retirement as Executive Director of the MS Department of Mental Health.
1910.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of Mr. Edwin C. Legrand Iii, Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health.

1911.title: Marie Atkinson Hull; acknowledge and observe September 28,2015, as "Marie Atkinson Hull Day."
1911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging September 28, 2015, As "marie Atkinson Hull Day" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On September 28, 2015, And Each Year Thereafter.

1912.title: Speaker Tim Ford; commend life and public service of.
1912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Speaker Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives Timothy Alan (tim) Ford, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

1913.title: Black Stuntmen's Association; commend for many accomplishments.
1913.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Historic Founding Of The Black Stuntmen's Association And The Coalition Of Black Stuntmen And Stuntwomen.

1914.title: Columbia National; commend upon winning the 2014 Dixie Youth Majors World Series.
1914.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Columbia National "bomb Squad" And Their Coaches Upon Winning The Dixie Youth Majors World Series.

1915.title: Suspend deadline for further consideration on HB 1636; include CO2 within definition of gas and remove certain exemptions on gas severance tax.
1915.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of House Bill 1636, Regular Session Of 2015, Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 27-25-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Carbon Dioxide Within The Definition Of The Term 'gas' For Purposes Of The Gas Severance Tax Laws; To Amend Section 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Gas Severance Tax Exemption Provided For Gas Lawfully Injected Into The Earth For Cycling, Repressuring, Lifting Or Enhancing The Recovery Of Oil; To Amend Section 27-25-503, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Credit Against The Oil Severance Tax Levied On The Value Of Oil At The Point Of Production On Oil Produced By An Enhanced Oil Recovery Method In Which Carbon Dioxide Is Used; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Shall Be The Amount Of Gas Severance Tax Paid On The Carbon Dioxide Used In The Enhanced Oil Recovery Method To Produce The Oil; To Bring Forward Section 27-25-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Defines Certain Terms Under The Oil Severance Tax Laws, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes."

1916.title: The First Baptist Church of Madison; congratulating on occasion of 125th Anniversary.
1916.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The First Baptist Church Of Madison On The Occasion Of Its 125th Anniversary.

1917.title: American Red Cross Month; declare March 2015.
1917.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of March 2015 As American Red Cross Month Commending This Organization For Its Noble Humanitarian Mission.

1918.title: Fred Haise commend astronautical and aeronautical accomplishments.
1918.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Exploratory Career, Courageous Leadership And Meritorious Service Of Astronaut Fred Wallace Haise, Jr.

1919.title: Dr. Christy Philippoff; commend and congratulate upon being honored as Instructor of the Year at Jackson County Campus of MGCCC.
1919.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Christy Philippoff, Ph.d., For Being Honored As Instructor Of The Year At The Jackson County Campus Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1920.title: Sherry James; commend and congratulate upon being honored as Instructor of the Year at the Perkinston Campus of MGCCC.
1920.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Sherry James For Being Honored As Instructor Of The Year At The Perkinston Campus Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1921.title: Mr. Calvin Walker; commend career as Executive Director of the Jackson Boys Club.
1921.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership Of Mr. Calvin Walker As The Executive Director Of The Jackson Boys Club.

1922.title: Mother Birteen M. Burnside;commend the life and legacy upon her passing.
1922.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mother Birteen (bert) Mcclaurin Burnside.

1923.title: Dr. Bruce D. Leopold; commend upon retirement after 28 years of service to the State of Mississippi and Mississippi State University.
1923.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedicated, Diligent And Professional Service Of Dr. Bruce D. Leopold To The State Of Mississippi And To Mississippi State University And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1924.title: Mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day; recognize March 25, 2015, as.
1924.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Members Of Phi Theta Kappa's All-mississippi Academic Team On The Occasion Of "mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day."

1925.title: Taiwan; commend relationship with MS and welcome Director General Huang.
1925.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Relationship Between The Republic Of China (taiwan) And The State Of Mississippi And Welcoming The Honorable Director General Louis Min-jing Huang To The State Of Mississippi.

1926.title: Judge Roy Noble Lee; commend life,legacy and service upon passing.
1926.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Extraordinary Legacy Of Retired Mississippi Supreme Court Chief Justice Roy Noble Lee.

1927.title: Dr. Erin Riggins; commend upon being named instructor of the year at Jefferson Davis Campus of MGCCC.
1927.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Erin Riggins On Being Named Instructor Of The Year At The Jefferson Davis Campus Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

1928.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Assistant teachers increase base salary by $2,500.00.
1928.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Base Salaries Of Assistant Teachers By The Amount Of Two Thousand Five Hundred Dollars Beginning With The 2015-2016 School Year, To A Total Of Fifteen Thousand Dollars In Addition To The One Percent Increase To The Base Salary Established For Assistant Teachers For Each One Percent That The Sine Die General Fund Revenue Estimate Growth Exceeds Five Percent; And For Related Purposes."

1929.title: Braden Ivey; commend and congratulate upon being selected the 2014 State Games of MS Male Athlete of the Year.
1929.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Braden Ivey On Being Selected As The 2014 State Games Of Mississippi Male Athlete Of The Year.

1931.title: Mr. Dewey Townsend; recognize and commend the distinguished leadership and accomplishments of.
1931.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Late Mr. Dewey Townsend For His Distinguished Civic Leadership And Numerous Accomplishments That Benefited The People Of Montgomery County And The City Of Winona.

1932.title: Lauren O. Pickett; commend upon being named the 2014 State Games of MS "Female Athlete of the Year".
1932.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Lauren O. Pickett For Being Named The 2014 State Games Of Mississippi "female Athlete Of The Year."

1933.title: Kimberly Sanchez; commend upon being named a Distinguished Finalist in the 2015 Prudential Spirit Community Awards.
1933.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Kimberly Sanchez Of Biloxi, Mississippi, On Being Named A Distinguished Finalist In The 2015 Prudential Spirit Of Community Awards.

1934.title: Honorable Judge Betty W. Sanders; commend distinguished career of upon her retirement.
1934.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Exceptional Service And Distinguished Career Of The Honorable Judge Betty W. Sanders And Congratulating Her Upon The Most Auspicious Occasion Of Her Retirement As Senior Circuit Court Judge Of The Fourth Circuit Court District Of Mississippi.

1935.title: Mrs. Lurlene Partlow Rogers; commend and congratulate on the occasion of her 100th birthday.
1935.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of Mrs. Lurlene Partlow Rogers Of Plantersville And Congratulating Her On The Most Auspicious Occasion Of Her 100th Birthday.

1936.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Study commission established to study governance structure of Mississippi IHL.
1936.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Establish A Study Commission To Study The Governance Structure Of Mississippi's Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes."

1937.title: Bay Springs High School Bulldogs Men's Basketball Team; congratulate for winning MHSAA Class 2A State Championship.
1937.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Bay Springs High School Bulldogs Boys Basketball Team For Winning The Mississippi High School Athletics Association Class 2a State Championship.

1938.title: The Peoples Bank of Ripley; commend and congratulate upon its 90th anniversary.
1938.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Peoples Bank Of Ripley Upon The Occasion Of Its 90th Anniversary.

1939.title: Persons with special needs; urge political subdivisions not to discriminate against.
1939.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging Political Subdivisions Not To Discriminate Against Persons With Special Needs Because It Is Morally Objectionable And May Violate Federal, State And Local Law.

1940.title: O'Keefe Funeral Homes; acknowledge and observe June 5, 2015 as "O'Keefe Funeral Homes Day."
1940.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging June 5, 2015, As "o'keefe Funeral Homes Day" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On June 5, 2015.

1941.title: Katie Rogers; commend upon being named a State Honoree in the 2015 Prudential Spirit of Community Awards.
1941.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Katie Rogers Of Collins, Mississippi, For Being Named A State Honoree In The 2015 Prudential Spirit Of Community Awards.

1942.title: Pelahatchie High School Lady Chiefs Basketball Team; commend and congratulate on winning MHSAA Class 1A State Championship.
1942.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pelahatchie High School Lady Chiefs Basketball Team And Their Coaches Upon Winning The 2014-2015 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 1a State Championship.

1943.title: Dr. John C. Clay; commend distinguished career as medical oncologist upon his retirement.
1943.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Accomplishments Of Medical Oncologist John Calvin Clay, M.d., Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1944.title: Mrs. Donna Wells; commend distinguished service as Executive Director of Crystal Springs Chamber of Commerce upon retirement.
1944.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Service Of Mrs. Donna Wells, Former Executive Director Of The Crystal Springs Chamber Of Commerce, Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement.

1946.title: Deputy U.S. Marshall Josie Wells; commend life and service upon his untimely passing.
1946.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Extraordinary Courage Of Deputy U.s. Marshal Josie Lamar Wells.

1947.title: Dr. Joseph S. Paul; commend service as Vice President for Student Affairs at Southern Miss upon his retirement.
1947.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of Dr. Joseph S. Paul Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The Vice President For Student Affairs At The University Of Southern Mississippi.

1948.title: Studio of Dance and Gymnastics; commend upon occasion of it 55th anniversary.
1948.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Studio Of Dance And Gymnastics In Pascagoula, Mississippi, Upon The Occasion Of Its 55th Anniversary.

1949.title: Armenian Genocide Resolution; affirm USM SGA Senate on.
1949.description: A Concurrent Resolution Affirming The University Of Southern Mississippi's Student Government Association Senate Resolution Recognizing And Denouncing The Armenian Genocide.

1951.title: Mr. Jimmy Blaine Fisher; commend on being named Junior Auxiliary of Corinth's 2015 Outstanding Citizen of the Year.
1951.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Mr. Jimmy Blaine Fisher As The Recipient Of The 2015 Corinth Junior Auxiliary Outstanding Citizen Of The Year Award.

1952.title: Suspend deadlines for introductions; State Bd. of Ed.; require to contract with certain entity for development of comprehensive statewide assessment.
1952.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Contract With A Single Entity For The Development And Administration Of A Comprehensive Statewide Assessment Program For Public School Students In Grades 3-10 As Well As Algebra I And English Ii, Which Is Aligned To The Mississippi College And Career-ready Standards; To Require The State Department Of Education To Provide A Job Skills Assessment System That Allows Students To Earn A Nationally Recognized Career Readiness Certificate Credentialing Workplace Employability Skills; To Require The Statewide Assessment Program To Be Fully Implemented In All Public Schools In The 2015-2016 School Year; To Prohibit The State Board Of Education From Issuing A Request For Proposals That Excludes Act Aspire As A Vendor For The Development Of A Statewide Assessment Aligned To The Mississippi College And Career Ready Standards; To Prohibit The State Board Of Education From Issuing A Request For Proposals To Or Contracting With Any Entity For The Development Of A Statewide Assessment Whose Alignment Of Curriculum And Testing Standards Are In Compliance With The Partnership For Assessment Of Readiness For College And Careers (parcc) Or Any Subsidiary Entities Affiliated With The Parcc Consortium Without Express Legislative Authority; To Impose A Moratorium On The Administration Of Any Statewide Standardized Assessments Which Are Not Aligned To The Curriculum Standards Developed In Conjunction With The Entity Selected By The Board To Enter Into Contract For The Development And Administration Of Such Comprehensive Statewide Assessment Program Effective With The 2015-2016 Scholastic Year And Each Scholastic Year Thereafter; And For Related Purposes."

1954.title: Oil and Gas Board; create regulatory division to protect interest-owner rights.
1954.description: An Act To Amend Section 53-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Creation Of The Regulatory Division Of The Oil And Gas Board; To Amend Section 53-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 53-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Assign To The State Supervisor The Responsibility For Oil And Gas Company Duties To Respond To Owner Requests For Information; To Create New Section 53-1-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Regulatory Division Of The Oil And Gas Board And To Provide Funding Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

1955.title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) Pre-Screening Eligibility Tool website; direct DHS to develop and implement.
1955.description: An Act To Codify Section 43-1-28.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Department Of Human Services To Develop And Implement A Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (snap) Pre-screening Eligibility Tool Website For Applicants To Determine If They Are Eligible To Receive Snap Benefits; And For Related Purposes.

1956.title: Municipalities; certain small municipalities may advertise budget hearings by posting notices rather than by publication.
1956.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Municipality To Advertise The Public Hearing At Which Time The Budget And Tax Levies For The Upcoming Fiscal Year Will Be Considered By Posting A Notice In Three Public Places If The Proposed Tax Levies Of The Municipality Are Not In Excess Of The Current Fiscal Year's Certified Tax Rate And The Municipality Has A Population Of Less Than 1,500 According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

1957.title: Sales taxes; assessment notice must be by certified mail if not delivered in person.
1957.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-65-35 And 27-65-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Written Notices Of Assessments And Demands For Payment Of Sales Taxes Shall Be Sent By Certified Mail If Not Delivered In Person; And For Related Purposes.

1958.title: Memorial highways; designate segment of MS Highway 371 in the Town of Marietta as the James C. "Jimmy" Pharr Memorial Highway.
1958.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 371 Within The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Marietta In Prentiss County, Mississippi, As The James C. "jimmy" Pharr Memorial Highway; And For Related Purposes.

1959.title: Literacy-Based Promotion Act; clarify good cause exemption applicable to disabled students.
1959.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-177-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Good Cause Exemption Under The Literacy-based 4th Grade Promotion Act Applicable To Students Who Have An Iep Or Section 504 Plan And Were Previously Retained In Lower Grades; And For Related Purposes.

1960.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for the E.E. Bass Cultural Arts Center.
1960.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The E.e. Bass Cultural Arts Center In Greenville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1961.title: Bonds; authorize for Phase II of construction of a new headquarters building for the Department of Public Safety.
1961.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Phase Ii Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Headquarters Building For The Department Of Public Safety; And For Related Purposes.

1962.title: Homestead exemption; provide for certain owners of manufactured homes or mobile homes.
1962.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-53-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes For An Owner Of A Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Who Occupies Such Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home As His Primary Home And Has Done So At The Same Physical Location For At Least Two Consecutive Years, Regardless Of Whether Such Person Owns The Land On Which The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Is Located Or How The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home And Land Are Assessed; To Provide That A Person May Not Claim The Exemption Provided In This Act If The Person Claims An Exemption Under The Homestead Exemption Law; And For Related Purposes.

1963.title: Intercept gaming winnings of parents with a child support arrearage; provide procedures for.
1963.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare As Public Policy That Children Are Adversely Affected When A Parent Who Has An Outstanding Child Support Arrearage Diverts Child Support To Gaming; To Codify Section 75-76-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Procedures For The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Department Of Human Services And Licensees Under The Mississippi Gaming Control Act To Intercept And Collect Child Support Arrearages Of A Parent From The Gaming Winnings Of Such Parent; And For Related Purposes.

1964.title: Insurance producers; employees of limited license rental car companies are deemed to be licensed producers.
1964.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-17-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Employees And Authorized Agents Of A Limited License Rental Car Company Shall Be Deemed To Be Licensed Under The Rental Car Company's Limited License And Shall Not Require Any Additional Licensing; And For Related Purposes.

1965.title: Commissioner of Insurance; authorize to issue cease and desist orders against persons engaged in unlicensed activities.
1965.description: An Act To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Enjoin Any Person, Company, Corporation Or Association From Engaging In Unlicensed Activities; And For Related Purposes.

1966.title: Newton County property; DFA may transfer to Mayor and Board of Aldermen of Newton on behalf of MS Bureau of Narcotics.
1966.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics, To Transfer Certain Real Property Located In Newton County, Mississippi, To The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Newton; And For Related Purposes.

1967.title: Small loan licensees; charges/premiums for credit insurance and auto club memberships not considered finance charges.
1967.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-17-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charges, Fees And Premiums For Voluntarily Purchased Credit Insurance And Auto Club Memberships Charged By A Small Loan Licensee Shall Not Be Considered To Be Finance Charges; And For Related Purposes.

1968.title: Crimes; create the crime of employment fraud.
1968.description: An Act To Create The Crime Of Employment Fraud For Persons Who Provide False Information In The Employment Process In Order To Gain Access To Manufacturing, Retail, Agricultural And Other Business Facilities; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1969.title: Prohibited trade practices; include certain restrictive actions by contact lens suppliers or manufacturers.
1969.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-24-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Certain Restrictive Practices By Contact Lens Suppliers Or Manufacturers As Prohibited Practices Under The Mississippi Consumer Protection Act; And For Related Purposes.

1971.title: At-risk youth; authorize Community-Based Placement Pilot Program.
1971.description: An Act To Create The Community-based Placement For At-risk Children Pilot Program In Order To Plan For Early Intervention With At-risk Children In The County In Which The Pilot Program Is Located; To Enact Standards For Community-based Homes; To Provide Standards For Determination Of Eligibility Of Children For Placement Under The Pilot Program; To Authorize Reasonable Reimbursement For Expenses Of Placements To The Community-based Homes; To Authorize Funding For The Pilot Program; To Provide For Supervision Of And Reporting By The Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

1972.title: Tourism project incentive program; cultural retail attraction certificates expire on 7/1/17 unless complete by that date.
1972.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certificates Issued Under The Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program Authorizing Participation In The Program By Entities That Are Developing Tourism Projects That Are Cultural Retail Attractions Shall Expire On July 1, 2017, Unless The Project Is Completed By Such Date; And For Related Purposes.

1973.title: Motor vehicles; authorize distinctive motor vehicle license tags for supporters of Byram Middle School.
1973.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags For Supporters Of Byram Middle School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1974.title: Children's Justice Center; change name to Children's Safe Center.
1974.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-115-43 And 41-111-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Name Of The Children's Justice Center To Children's Safe Center; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1975.title: Voyeurism; prohibit lewd surreptitious viewing and photography.
1975.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-29-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit "peeping Tom" Activities That Do Not Amount To Felonious Trespass; To Amend Section 97-29-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Surreptitious Photography Of A Person's Body Or Underclothing Under Circumstances In Which A Person Would Reasonably Expect To Not Be The Subject Of Such Photography; And For Related Purposes.

1976.title: Children at risk; establish the Motivating Parents and Children (MPAC) pilot program for school districts.
1976.description: An Act To Establish A Motivating Parents And Children (mpac) Pilot Program Within The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Making Grants To School Districts That Provide Parental Involvement Services To Families Of Compulsory-school-age Children Residing In Such School District; To Set Forth The Purposes Of The Mpac Pilot Program; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Implement The Mpac Pilot Program; To Prescribe The Basic Components Of Services To Be Offered By School Districts Under The Mpac Pilot Program; To Provide An Application And Selection Procedure For School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 37-11-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Parents To Attend Conferences And Other Functions Of School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program; To Amend Section 63-1-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Children Under 18 Residing In School Districts Participating In The Mpac Pilot Program Who Withdraw From School May Have Their Driver's License Suspended; To Amend Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Such Minors From License Reinstatement Fees; To Amend Section 63-1-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1977.title: School districts; pilot program requiring pupils to read a minimum of four books per school year.
1977.description: An Act To Establish A Pilot Program Authorizing Local School Boards In The State To Require All Pupils In Grades 1 Through 12 To Read A Minimum Of Four Books Per School Year And Make Reports Thereon; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Develop And Issue Guidelines Under Which School Districts May Apply For Participation In This Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

1978.title: Civil Assistance Fund; increase funding for.
1978.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Assessment On Various Criminal Violations To Be Paid Into The Civil Legal Assistance Fund; To Amend Section 9-21-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Sources Of Funding For The Civil Legal Assistance Fund; To Bring Forward Sections 25-7-9, 25-7-13, 27-19-56.99 And 27-19-56.135, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1979.title: Appropriation FY2016; Mississippi Development Authority for Small Farm and Agribusiness Center.
1979.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Development Authority For The Mississippi Small Farm And Agribusiness Center And Mississippi Natural Products Association, For The Purpose Of Expanding Shiitake Mushroom Research And Production For Fiscal Year 2016; And For Related Purposes.

1981.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of state g.o. bonds to provide funds to repair state, county and municipal roads and bridges.
1981.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $300,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Repair And Rehabilitation Of State Maintained Highways And Bridges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $100,000,000.00 To Provide Additional Funds For The State Aid Road Fund In The State Treasury; To Limit The Amount Of Such Bonds That May Be Issued In Any One Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

1982.title: Small Municipalities and Limited Population Counties Fund; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for in the amount of $10,000,000,.00.
1982.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1983.title: High-school testing requirements; replace PARCC and SAT2 with ACT assessment on phased-in basis.
1983.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Replace Subject Area Testing Requirements (satp2) And Parcc Student Assessments With The American College Testing (act) Assessment On A Phased-in Basis; To Amend Section 37-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Require The Act College Readiness Test And Precursor Diagnostic Tests To Be Administered Beginning In The 2017-2018 School Year With Results To Be Included In Each School District's Accountability Report; To Direct The State Superintendent Of Education To Take Immediate Action To Withdraw From The Partnership For Assessment Of Readiness For College And Careers (parcc); To Amend Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That The State Department Of Education Combine The State School Accountability System With The Federal System; And For Related Purposes.

1984.title: School district consolidation incentive grants; establish program in the State Department of Education.
1984.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Distribute School District Consolidation Incentive Grants To North Bolivar Consolidated School District, West Bolivar Consolidated School District, Sunflower County School District, And To Any School District Which Consolidates After July 1, 2015, To Defray Certain Transitional Costs Relating To The Administrative Consolidation; To Provide Standards For Calculating The Amount Of The Grants; To Provide That Such Grant Funds Shall Be Distributed At The Same Time And In The Same Manner As Adequate Education Program Funds; And For Related Purposes.

1985.title: Retired teachers; may draw retirement benefits and be reemployed as teachers if they have 30 years of creditable service.
1985.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-11-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Persons Receiving A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Employed As Teachers In The Public School System After Their Retirement, And Certain Persons Employed As Teachers In The Public School System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance From The Public Employees' Retirement System, May Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers In Addition To Receiving A Teacher's Salary; To Provide That Those Persons Shall Not Be Contributing Members Of The Retirement System Nor Receive Any Creditable Service For The Period During Which They Receive A Retirement Allowance During Their Employment As Teachers; To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105 And 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1986.title: Prekindergarten programs; establish Early Childhood Services Interagency Coordinating Council.
1986.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish An Early Childhood Services Interagency Coordinating Council To Coordinate Prekindergarten Services And To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Council; And For Related Purposes.

1987.title: Sixteenth section land; clarify provisions related to leases of.
1987.description: An Act To Clarify That A Lease Of Sixteenth Section Lands That Is Duly Executed By The Applicable School Board Of The School District Is Presumed To Be Valid; To Clarify That The Approval Of The Secretary Of State Is Not Necessary Before The Board May Enter Into Any Such Lease; To Provide That The Secretary Of State May Object To The Validity Of Such A Lease By Filing An Action In The Appropriate Chancery Court And Demonstrating That The Lease Is Unconscionable Or Otherwise Not Valid; To Provide That Board Members Acting In Good Faith Are Immune From Individual Liability Associated With Entering Into The Lease; To Amend Section 29-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Certain Standards Regarding The Classification And Reclassification Of Sixteenth Section Land; To Amend Section 29-3-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Appraisal Every 5 Years And To Provide For A Certain 16th Section Land Complaint Tribunal For Leaseholders; To Authorize The Local School Board In Its Discretion To Charge The Leaseholder For The Cost Of The First Appraisal Of Sixteenth Section Land; To Amend Section 29-3-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority Of The Secretary Of State To Reclassify Any Sixteenth Section Land On His Own Motion And Leave That Authority With The Local School Board; To Amend Section 29-3-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of Sixteenth Section Land Managers; To Amend Section 29-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize 16th Section Land Leaseholders To Assign Or Sublease Their Lease In Their Discretion; To Amend Sections 29-3-63 And 29-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1988.title: Bolivar County School District consolidation; repeal mandated school district consolidation law.
1988.description: An Act To Repeal Section 37-7-104.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Mandated An Administrative Consolidation Of Bolivar County School Districts Into Two New Districts To Be Designated As North Bolivar Consolidated School District And West Bolivar Consolidated School District And Provided For New School Boards In The New Districts; And For Related Purposes.

1989.title: Domestic violence; clarify entry of criminal protection orders in the registry.
1989.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Violation Of Criminal Protection Orders On The Same Basis As Protection From Domestic Violence Civil Orders; To Amend Section 93-21-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Recordation Of Domestic Violence Criminal Orders; To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

1990.title: Penalty for withdrawal of accreditation of school or school district; shall not include suspension of extracurricular events.
1990.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Penalty For The Withdrawal Of Accreditation Of A School Or School District Shall Not Result In Suspension Of Participation In Extracurricular Or Interscholastic Activities, Including Regular And Post Season Games And Contests; And For Related Purposes.

1991.title: School board members; all elected beginning with the November 2016 general election; appoint all local school superintendents.
1991.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-6-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact The "nonpartisan School Board Election Act"; To Provide That Beginning With The November 2016 General Election, The Members Of The County Boards Of Education, Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts, The Trustees Of Consolidated School Districts And The Trustees From The Special Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected In A Nonpartisan Election Concurrent With The Federal Election For The President Of The United States; To Provide That The Terms Of Office Of All School Board Members Shall Be Four Years; To Provide For Nominating Petitions To Run For The Office Of Elected School Board Members And A Uniform Number Of Signatures On Said Petitions Of Nomination; To Provide The Procedure For Filling Vacancies In The Office Of Elected School Board Members; To Amend Sections 37-5-1, 37-5-3, 37-5-7, 37-5-9, 37-5-18, 37-5-19, 37-7-203, 37-7-207, 37-7-221, 37-7-223, 37-7-225, 37-7-227, 37-7-229 And 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Sections 37-7-204, 37-7-209, 37-7-211, 37-7-215, 37-7-217 And 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Added Territory; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705, 37-7-707, 37-7-709, 37-7-711, 37-7-713, 37-7-715 And 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; To Amend Sections 37-9-13, 37-9-25 And 37-5-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of All Superintendents Of Schools From And After January 1, 2016; To Authorize A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education In Counties Pursuant To Petition; To Repeal Effective January 1, 2016, Sections 37-5-61, 37-5-63, 37-5-65, 37-5-67, 37-5-69, 37-5-71 And 37-5-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Changing The Position Of County Superintendent Of Education To An Appointed Office Pursuant To Petition And Referendum, Provide For The Reestablishment Of The Office As An Elective Office, Authorize The Appointment Of The County Superintendent Of Education In Certain Counties, Provide For The Selection And Qualifications Of Elected Superintendents In Certain Counties, Provide For The Filling Of Vacancies In The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education, And Section 37-9-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Elective Method Of Choosing The County Superintendent Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

1992.title: Memorial highway; designate a portion of Mississippi Highway 8 in Grenada as "Blue Star Memorial Highway."
1992.description: An Act To Designate A Portion Of Mississippi Highway 8 Within The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Grenada, Mississippi, As "blue Star Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

1993.title: Admission requirements for examination for cosmetology license; clarify.
1993.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Board Of Cosmetology Shall Admit For Licensure Examination An Applicant Who Has Been Enrolled In A Community College And Otherwise Meets Statutory Qualifications; And For Related Purposes.

1994.title: Tourism project incentive program; remove references to "cultural retail attractions."
1994.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-26-1 And 57-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove References To "cultural Retail Attractions" In The Provisions Of Law That Govern The Tourism Project Incentive Program; And For Related Purposes.

1995.title: Tanning facility regulation; prohibit use by anyone under 18 years of age.
1995.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-115-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Use Of Tanning Devices At Tanning Facilities By Children Under Age 18; To Assess A Civil Penalty For Violations Of This Section; To Require Tanning Facilities To Post A Notice Developed By The Mississippi State Department Of Health Stating It Is Unlawful For A Tanning Facility Owner Or Operator To Allow A Person Under The Age Of 18 To Use Any Tanning Device; To Require Tanning Facilities To Post A Notice Developed By The Mississippi State Department Of Health Stating That A Tanning Facility Or Operator That Violates This Section Is Subject To A Civil Penalty; To Require Tanning Facilities To Post A Notice Developed By The Mississippi State Department Of Health Stating That An Individual May Report Violations Of This Section To The Mississippi State Department Of Health Stating The Health Risks Associated With Tanning; To Require The Operator To Require Photo Identification Indicating That The Person Using A Tanning Device Is At Least 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1996.title: Maternal Mortality Review Committee; establish under State Board of Health.
1996.description: An Act To Establish The Maternal Mortality Review Committee Under The State Board Of Health To Review Maternal Deaths; To Provide For Data; To Provide For Confidentiality; To Provide For Limited Liability; To Provide For Reports; And For Related Purposes.

1997.title: Texting while driving; constitutes careless driving.
1997.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-1213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Rebuttable Presumption That Manually Texting While Driving Constitutes Careless Driving; And For Related Purposes.

1999.title: Mississippi Check Cashers Act; check cashing transaction shall be void if lender is not licensed.
1999.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-525, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, If Any Person Engages In The Business Of Check Cashing Without First Securing A License, The Check Cashing Transaction Contract Shall Be Void And The Person Shall Have No Right To Collect Any Principal, Charges Or Fees In Connection With The Transaction; And For Related Purposes.

2000.title: False report of child abuse or neglect; provide criminal penalties and civil liability.
2000.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-35-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The False Report Of Child Abuse Or Neglect To The Department Of Human Services Shall Be Punishable As A Misdemeanor; To Provide That A Person Who Knowingly And Willfully Makes A False Report Of Child Abuse Or Neglect May Be Civilly Liable For Damages Suffered Including Reasonable Attorney Fees And Costs; And For Related Purposes.

2001.title: Juvenile sentencing; provide criteria for determining parole eligibility & require hearing before imposing life without parole.
2001.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure Consistent With Decisions Of The United States Supreme Court And The Mississippi Supreme Court For The Parole Of Certain Offenders Who Were Under The Age Of Eighteen When They Committed The Crimes For Which They Are Sentenced; To Provide For The Procedure To Be Followed Before Certain Juvenile Offenders May Be Sentenced To Life Imprisonment Without The Possibility Of Parole; To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2003.title: Expunction of felony; revise.
2003.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Expunction Of A Felony Record Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2004.title: Habitual criminal; revise computation of prior convictions.
2004.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sentencing Of Repeat Felons Under The Habitual Criminal Statute; And For Related Purposes.

2005.title: Trusty time; exempt juvenile offenders from provisions that render all other offenders ineligible for a reduction in sentence.
2005.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Making An Offender Ineligible For A Reduction In Sentence Under The Trusty-time Program Shall Not Apply To An Offender Who Was Under The Age Of 18 When He Committed The Crime For Which He Was Sentenced; And For Related Purposes.

2006.title: Earned time; exempt juvenile offenders from the provisions which could make them ineligible for a reduction in sentence.
2006.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Making An Offender Ineligible For A Reduction In Sentence Under The Earned-time Program Shall Not Apply To An Offender Who Was Under The Age Of 18 When He Committed The Offense For Which He Was Sentenced; And For Related Purposes.

2007.title: Smoking in all public places; prohibit.
2007.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Uniform Smoke-free Public Place Act Of 2015"; To Prohibit Smoking In Public Places; To Provide For Definitions; To Prohibit Smoking In Certain Public Places And Areas; To Prohibit Smoking In Any Indoor Or Outdoor Public Facility In Mississippi During Any Time That Persons Under 18 Years Of Age Are Engaged In An Organized Athletic Event In The Facility; To Provide For Exceptions; To Provide For Posting Of Signs And Removal Of Ashtrays; To Provide For An Informational Program; To Provide For Enforcement By The State Department Of Health; To Provide That Violations Of Smoking Prohibition Are Punishable By Civil Penalty; To Provide That This Prohibition Supersedes Local Ordinances; To Amend Sections 29-5-160, 29-5-161 And 29-5-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Enforcement And Penalty Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Applicable To The Statutes Prohibiting Smoking In Government Buildings, To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In Government Buildings Are Applicable To Government-owned Vehicles And To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In University Or College Buildings Are Applicable To Private Universities And Colleges; To Amend Section 97-32-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Smoking In All Private School Buildings And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2008.title: Texting; prohibit while driving for all ages.
2008.description: An Act To Create Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving By The Holders Of Temporary And Intermediate Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2009.title: Radar; authorize use by sheriffs.
2009.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff Of Any County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon Public Streets, Roads And Highways That Are Under The Jurisdiction Of The Board Of Supervisors For Maintenance And Construction And That Are Located Outside The Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2010.title: Public records; booking information of certain mentally ill patients exempt.
2010.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Booking Information From The Public Records Act If The Person Being Booked Is Held In Custody Solely On The Basis Of The Person's Mental Health Status; To Amend Section 25-61-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "booking Information" For Purposes Of The Exemption; And For Related Purposes.

2011.title: Headlights; require use during precipitation.
2011.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Headlights Of Vehicles Shall Be Operated Whenever Precipitation Necessitates The Use Of Windshield Wipers; To Prohibit The Use Of Only The Parking Lights Of Vehicles During Times When The Use Of Headlights Is Required; To Provide That State Assessments Under Section 99-19-73 Shall Not Be Imposed On Such Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2013.title: Medicaid; expand eligibility to include individuals entitled to benefits under federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
2013.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Medicaid Eligibility To Include Those Individuals Who Are Entitled To Benefits Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca) Beginning July 1, 2015; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Essential Health Benefits For Individuals Eligible For Medicaid Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca); And For Related Purposes.

2014.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for Mississippi residents age 65 or older.
2014.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Mississippi Resident Age 65 Or Older Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; To Provide That Such Waiver Shall Be Administered Under The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program (mtag); And For Related Purposes.

2015.title: Leflore County private correctional facility; designate as a regional facility.
2015.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The Private Correctional Facility Located In Leflore County As A Regional Facility; To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Contract With The Private Entity That Operates The Facility; To Amend Section 47-4-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2016.title: DUI; increase penalty for 4th and 5th offenses.
2016.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create An Increased Penalty For A Fourth Or Subsequent Conviction Of Driving Under The Influence Of Alcohol Or Other Drugs; And For Related Purposes.

2017.title: Judges; provide additional chancellor for the Fourth Chancery Court District.
2017.description: An Act To Enact Trial Court Redistricting; To Amend Section 9-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Two Chancellors For The Fourth Chancery Court District; And For Related Purposes.

2018.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt pollution control equipment mandated by federal or state law or regulations.
2018.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Pollution Control Equipment Mandated By Federal Or State Law Or Regulation Shall Be Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

2019.title: Contraband tobacco; modify procedure for confiscation, forfeiture and disposal of.
2019.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-69-53, 27-69-55 And 27-69-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Modify The Procedure For Forfeiture And Disposal Of Contraband Tobacco; To Provide The Procedure For The Sale Of Tobacco That Is Forfeited; To Provide For The Payment Of Taxes By The Purchaser Of Such Tobacco; To Authorize The Destruction Of Forfeited Contraband Tobacco If It Is Unable To Be Sold; And For Related Purposes.

2020.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to assist Hinds County in construction of the Byram-Clinton Parkway Project.
2020.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hinds County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction And Development Of The Byram-clinton Parkway Project; And For Related Purposes.

2021.title: Motor vehicle privilege tax; increase the period of time within which a newly acquired motor vehicle must be registered.
2021.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From 7 Working Days To 14 Business Days The Period Of Time Within Which A Newly Acquired Motor Vehicle Must Be Registered; To Amend Sections 27-19-40 And 27-19-141, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Sales tax; remove requirement that certain taxpayers pay June liability for the tax on or before June 25.
2022.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Provision That Requires A Taxpayer Who Is Required To Collect Sales Taxes And Who Has An Average Monthly Sales Tax Liability Of At Least $20,000.00 To Pay A Portion Of His Sales Tax Liability For The Month Of June On Or Before June 25; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to repair, renovate & refurbish Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center.
2023.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

2024.title: Light wine and beer; may be seized and disposed of in the same manner as alcoholic beverages for certain violations of law.
2024.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-71-335, 67-1-18, 67-1-72, 67-3-13, 67-3-15 And 67-3-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Light Wine And Beer Upon Which Taxes Have Failed To Be Paid, That Is Possessed In A Dry County, That Is Manufactured Without A Permit Or Possessed Or Sold By A Retailer Without A Permit, Shall Be Seized And Disposed Of In The Same Manner As Provided For The Seizure And Disposal Of Alcoholic Beverages; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Parental Rights Act; create.
2025.description: An Act To Establish The Fundamental Right Of Parents To Direct The Upbringing, Education And Care Of Their Children; And For Related Purposes.

2026.title: Kindergarten-age children; require compulsory school attendance for all.
2026.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Of The Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law Are Fully Applicable To Kindergarten-age Children; And For Related Purposes.

2027.title: K-4 school assistant teachers and prekindergarten programs; earmark funding from gaming winnings tax.
2027.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Elementary School Assistant Teachers In Fourth Grade Beginning In The 2016-2017 School Year; To Amend Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Funding For Prekindergarten Programs Under The "early Learning Collaborative Act Of 2013" May Be Made From The Income Tax On Certain Winnings Paid To Patrons Of Gaming Establishments From The Early Childhood Education Fund Created Under This Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "early Childhood Education Fund" And To Provide That Money In The Fund Shall Be Utilized By The Department Of Education To Assist In Funding The Prekindergarten Program And Elementary School Assistant Teachers In Grades K Through 4; To Amend Section 27-7-901, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose An Additional Tax Upon Certain Amounts That Are Paid Or Credited By Gaming Establishments Licensed Under The Provisions Of The Mississippi Gaming Control Act To Their Patrons And Provide That The Revenue From Such Tax Shall Be Deposited Into The Early Childhood Education Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Prekindergarten programs; increase funding for second and third phase.
2028.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Second And Third Phase Of Prekindergarten Funding Commitment For The "early Learning Collaborative Act Of 2013"; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: Creation of innovation schools and innovation zones in school districts; authorize.
2029.description: An Act Relating To Authorizing Creation Of Innovation Schools And Innovation Zones Focused On Science, Technology, Engineering And Mathematics In School Districts; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Develop An Application Process And Standards To Be Administered By The Local School Boards; To Amend Section 37-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2030.title: Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law; applies to students through age 18 and increase penalties for parents.
2030.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Of The Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law Are Applicable To Students Through Age 18; To Provide That Every Day A Compulsory-school-age Child Accumulates An Unlawful Absence Constitutes A Separate Criminal Violation Relative To The Parents Or Legal Guardians Of Such Students And To Amend Sections 97-5-39 And 37-13-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: Gaming; create statewide lottery to fund Hope College Scholarship Program.
2031.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create A Trust Fund Into Which A Portion Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited; To Amend Sections 37-106-11, 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.

2032.title: Distinguished Flying Cross, Air Medal and the Bronze Star motor vehicle tags; exempt from vehicle registration fees and taxes.
2032.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-19-56.13 And 27-19-56.62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Authorized To Be Issued To Recipients Of The Distinguished Flying Cross, The Air Medal And The Bronze Star Shall Be Exempt From All Motor Vehicle Registration Fees And Privilege Taxes; To Provide That The Surviving Spouse Of A Deceased Person Who Was Issued Such A License Plate Or Tag Shall Be Entitled To Apply For Or Retain Such A License Plate Or Tag Issued Under This Section And May Continue Annually To Renew Registration For One Such Motor Vehicle License Plate Or Tag For As Long As The Spouse Remains Unremarried; To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Certain Motor Vehicles Owned By Recipients Of The Bronze Star, Distingished Flying Cross Or The Air Medal Or The Unremarried Surviving Spouses Of Such Recipients; And For Related Purposes.

2033.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for students with at least 3.0 GPA.
2033.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Who Have At Least A 3.0 Grade Point Average In High School And Maintain That Average Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: SREB contract program at out-of-state college of optometry; students not required to practice in Mississippi.
2034.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-135-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Participating In The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb) Contract Program At Any College Of Optometry Outside Of The State Shall Not Be Required To Return To The State Of Mississippi To Practice After Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: Child support; arrearage not pursued absent proof of nonpayment.
2036.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-19-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow An Absent Parent The Opportunity To Prove That Child Support Is Current Before The Department Of Human Services Can Open A Case Against The Absent Parent For An Alleged Arrearage; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Child custody; noncustodial parent allowed opportunity to object to other parent's proposed move of minor child.
2038.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-5-23 And 93-5-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Opportunity For Notice And Hearing In Cases Where A Custodial Parent Desires To Relocate And The Move Would Significantly Affect The Noncustodial Parent's Right Of Visitation, According To The Best Interest Of The Child; To Amend Section 93-5-34, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Termination Of Temporary Custody Orders Entered Upon Military Deployment Of A Custodial Parent; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Headlights; require use of when windshield wipers necessary.
2039.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Use Of Headlights Whenever Driving Conditions Necessitate The Use Of Windshield Wipers; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Memorial bridge; designate a certain bridge in Lowndes County as the Terry W. Brown Memorial Bridge.
2040.description: An Act To Designate The Bridge That Spans The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway On U.s. Highway 82 In Lowndes County As The Terry W. Brown Memorial Bridge; And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: Mississippi Nursing Practice Act; make technical amendments to.
2041.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Title Of The Mississippi Nursing Practice Law To The Mississippi Nurse Practice Law; To Amend Section 73-15-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Purpose Of The Nurse Practice Law And To Clarify The Requirement For Collaboration By Advanced Practice Nurses; To Amend Section 73-15-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Several Definitions Under The Nurse Practice Law; To Amend Section 73-15-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exceptions From The Nurse Practice Law; To Amend Section 73-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Composition Of The Mississippi Board Of Nursing; To Amend Section 73-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner Of Giving Notice Of Special Meetings Of The Board To The Members; To Amend Section 73-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Funds Of The Board Be Deposited In The State Treasury; To Amend Section 73-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications For Members Of The Board; To Amend Section 73-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Board; To Amend Section 73-15-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Composition Of The Nursing Workforce Advisory Committee; To Amend Section 73-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License Application And Issuance Procedures For Registered Nurses; To Amend Section 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License Application And Issuance Procedures For Advanced Practice Registered Nurses; To Amend Section 73-15-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License Application And Issuance Procedures For Licensed Practical Nurses; To Bring Forward Section 73-15-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Nurse Licensure Compact, For Amendment; To Amend Section 73-15-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify A Reference To The Nurse Licensure Compact Administrator; To Repeal Section 73-15-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The State Department Of Education Through Its Division Of Vocational Education To Contract With The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Establish Uniform Standards For The Accreditation Of Schools Of Practical Nursing In This State; To Amend Section 73-15-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Provisions Regarding The Renewal And Reinstatement Of Licenses; To Amend Section 73-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Provisions Regarding The Grounds For Suspending Or Revoking Licenses And Penalties For Engaging In Prohibited Conduct; To Amend Section 73-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions Applicable To Disciplinary Proceedings; To Create New Section 73-15-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Consolidate The Procedures For Restoration Of Suspended Or Revoked Licenses; To Amend Section 73-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Provisions Regarding Violations And Penalties; To Amend Section 73-15-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Provisions Regarding Injunctive Relief; To Amend Section 73-15-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The License Application And Issuance Procedures For Certified Clinical Hemodialysis Technicians; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: Home health services; authorize advanced practice nurses and physician assistants to provide to Medicare/Medicaid beneficiaries.
2042.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5, 73-15-20 And 73-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Clinical Nurse Specialists, Nurse Practitioners And Physician Assistants May Provide Home Health Services For Medicare Or Medicaid Beneficiaries Consistent With Federal Law; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: Visitation; allow to third party under certain limited circumstances.
2043.description: An Act To Create New Section 93-5-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Means For A Court To Grant Third-party Visitation To A Person Standing In Loco Parentis To A Child Or To Another Person With A Significant Relationship With The Child Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Health care certificate of need; additional services subject to CON review.
2044.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Additional Services Subject To Health Care Certificate Of Need Review; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Radiological health entities; State Board of Health shall set applicable fees at 25% of federal NRC rate.
2045.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-14-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Health To Set Applicable Fees For Licensing And Registration Of Radiological Health Entities Equal To 25% Of The Amount Charged By The Federal Nuclear Regulatory Commission (nrc); To Amend Section 45-14-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Health To Set Fees For Radiological Health Entities Not Regulated By The Nrc; And For Related Purposes.

2046.title: Certain electric power associations and electric public utilities; authorize to undertake economic development activities.
2046.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-5-231, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any Generation And Transmission Electric Power Association To Undertake Economic Development Activities Whether Directly, Indirectly, Or In Conjunction With Other Entities; To Amend Section 77-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare That It Is The Policy Of The State Of Mississippi To Support And Augment The Economic Development Activities Of Rate-regulated Public Utilities; To Create New Section 77-3-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any Rate-regulated Electric Public Utility With Certificated Service Area In Mississippi To Undertake Economic Development Activities; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: Indecent exposure; revise penalty.
2047.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-29-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For Indecent Exposure Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Alternative Fuel Revolving Loan Fund; authorize counties to borrow money from.
2048.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-421, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties To Enter Into Loans Under A Revolving Loan Program Established By The Mississippi Development Authority To Assist Counties With Paying The Cost Of Qualified Alternative Fuel Motor Vehicle Fuel Property; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: Nursing; delete requirement that advanced practice nurses must practice within collaborative relationship with a physician.
2049.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Advanced Practice Registered Nurses Must Practice Within A Collaborative Or Consultative Relationship With A Physician Or Dentist; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: Paternity; clarify circumstances under which putative father cannot contest.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Circumstances Under Which A Putative Father Cannot Further Contest Paternity; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: Child support; duty does not terminate for disabled children.
2051.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Duty To Support A Child Who Is Physically Or Mentally Incapable Of Self-support Does Not Terminate Upon Reaching The Age Of Majority; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize issuance to recipients of the Legion of Merit.
