2052.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Recipients Of The Legion Of Merit And To The Unremarried Surviving Spouse Of Any Such Person Without The Payment Of An Additional Fee; To Provide That Such License Tags Shall Be Exempt From All Motor Vehicle Registration Fees And Privilege Taxes; To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Such License Tags From The Payment Of Motor Vehicle Ad Valorem Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

2053.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for the cost of certain alternative fuel motor vehicles.
2053.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For The Cost Of Purchasing Motor Vehicles That Utilize Certain Alternative Fuels And For The Cost Of Converting Motor Vehicles To Utilize Certain Alternative Fuels; To Provide That The Credit Shall Be An Amount Equal To 50% Of The Cost Or $5,000.00 Per Motor Vehicle, Whichever Is Less; To Provide That Any Such Tax Credit Claimed But Not Used In Any Taxable Year May Be Carried Forward For 10 Consecutive Tax Years From The Close Of The Tax Year In Which The Credit Was Earned; And For Related Purposes.

2054.title: Certified nurse practitioners; no physician supervision required if over 3,600 hours of clinical practice.
2054.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-25-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certified Nurse Practitioners With Over 3,600 Hours Of Clinical Practice Shall Not Be Required To Have A Written Collaborative Agreement With A Physician Or Be Required To Submit Patient Charts To A Physician For Review; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Civil commitment; include nurse practitioners as authorized evaluators.
2055.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-21-67, 41-21-69, 41-21-71 And 41-30-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Licensed Nurse Practitioners As Mandatory Evaluators For Civil Commitment And To Include Licensed Professional Counselors, Licensed Clinical Social Workers And Licensed Marriage And Family Therapists As Potential Second Evaluators For Civil Commitment; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: Nurse practitioners; define scope of practice and revise certification and collaboration requirements.
2056.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Scope Of Practice And To Revise And Modernize Requirements For Certification As A Nurse Practitioner By The Mississippi Board Of Nursing; To Establish Criteria For The Collaboration Of The Services Of A Certified Nurse Practitioner With The Practice Of A Licensed Physician; To Amend Section 73-25-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Collaborative Agreements Between Nurse Practitioners And Licensed Physicians Shall Be Approved By The State Board Of Medical Licensure And To Authorize A Nurse Practitioner Whose Collaborative Agreement Has Been Denied Or Terminated To Appeal Such Action To The State Board Of Health; And For Related Purposes.

2058.title: Children in custody of DHS; require notification of parents of child's siblings in conformity with federal law.
2058.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Mississippi Department Of Human Services To Notify The Parents Of A Child's Siblings When The Child Enters Agency Custody In Conformity With Federal Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Practice of podiatry; revise to include treatment of the ankle, muscles or tendons of the lower leg.
2059.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Scope Of Practice Of Podiatric Medicine To Include The Treatment Of The Ankle, Muscles Or Tendons Of The Lower Leg Governing The Functions Of The Foot And Ankle; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: Individuals with disabilities; require statutes and regulations to use "person first" references.
2060.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-6-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Statute Requiring Legislative Drafting Offices And State Agencies To Use Certain "person First" References To Individuals With Disabilities; And For Related Purposes.

2061.title: Caregiver Advise, Record, Enable (CARE) Act; record family caregivers upon admission to hospital.
2061.description: An Act To Authorize Hospitals To Provide Each Patient Or The Patient's Legal Guardian An Opportunity To Designate A Lay Caregiver After The Patient's Admission Into A Hospital And Before The Patient's Discharge To The Patient's Residence; To Provide That Designation Of A Lay Caregiver By A Patient Or A Patient's Legal Guardian Does Not Obligate Any Individual To Perform Any Aftercare Tasks For The Patient; To Provide That If A Patient Or The Patient's Guardian Has Designated A Lay Caregiver, A Hospital Shall Notify The Designated Lay Caregiver Of The Patient's Discharge To The Patient's Residence Or Transfer To Another Licensed Facility As Soon As Practicable; To Provide That If The Hospital Is Unable To Contact The Designated Lay Caregiver, The Lack Of Contact Shall Not Interfere With, Delay Or Otherwise Affect The Medical Care Provided To The Patient, Or An Appropriate Discharge Of The Patient; To Require The Hospital To Make A Reasonable Number Of Attempts To Consult With The Designated Lay Caregiver To Prepare Him Or Her For Aftercare And Issue A Discharge Plan Describing A Patient's Aftercare Needs; To Provide That If The Hospital Is Unable To Contact The Designated Lay Caregiver After A Reasonable Number Of Attempts, The Lack Of Contact Shall Not Interfere With, Delay Or Otherwise Affect An Appropriate Discharge Of The Patient; And For Related Purposes.

2062.title: Alternative fuel systems; expand loan program to all political subdivisions.
2062.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-421, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand To All Political Subdivisions The Program That Provides Loans To School Districts And Municipalities To Pay The Cost Of Purchasing Alternative Motor Fuel Vehicles, Converting Vehicles To Alternative Fuel And Providing Alternative Fuel Refueling Stations For Such Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2063.title: Adult care facilities; define for licensure and reimbursement purposes.
2063.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "adult Day Care Facility" For Purposes Of Institutional Licensure By The State Department Of Health; To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Rules, Regulations And Standards Regarding The Operation Of Adult Day Care Facilities Which Incorporate The Most Current Ranges And Levels Of Care Developed By The National Adult Day Services Association (nadsa), And To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Implement The Rap-back Criminal History Records System For Monitoring Employees At Licensed Adult Care Facilities; To Codify Section 43-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees For Adult Day Care Facility Licensure; To Amend Section 43-13-117.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Requirements And Levels Of Service For Medicaid Reimbursement For Adult Day Health Services By A Medicaid Waiver Provider; And For Related Purposes.

2064.title: CNG school bus purchase grants; authorize pilot program.
2064.description: An Act To Require The State Department Of Education To Establish A Compressed Natural Gas School Bus Grant Pilot Program To Provide School Districts In The Program With Grant Funds To Purchase Four School Buses Per District That Are Fueled With Compressed Natural Gas And Related Fueling Infrastructure; To Provide The Amount Of Such Grants; And For Related Purposes.

2065.title: Municipal annexation; require approval by majority of electors in area to be annexed and in certain adjoining areas.
2065.description: An Act To Create Section 21-1-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Election On The Question Of Municipal Annexation In The Territory Proposed To Be Annexed And In Certain Adjoining Territory; To Require The Governing Authorities Of The Municipality To Annex The Proposed Territory And The Unincorporated Areas Of Both The Census Block Where The Territory Is Located And Any Census Block Adjoining That Territory If Approved By A Majority Vote Of Qualified Electors; To Amend Sections 21-1-27, 21-1-29, 21-1-31, 21-1-33, 21-1-35, 21-1-37 And 21-1-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Question Of Municipal Annexation From The Chancery Court; And For Related Purposes.

2066.title: Workers' Compensation; increase maximum total recovery and remove cap on permanent total disability compensation.
2066.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-3-13, 71-3-17, 71-3-21 And 71-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Total Compensation That An Employee May Recover Under The Workers' Compensation Law, And To Provide That Compensation For Permanent Total Disability Shall Be Paid To The Employee Until His Death; And For Related Purposes.

2067.title: Disabilities; authorize designation of certain on driver's licenses or I.D. cards.
2067.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Designation Of Certain Disabilities On Driver's Licenses And Identification Cards Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Training For Law Enforcement Officers In Recognizing Certain Mental Or Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2068.title: Appropriations FY2016; State Department of Health, Taborian Urgent Care Center medical services.
2068.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of State General Funds To The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Implementing A Healthcare Network And Related Medical Emergency Services For The Taborian Urgent Care Center In Mount Bayou, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2016; And For Related Purposes.

2069.title: Courts; prohibit applying foreign law.
2069.description: An Act To Address The Application Of Foreign Laws In Judicial Proceedings In This State; To Provide Legislative Findings; To Define Certain Terms; To Prohibit The Use And Enforcement Of Foreign Laws Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Applicability In Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2070.title: Fondling of a child under 18; revise offense and penalty.
2070.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Fondling A Child Under The Age Of 18 And To Revise The Penalty Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2071.title: Controlled substance; revise Schedules I, II, III and IV.
2071.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Synthetic Cathinones To The List Of Stimulants In Schedule I; To Amend Section 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Hydrocodone Is A Schedule Ii Substance Even When In Combination With Other Materials; To Amend Section 41-29-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Drug Perampanel To Schedule Iii; To Amend Section 41-29-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Drug Alfaxalone To Schedule Iv; And For Related Purposes.

2072.title: Tishomingo County; authorize a tax on light wine, beer and alcoholic beverages to fund youth activities.
2072.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional 2% Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Light Wine, Beer And Alcoholic Beverages In The County; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Used To Promote Youth Activities; And For Related Purposes.

2073.title: Youth Services under Department of Human Services; make technical amendments.
2073.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Youth Court Intake Officer Is An Employee Of The County Or Municipality With Jurisdiction; To Amend Section 43-21-257, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Administrative Office Of The Courts Shall Maintain The State Central Registry Of Youth Court Cases Through The Mycids Documentation System; To Amend Section 43-27-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Obsolete Provisions Regarding Correctional Facilities For Juveniles And To Authorize A New State Adolescent Opportunity Program (aop) As Alternatives To Existing Community-based Programs For Use By The Youth Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2074.title: Enhanced penalty for simple and aggravated assault; enhance list of protected personnel.
2074.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Protected Personnel Triggering An Enhanced Penalty Under The Offenses Of Simple And Aggravated Assault; And For Related Purposes.

2075.title: Motor vehicles; define and regulate autocycles.
2075.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Autocycles; To Amend Section 63-1-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Autocycles From The Requirement Of A Motorcycle Endorsement License; To Amend Section 63-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Use Of Seat Belts In Autocycles; To Amend Section 63-7-64, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Autocycles From The Motorcycle Helmet Requirement; To Amend Section 63-17-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Autocycles In The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Commission Law; To Amend Section 63-17-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Autocycles In The Motor Vehicle Warranty Enforcement Act; And For Related Purposes.

2076.title: Medical Radiation Technologist Registration Law; extend repealers.
2076.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-58-1, 41-58-3 And 41-58-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Statutes Providing For The Registration Of Medical Radiation Technologists; To Further Amend Section 41-58-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "nuclear Medicine Technologist"; And For Related Purposes.

2077.title: Hospice licensure; extend moratorium and repealer on new applications.
2077.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-85-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The State Department Of Health From Processing Any New Applications For Hospice Licensure Or Issuing Any New Hospice Licenses, Except Renewals, Unless The Application Was Pending On March 1, 2013; To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On This Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2078.title: Sexual battery; conform statute of limitation to rape.
2078.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Passage Of Time Will Not Bar Prosecution For Sexual Battery Without Regard To The Age Of The Victim; And For Related Purposes.

2081.title: Sales taxation; exempt hearing aids when ordered or prescribed by a licensed physician, audiologist or hearing aid specialist.
2081.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Hearing Aids When Ordered Or Prescribed By A Licensed Physician, Audiologist Or Hearing Aid Specialist For Medical Purposes Of A Patient; And For Related Purposes.

2082.title: Divorce; revise property settlement and child custody when on ground of irreconcilable difference.
2082.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Disposition Of Property Settlement And Child Custody Issues Under Certain Circumstances In A Proceeding To Obtain Divorce On The Ground Of Irreconcilable Differences; And For Related Purposes.

2083.title: Waste management fees; exempt certain county-owned nonhazardous solid waste management facilities from.
2083.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-17-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain County-owned Nonhazardous Solid Waste Management Facilities From The Per-ton Fees Imposed On The Management Of Waste; And For Related Purposes.

2084.title: Emergency management; local emergency may be declared by public official authorized by the governing body of a county.
2084.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Local Emergency May Be Proclaimed By The Public Official Authorized By The Governing Body Of A County; And For Related Purposes.

2085.title: Local governments; may adopt regulations for waiver of certification that goods or services have been received or performed.
2085.description: An Act To Codify Section 17-25-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governing Authority Of Any County Or Municipality To Adopt Rules And Regulations For Offices, Departments, Agencies, Divisions Or Boards Under Its Governance For The Waiver Of Certification That Goods Or Services Have Been Received Or Performed; And For Related Purposes.

2087.title: Bonds; clarify use of bond proceeds for a multipurpose building for the Department of Mental Health in Kemper County.
2087.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 602, Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Section 15, Chapter 431, Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Section 37, Chapter 530, Laws Of 2014, To Make It Clear That The Proceeds Of Bonds Issued Under Such Section Must Be Utilized For The Construction Of A Multipurpose Building In Kemper County For The Department Of Mental Health; And For Related Purposes.

2088.title: MAEP funding and local school funding sources; require school districts to identify and account for expenditures separately.
2088.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School Districts To Identify And Account For Mississippi Adequate Education Program (maep) Funding Expenditures Separately From Expenditures From Local And Other Sources Of Funds In A Manner Prescribed By The State Department Of Education; To Clarify The Limitation On Budgeted Expenditures For School District Administration Costs; And For Related Purposes.

2091.title: Abortions; increase the minimum waiting period to 72 hours.
2091.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-41-33, 41-41-34 And 41-41-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Minimum Waiting Period Before A Woman Can Have An Abortion From 24 Hours To 72 Hours; And For Related Purposes.

2092.title: Income tax; public and private hospitals may collect certain debts by a set off against the debtor's refund.
2092.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure To Allow Public And Private Hospitals To Collect Certain Debts Through A Setoff Against Income Tax Refunds Owed The Debtor; To Provide For Hearing And Appeals In Contested Cases; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Transfer The Income Tax Refunds Of A Debtor To Claimant Hospital For The Purpose Of Satisfying Such Debts; To Amend Section 27-7-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2093.title: Elective state-funded course for academic study of the Bible; direct State Board of Education to approve curriculum for.
2093.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Approve A Curriculum For An Elective State-funded Course For Nonsectarian, Nonreligious Academic Study Of The Bible; And For Related Purposes.

2094.title: Motor vehicles; authorize a distinctive motor vehicle license tag for supporters of various organizations.
2094.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Leland School District, Byram Middle School, East Webster High School, Murrah High School, East Side High School And The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Authorize The Issuance Of A Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tag Commemorating The Tricentennial Of The Establishment Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; To Amend Section 27-19-56.209, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of St. Martin High School; To Amend Section 27-19-56.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Identifying A Person As A Recipient Of The Purple Heart Medal To Bear The International Symbol Of Access Adopted By Rehabilitation International In 1969 At Its Eleventh World Congress On Rehabilitation If The Applicant For Such Tag Is Eligible To Receive A Distinctive Tag Under Section 27-19-56; To Amend Section 27-19-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 27-19-56.88, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes A Distinctive License Tag For The "friends Of The Med" In Coahoma County; And For Related Purposes.

2095.title: Funeral escort vehicles; may be marked with purple lights when leading a military funeral procession.
2095.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Any Nonlaw Enforcement Vehicle Being Used To Lead And Facilitate The Movement Of A Military Funeral Procession To Be Marked With Blinking, Rotating Or Oscillating Purple Lights; And For Related Purposes.

2096.title: 811 Law; operator must obtain permission before crossing/entering private property to mark underground utility lines.
2096.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Operator To Obtain Permission From The Property Owner Before Crossing Or Entering Private Property To Mark Underground Utility Lines Or Underground Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2097.title: Smartphones; require kill switch.
2097.description: An Act To Require That All Cell Phones Manufactured And Sold In Mississippi After A Certain Date Must Be Equipped With A Kill Switch; To Prohibit Interruptions Of Communications Services Except As Provided By Law; To Provide For Judicial Review; To Enact Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2098.title: Income tax: authorize credits for certain child care expenses and for pre-k providers for care of certain children.
2098.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers In An Amount Equal To Child Care Expenses Paid By Taxpayers For Child Care For Their Children To Prekindergarten Providers Who Participate In The Early Learning Collaborative Act Of 2013; To Authorize A Tax Credit For Prekindergarten Providers Who Participate In The Early Learning Collaborative Act; And For Related Purposes.

2099.title: School boards; prohibit school employees from serving as a member of any local school board.
2099.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-306, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit School Employees From Serving As A Member Of Any Local School Board; And For Related Purposes.

2100.title: Corporation franchise tax; phase out for business enterprises classified as manufacturers by the IRS.
2100.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Corporation Franchise Tax On Business Enterprises That Are Classified Under The Internal Revenue Service Principal Business Or Professional Activity Codes As Manufacturers And Primarily Operating As A Manufacturer In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2101.title: Child support; may continue past age of majority for a disabled child.
2101.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Child Support For A Child With A Disability May Continue Past The Age Of Majority; And For Related Purposes.

2102.title: Regional correctional facility; MDOC may contract with Lee County to house offenders in such facility.
2102.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-931, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Contract With Lee County To House State Offenders In A Regional Correctional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2103.title: Sixteenth section land; clarify school districts' authority to purchase easement for access to.
2103.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Prohibition Against A School District Utilizing The Power Of Eminent Domain In Order To Obtain An Easement For Access To Sixteenth Section Land; And For Related Purposes.

2104.title: Bail bonds; may not be written on credit and premium may not be discounted.
2104.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-39-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Professional Bail Agent Or His Agent From Writing A Bail Bond On Credit Or Without Collecting The Full Premium; And For Related Purposes.

2105.title: Appropriation FY2016; Elvis Presley Memorial Foundation for completing Master Plan 2000.
2105.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Elvis Presley Memorial Foundation, For The Purpose Of Completing "master Plan 2000" For Fy2016; And For Related Purposes.

2106.title: Income taxation; authorize a credit for certain physicians who train residents in certain accredited residency programs.
2106.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Are Physicians Who Are Not Primarily Employed By An Academic Medical Center And Who Train Family Medicine Residents In A Family Medicine Residency Program Accredited By The Accreditation Council For Graduate Medical Education Or The American Osteopathic Association; To Provide That The Allocation Of The Tax Credit For Each Clinical Rotation Shall Be Made By The Residency Program Providing Training For The Resident Physician And Verified By The Office Of Mississippi Physician Workforce; To Amend Section 41-123-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2107.title: Mississippi University Research Authority Act; extend eligibility for an exemption to certain university officers or employees.
2107.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-147-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Eligibility For An Exemption Under The Mississippi University Research Authority Act To University Officers Or Employees Who Make Valuable Contributions To The Commercialization Of University Technologies; And For Related Purposes.

2108.title: University law enforcement officers; revise jurisdiction to enforce traffic and criminal laws.
2108.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-105-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A University's Law Enforcement Officers To Enforce The Laws Of The State On Property That Is Within 500 Feet Of Any Property Owned By The University; And For Related Purposes.

2109.title: School attendance and absenteeism; restore former requirement for compulsory attendance law & ADA calculations under MAEP.
2109.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Restore The Former Requirement That A Compulsory-school-age Child Who Is Absent More Than 40% Of The Instructional Day Must Be Considered Absent The Entire Day; To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "minimum School Term" And "average Daily Attendance" As Such Terms Are Used For Determining Allocations To School Districts Under The Adequate Education Program To Conform To The Student Absentee Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2110.title: Newborn screening program, direct State Board of Health to include Krabbe Newborn Screening.
2110.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Health To Include Screening For Early Infantile Krabbe Disease (eikd) In Its Comprehensive Newborn Screening Program; And For Related Purposes.

2111.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for supporters of East Webster High School.
2111.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of East Webster High School; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2112.title: Crime Lab; rename "Mississippi Forensics Laboratory" and extend Bureau of Narcotics' authority to advertise forfeitures online.
2112.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-21-105, 41-61-57, 41-61-63, 41-61-77, 45-1-2, 45-1-25, 45-1-29, 45-1-31, 45-33-23, 45-33-35, 45-33-37, 57-21-9, 63-11-5, 63-11-8, 63-11-13, 63-11-19, 63-11-32, 63-11-47 And 99-39-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Identify The State's Primary Criminal Examination, Research And Analysis Laboratory Designed For The Detection And Investigation Of Crime As The Mississippi Forensics Laboratory; To Amend Section 99-49-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 257, 2015 Regular Session, To Conform; To Amend Section 41-29-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Advertising For The Administrative Forfeiture Of Property Under The Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 484, Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Section 5, Chapter 501, Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On Section 41-29-176; And For Related Purposes.

2113.title: Mississippi Responder Management System; provide workers' compensation and death benefits coverage for registrants of.
2113.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Workers' Compensation And Death Benefits Coverage For Registrants In The Mississippi Responder Management System; And For Related Purposes.

2114.title: MS Commission on College and Career Readiness; establish to recommend new standards to replace Common Core.
2114.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Commission On College And Career Readiness To Develop And Recommend New Curriculum And Assessment Standards For The Public Schools Based On National And International Benchmarks; To Provide For The Membership Of The Commission And To Provide That The Commission Shall Be Located Administratively In The State Department Of Education; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Consider The New Mississippi College And Career Readiness Standards Recommended By The Commission; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Remove The Common Core Copyright And Any References To The Common Core Standards From The Mississippi College And Career Readiness Standards; To Provide For Student Confidentiality; To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Discontinue Parcc Student Assessments Or Any Other Consortia Developed Test; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete Until January 1, 2017, The Requirement That The State Department Of Education Combine The State School Accountability System With The Federal System; To Conform References To The State Accountability Standards To The "mississippi College And Career-ready Standards"; To Amend Section 37-177-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2115.title: MS Gaming Commission; provide procedure to withhold gaming winnings of parents with child support arrearages.
2115.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare As Public Policy That Children Are Adversely Affected When A Parent Who Has Outstanding Child Support Arrearages Diverts Child Support To Gaming; To Codify Section 75-76-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Procedures For The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Department Of Human Services And Licensees Under Chapter 76 Of Title 75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Carry Out The Intercept And Seizure Of Game Winnings Of Parents With Child Support Arrearages; And For Related Purposes.

2116.title: Health care certificate of need law (CON); enact moratorium on exemption of low-energy radiation therapy services.
2116.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-173, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Exemption From The Applicability Of The Health Care Certificate Of Need Law For Low-energy Radiation Therapy Services And Equipment Shall Be Suspended Unless The Application For The Operation Of Such Services Was Pending With The State Department Of Health On January 1, 2015; To Direct The State Board Of Health To Develop And Present A Report To The Legislature On The Continuation Of This Exemption And To Impose An Automatic Repealer On The Definition Of Radiation Therapy Services Under The Con Law; And For Related Purposes.

2117.title: Banks; shall post owner information of ATM if owned by another bank or entity.
2117.description: An Act To Require Any Bank That Has An Automated Teller Machine Located On Its Premises That Is Owned By Another Financial Institution Or Other Entity To Affix On The Front Of The Machine The Name, Address And Contact Information Of The Owner; And For Related Purposes.

2118.title: State agencies; require to accept payment by personal check upon certain conditions.
2118.description: An Act To Require All State Agencies, Departments, Boards Or Commissions To Accept Personal Checks For Payment Of Any License, Permit, Fee Or Any Obligation Owing To The Agency Or Trust Deposit; And For Related Purposes.

2119.title: Texting; prohibit while driving for those under 18.
2119.description: An Act To Create Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Texting While Driving; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide Exemptions; To Repeal Section 63-1-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Texting While Driving By The Holders Of Temporary And Intermediate Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2120.title: Red light; motorcycle may proceed with due caution under certain circumstances.
2120.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Motorcycle To Proceed Through A Red Light Using Due Caution Under Certain Limited Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2121.title: State takeover of school districts; provide timeline and exit criteria for school district conservators.
2121.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Provide Specific Findings Of Accreditation Violations, Financial Mismanagement Or Academic Deficiencies In Order For The Governor To Declare An Emergency Resulting In A State Takeover Of The District, To Define The Authority Of A State Conservator Appointed By The State Board Of Education To Administer A School District In State Takeover Status, And To Provide A Time Limitation For The Authority Of Such School District Conservator And Specific Exit Criteria Unless The Governor Continues The State Takeover; And For Related Purposes.

2122.title: Determination of cost of adequate education program; define student "average daily membership" (ADM) for purpose of formula.
2122.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "average Daily Membership (adm)" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Determination Of The Basic Adequate Education Program Cost For Each School District Based On Student Average Daily Membership With Certain Exceptions; To Provide For Student Counts By The State Auditor; To Amend Sections 37-151-85, 37-151-97 And 37-151-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2123.title: Municipally owned waterworks; prohibit from charging higher rates to certain customers in another municipality.
2123.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Certain Municipalities From Charging Greater Rates For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Outside Of And Within One Mile Of The Corporate Limits Of The Municipality Than For Water Supplied To Consumers Residing Within The Municipality; To Amend Section 77-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Section; And For Related Purposes.

2124.title: Local government capital improvements revolving loan program; include municipal natural gas facilities.
2124.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "capital Improvements" For Purposes Of The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Program To Include Repair, Renovation And Improvement Of Municipal Natural Gas Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2125.title: Privilege license tax; local governments may reduce or waive.
2125.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-17-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Reduce Or Waive The Amount Imposed As A Tax To Secure A Privilege License; And For Related Purposes.

2126.title: Education Employment Procedures Law; increase probationary period for newly hired certified employees on phased-in basis.
2126.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Probationary Period Under The Education Employment Procedures Law (eepl) For Certified School District Employees On A Phased-in Basis; And For Related Purposes.

2127.title: Legislative Internship Program; authorize IHL to administer under certain conditions.
2127.description: An Act To Establish A Legislative Internship Program To Allow Third-year Students At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning To Work For Members Of The Senate Or House Of Representatives And Receive Academic Credit; To Provide Certain Conditions On This Program; And For Related Purposes.

2129.title: Lotteries; repeal advertising prohibitions.
2129.description: An Act To Repeal Section 97-33-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits The Advertising Of Lotteries; To Repeal Section 97-33-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Publication Or Circulation Of Newspapers Advertising A Lottery; To Repeal Section 97-33-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits The Sale Of Newspapers Containing A Lottery Advertisement; And For Related Purposes.

2130.title: Official Mississippi state song; authorize two state songs.
2130.description: An Act Authorizing Mississippi To Have Two Official State Songs Consisting Of The Present Official State Song "go Mississippi" And "my Home Mississippi"; And For Related Purposes.

2131.title: Official state song; adopt "My Home Mississippi."
2131.description: An Act Adopting "my Home Mississippi" By Delma Furniss As The Official State Song; And For Related Purposes.

2132.title: Official State Book; Holy Bible shall be.
2132.description: An Act To Provide That The Holy Bible Shall Be The Official State Book; And For Related Purposes.

2133.title: Daylight saving time; state and political subdivisions shall observe year-round.
2133.description: An Act To Provide That Daylight Saving Time Shall Be The Year-round Standard Time Of The Entire State Of Mississippi And All Of Its Political Subdivisions; To Authorize Each School District To Adjust School Start Times Due To The Year-round Observance Of Daylight Saving Time; And For Related Purposes.

2134.title: Cyberbullying; revise and clarify electronic communication offenses.
2134.description: An Act To Revise And Clarify Electronic Communication Offenses; To Amend Section 97-29-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Obscene Electronic Communication; To Amend Section 97-45-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cyberstalking; To Amend Section 97-45-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cyberbullying; And For Related Purposes.

2135.title: Sanitation vehicles; conform penalty for improper passing of, and duty of care for drivers of.
2135.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-809, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Penalty For Improper Passing Of A Stationary Sanitation Vehicle To The Penalty For Similar Offenses Involving Stationary Vehicles Such As Utility Service Trucks; To Provide That The Duty Of Care Imposed On Drivers Of Sanitation Vehicles Is Not Lessened Under The Statute; And For Related Purposes.

2136.title: Bicycle safety; require helmets when riding on public streets.
2136.description: An Act To Provide That All Operators Of Bicycles, Tricycles And Skateboards Wear A Helmet When Riding On Any Public Road, Highway Or Bike Path; And For Related Purposes.

2137.title: General obligation bonds; authorize issuance for a wastewater facility in the Byram-Clinton corridor area.
2137.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hinds County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction And Development Of A Centralized Wastewater Treatment Facility For The Byram-clinton Corridor Area; And For Related Purposes.

2138.title: CPR/AED; require to be taught as instructional component of physical or health education curriculum.
2138.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-134, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Proper Administration Of Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (cpr) And Use Of An Automated External Defibrillator (aed) Shall Be Included As An Instructional Component Of The Physical Or Health Education Curriculum; And For Related Purposes.

2139.title: Teacher supply debit cards; allow state special school teachers to receive.
2139.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-61-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Authorized Expenditures From The Education Enhancement Fund To The Mississippi School For The Arts, Mississippi School For Math And Science, The Mississippi School For The Blind And The Mississippi School For The Deaf; And For Related Purposes.

2140.title: Third Circuit District; revise residency requirement.
2140.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Subdistrict Residency Requirements In The Third Circuit District; And For Related Purposes.

2141.title: Assistant teachers; increase salaries for.
2141.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Salaries For Assistant Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

2142.title: Teaching Fellows Program under the State Board of Education; make technical revisions.
2142.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Award And Qualifications For Applicants To The Teaching Fellows Program, Clarify Repayment Terms And Authorize The State Board Of Education To Set Regulations Regarding Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2145.title: Local school superintendents; all appointed after January 1, 2020, except pursuant to referendum.
2145.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-9-13, 37-9-25 And 37-5-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Appointment Of All Superintendents Of Schools From And After January 1, 2020; To Authorize A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education In Counties Pursuant To Petition; To Repeal Effective July 1, 2015, Sections 37-5-61, 37-5-63, 37-5-65, 37-5-67, 37-5-69, 37-5-71 And 37-5-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Changing The Position Of County Superintendent Of Education To An Appointed Office Pursuant To Petition And Referendum, Provide For The Reestablishment Of The Office As An Elective Office, Authorize The Appointment Of The County Superintendent Of Education In Certain Counties, Provide For The Selection And Qualifications Of Elected Superintendents In Certain Counties, Provide For The Filling Of Vacancies In The Office Of Elected County Superintendent Of Education, And Section 37-9-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For A Referendum On The Question Of Retaining The Elective Method Of Choosing The County Superintendent Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

2146.title: Court reporters; increase annual salary of.
2146.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Salary Of Court Reporters For Circuit And Chancery Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2147.title: Third Grade "Reading Gate" Literacy-Based Promotion Act; delay retention requirement for 2 years.
2147.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-177-9, 37-177-13 And 37-177-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay The Third Grade "reading Gate" Literacy-based Promotion Act Retention Requirement For 2 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2148.title: Public purchasing; state and local entities shall use life-cycle costs to determine lowest and best bid for vehicle purchases.
2148.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Lowest And Best Bid For Purchases Of Motor Vehicles Made By State Agencies And Governing Authorities Of Municipalities And Counties Shall Be Determined By Using Life-cycle Costs; And For Related Purposes.

2149.title: Military officers and employees; grant leave of absence from civil occupations in public or private business.
2149.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Officers And Employees Of Any Public Or Private Business Or Industry Who Are Active Members Of The Military Shall Be Entitled To Military Leave Of Absence From Their Respective Civil Duties And Occupations; And For Related Purposes.

2150.title: Riding bailiffs; revise per diem.
2150.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-25-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Pay To Be Paid To A Riding Bailiff Per Day Of Service; To Amend Section 19-19-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2151.title: State employee salaries; direct State Personnel Board to implement 5% across-the-board increase.
2151.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Personnel Board To Amend The Variable Compensation Plan As Necessary To Award A Salary Increase To Each State Employee Whose Salary Is Funded By The State General Fund In The Amount Of A 5% Across-the-board Increase Per Year Beginning July 1, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

2152.title: Mississippi Department of Human Services; extend automatic repealers on.
2152.description: An Act To Amend Sections 43-1-1, 43-1-2, 43-1-3, 43-1-5, 43-1-55 And 43-27-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealers On Those Statutes Which Establish The Mississippi Department Of Human Services And Its Divisions, And Provide Qualifications For Family Protection Specialists; To Amend Section 43-27-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Duties And Responsibilities Of The Division Of Youth Services; And For Related Purposes.

2153.title: Antlered deer; all of bag limit for hunters 75 or older may be any antlered deer.
2153.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Hunters 75 Years Of Age Or Older All Of The Bag Limit On Antlered Deer Set By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks May Be Any Antlered Deer; And For Related Purposes.

2154.title: Check Cashers Act; clarify the term and maximum fee for multiple delayed deposit checks.
2154.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Term And Maximum Fee For Multiple Delayed Deposit Checks Under The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2155.title: Helen's Law; require law enforcement agencies to adopt E911 response policies.
2155.description: An Act To Be Known As "helen's Law;" To Amend Section 19-5-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Law Enforcement Agencies To Adopt E911 Response Policies; To Impose Loss Of State And Federal Funding For Noncompliant Law Enforcement Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2156.title: Professional association dues deduction by teachers; authorize.
2156.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Deduction Of Professional Association Dues By Local School District Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

2157.title: State Employees Health Insurance Plan; extend repealer on provision providing for the payment of premiums.
2157.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provision Providing For The Payment Of Premiums Under The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan; And For Related Purposes.

2158.title: Youth court records; revise confidentiality.
2158.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Persons And Entities To Whom Youth Court Records Can Be Disclosed By Order Of The Youth Court; And For Related Purposes.

2159.title: Public works; increase to $100,000.00 the amount exempt from supervision by engineers and architects.
2159.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-13-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From Less Than $75,000.00 To Less Than $100,000.00 Public Works Expenditures That Are Exempt From The Provision That Prohibits The Award Of A Contract For Construction Of A Public Work By The State And Its Political Subdivisions Unless The Plans, Specifications And Estimates Have Been Prepared By A Registered Professional Engineer Or Architect; To Remove The Provision That Exempts Municipalities From The Prohibition If The Public Work Is Not Financed In Whole Or In Part Through The Issuance Of Bonds; To Provide That Professional Engineers Or Architects May Submit Prices For Services Prior To Be Selected To Perform Any Work; And For Related Purposes.

2160.title: Alcoholic beverage license tax; eliminate portion retained by the state while maintaining portion paid to local governments.
2160.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount Of The License Tax For Certain Permits Issued Under The Alcoholic Beverage Control Law By Eliminating The Additional Tax That Is Currently Retained By The State For Purchases Exceeding $5,000.00 While Maintaining The Additional Tax For Such Purchases That Is Paid To Local Governments; And For Related Purposes.

2163.title: Sex offender registration; conform to Adam Walsh Act for certain juvenile offenders.
2163.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Registration Of Juvenile Sex Offenders To The Requirements Of The Federal Adam Walsh Act; And For Related Purposes.

2165.title: Youth court; clarify original jurisdiction of certain serious crimes.
2165.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Original Jurisdiction Of The Youth And Circuit Courts Over Certain Serious Crimes Committed By Minors; And For Related Purposes.

2166.title: Sex offender registration; clarify for very young offenders.
2166.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Sex Offender Registration Status Of Certain Very Young Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

2167.title: Expunction; revise list of felonies that a first-time offender is allowed to expunge.
2167.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Type Of Felony Offenses That A First-time Offender Is Allowed To Expunge; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction; And For Related Purposes.

2168.title: Dental hygienists; provide for general supervision of licensed dental hygienists by licensed dentists.
2168.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-9-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For General Supervision Of Licensed Dental Hygienists By Licensed Dentists; To Provide Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

2170.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that employ veterans.
2170.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who Are Honorably Discharged Veterans Who Served On Active Duty In The Armed Forces Of The United States On Or After September 11, 2001, And Who Have Been Unemployed For Six Consecutive Months Immediately Prior To Being Employed By Such Taxpayers; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Authorize Any Tax Credit Claimed But Not Used In Any Taxable Year To Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years; And For Related Purposes.

2171.title: Health insurance exchange navigators and certified application counselors; require licensure by the MS Department of Insurance.
2171.description: An Act To Provide That A Person May Not Act Or Claim To Be A Navigator Or Certified Application Counselor Under Federal Law To Assist Individuals In Obtaining Health Insurance Through A Health Benefit Exchange Unless That Person Has A License; To Prescribe Definitions And Requirements For Such Licensure To Be Issued By The Mississippi Department Of Insurance; To Provide For Enforcement Of Violations Of This Act By The Mississippi Department Of Insurance And To Authorize Rules And Regulations For The Enforcement Of This Act; To Provide Exemptions; To Provide For Criminal History Records Checks; And For Related Purposes.

2172.title: Keyaurdra's Law; require unique identifying mark on bullet casings.
2172.description: An Act To Be Known As Keyaurdra's Law; To Create New Section 97-37-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That All Center-fire Pistol And Rifle Cartridges Sold In Mississippi Bear A Unique Identifying Mark; To Require Sellers Of Ammunition To Keep Records As To The Purchaser Of Such Ammunition By Serial Number Or Other Unique Identifying Mark; And For Related Purposes.

2173.title: Burn bans; allow board of supervisors to provide an exemption for certain persons.
2173.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Boards Of Supervisors To Provide An Exemption To Outdoor Burning Bans For Persons Who Are Certified To Perform Controlled Burns; And For Related Purposes.

2174.title: Assistant teachers/reading instructors; require in each K-3 class.
2174.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Employ Assistant Teachers/reading Instructors In Each Kindergarten, First Grade, Second Grade And Third Grade Class And To Provide That The State Shall Allot Sufficient Funding For These Assistant Teachers/reading Instructors; And For Related Purposes.

2175.title: Youthful Offender Unit; offenders housed in to remain under court's jurisdiction.
2175.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Offenders Placed On Earned Probation In The Youthful Offender Unit (you) Shall Remain Under The Court's Jurisdiction; To Require The Court's Approval Before Those Offenders May Be Transferred From The You; To Amend Section 47-5-1401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2176.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that employ certain supervised offenders.
2176.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who Is An Offender Who Is Being Supervised By The Community Corrections Division Of The Department Of Corrections Or Who Has Been Discharged From The Custody Of The Department Of Corrections; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; And For Related Purposes.

2177.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt hunting and/or fishing leases on sixteenth section lands.
2177.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Leases That Grant Hunting And/or Fishing Privileges On Sixteenth Section School Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2179.title: Concealed-carry permit; revise fees.
2179.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Charged In Connection With Concealed-carry Permits; And For Related Purposes.

2182.title: Commercial motor vehicle registration; reenact penalties for unlawful operation of.
2182.description: An Act To Reenact Section 27-19-60, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Was Repealed By Operation Of Law On July 1, 2014, To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Deny Registration And Licensing Or Revoke Or Suspend Licensing Of Commercial Motor Vehicles Operated By Certain Persons, And To Authorize The Removal Of License Plates From Commercial Motor Vehicles Of Persons Who Have Been Prohibited From Operating By A Federal Or State Agency Responsible For Motor Carrier Safety; To Amend Section 27-19-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Unlawful To Willfully And Knowingly Make Any False Statement Or Representation On The Registration Application For A Commercial Motor Vehicle In Order To Circumvent The Federal Prohibition From Operating In Interstate Commerce Or The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi, Or To Attempt To Register A Commercial Motor Vehicle On Behalf Of Another Person In Order To Circumvent The Federal Prohibition From Operating In Interstate Commerce Or The Laws Of The State Of Mississippi; To Reenact Section 27-19-90, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Was Repealed By Operation Of Law On July 1, 2014, To Provide Criminal Penalties For Any Person Who Willfully And Knowingly Alters, Forges Or Counterfeits Any License Plate, Decal, Permit Or Other Document Required For A Commercial Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

2183.title: Limited Lines Travel Insurance Act; enact.
2183.description: An Act To Create The Limited Lines Travel Insurance Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Authorize A Travel Retailer To Offer And Disseminate Travel Insurance Under A Limited Lines Travel Insurance Producer Business Entity License Under Certain Conditions; To Require The Travel Retailer To Make Certain Disclosures; To Require Registration Of Limited Lines Travel Insurance Producers Under The Act; To Provide That Limited Lines Travel Insurance Producers And Travel Retailers Shall Be Subject To Unfair Trade Practices Provisions And Certain Enforcement Provisions Applicable To Insurance Producers; And For Related Purposes.

2184.title: Constables; allow fee for attempt to serve the process.
2184.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Constables To Receive The Uniform Fee When The Defendant Cannot Be Found After Two Documented Actual Attempts To Serve The Process; And For Related Purposes.

2185.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; reauthorize issuance to supporters of St. Martin High School.
2185.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.209, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reauthorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of St. Martin High School; And For Related Purposes.

2186.title: Ports; remove members from a county with a county port who are on the board of the Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority.
2186.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-17-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Conflict Of Interest By Removing The Members On The Board Of The Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority Who Are Appointed From A County That Has A County Port; And For Related Purposes.

2187.title: Diamondhead Water & Sewer District; board members shall be appointed by City of Diamondhead.
2187.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-167, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Members Of The Board Of Commissioners Of The Diamondhead Water And Sewer District Shall Be Appointed By The Governing Authority Of The City Of Diamondhead; And For Related Purposes.

2188.title: Auto repair shops; prohibit certain labor charges by.
2188.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-501, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Motor Vehicle Repair Shops From Charging Labor Rates In Excess Of A Certain Percentage Above The National Average For Like Kind Work; And For Related Purposes.

2189.title: Auto insurance; revise requirement that insurer paying a claim must add name of repair business or lienholder on the check.
2189.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-551, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirement That An Automobile Insurer Paying A Claim Shall Add The Name Of The Repair Business Or Lienholder On The Check; And For Related Purposes.

2190.title: Genetic testing; reimbursement of costs to a father successfully asserting paternity.
2190.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Court's Duty To Decree A Child's Surname In An Order Of Filiation And To Provide That The Father Seeking An Order Of Filiation Cannot Be Charged More For Genetic Testing Than Would Be Charged To The Mother Proceeding Against A Putative Father To Seek An Order Of Filiation; To Amend Section 93-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Defendant In A Paternity Action To Reimburse The Successful Plaintiff; And For Related Purposes.

2191.title: Deer processors; authorize to cover 50% of processing cost from abandoning individuals after 90 days.
2191.description: An Act To Require Individuals Engaged In Processing Wild Game To Recover From The Deliverer Of The Wild Game Fifty Percent Of The Costs Associated With Preparing The Wild Game For Human Consumption After Ninety Days Of The Original Date Of Delivery; To Require The Processing Establishment To Make Reasonable Attempts To Contact The Owner Of The Wild Game To Collect The Wild Game; And For Related Purposes.

2192.title: Easements; clarify purchase of for access.
2192.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Prohibition Against A School District Utilizing The Power Of Eminent Domain In Order To Obtain An Easement For Access To Sixteenth Section Land; And For Related Purposes.

2194.title: Bicycles; require lamps and reflectors for safety during nighttime riding.
2194.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-1307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Bicycles Operated At Night To Be Equipped With Lamp And Reflector Safety Equipment; To Amend Sections 63-7-11 And 63-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2195.title: E911; create criminal immunity for seeking treatment for overdose.
2195.description: An Act To Create New Section 41-29-149.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The "mississippi Medical Emergency Good Samaritan Act" To Provide Immunity From Arrest Or Prosecution For Certain Drug Violations By A Person Seeking Treatment For A Drug Overdose If The Evidence Of The Violation Results From The Medical Treatment Of The Drug Overdose; And For Related Purposes.

2196.title: Public Trust Tidelands; auth. leases for residential purposes on Lowry Island and auth. SOS to share sublease income with city.
2196.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-1-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Residential Leases On Lowry Island; To Delete References To Multiunit Residential Structures; To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Share Sublease Income With The City; And For Related Purposes.

2197.title: Wildlife; require Commission on Wildlife to issue depredation permits to farmers to use dogs during turkey season to control wild hogs.
2197.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Issue Depredation Permits For Farmers To Use Dogs During Turkey Season For The Control Of Wild Hogs; To Authorize The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Establish The Term Of The Permits; And For Related Purposes.

2198.title: Surplus lines premium tax; exempt property risk written by and through Dept. of Finance & Administration.
2198.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-21-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Property Risk Written By And Through The Department Of Finance And Administration From The Payment Of Surplus Line Premium Tax; And For Related Purposes.

2199.title: Marine Resources fees; authorize Commission on Marine Resources to adjust fees to cover costs of permitting programs.
2199.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Marine Resources To Adjust Fees To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources; To Create The Department Of Marine Resources Program Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2200.title: Environmental justice; require meaningful involvement of all people in siting process.
2200.description: An Act To Require The Fair Treatment And Meaningful Involvement Of All People Regardless Of Race, Color, National Origin Or Income With Regard To The Development And Enforcement Of Environmental Laws And The Siting Of Certain Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2201.title: Natural resources; recommend an assessment of the value of Mississippi's natural resources.
2201.description: An Act To Recommend The Assessment Of The Economic Value Of The Natural Resources Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

2203.title: Environmental Quality; require the department to identify all coal ash dam sites.
2203.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Environmental Quality To Identify And Publish The Locations Of All Coal Ash Dam Sites In The State And To Develop Regulations To Monitor Such Sites; And For Related Purposes.

2204.title: Computer and electronic waste; require management plan for recycling and disposal.
2204.description: An Act To Provide A Program For The Recycling And Disposal Of Computer And Electronic Solid Waste; To Require Each State Agency To Implement Such Program; To Provide For The Sale Or Donation Of Such Equipment; To Create A Computer And Electronic Recycling Fund; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Fund Proceeds; And For Related Purposes.

2205.title: Environmental Quality; require commission to adopt rules on radon control.
2205.description: An Act Requiring The Commission On Environmental Quality To Adopt Rules For Radon Control; And For Related Purposes.

2206.title: Railroad grade crossings; prohibit obstruction of vehicular traffic for more than 20 consecutive minutes at grade crossings.
2206.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-9-235, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Train, Railroad Car Or Equipment, Or Engine From Obstructing Vehicular Traffic At A Railroad Grade Crossing Upon A Public Street, Road Or Highway For A Period In Excess Of 20 Consecutive Minutes; To Provide Exceptions To Such Prohibition; To Provide Fines For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2207.title: Environmental fees; authorize Commission on Environmental Quality to set to cover costs of permitting programs.
2207.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Create The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Amend Sections 51-3-31, 51-5-1, 53-7-21, 53-7-25, 53-7-69 And 49-31-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission To Set Program Fees And To Direct Fees To The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Bring Forward Section 53-7-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Applications For The Modification, Transfer Or Reissuance Of Any Surface Mining Permit, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2208.title: Single state/federal system for school district accountability; delay requirement.
2208.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay The Requirement That The State Department Of Education Combine The State School Accountability System With The Federal System Until January 1, 2016; And For Related Purposes.

2209.title: State Department of Education; provide technical amendments to administrative authority.
2209.description: An Act Relating To The Administrative Authority Of The State Department Of Education; To Amend Section 37-3-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Time Period For Local School Districts To Publish Annual Reports; To Amend Section 37-9-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Financial Advisors Appointed By The State Superintendent Of Education Shall Be Deemed To Be Independent Contractors; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Travel Restrictions On Local School Boards And Superintendents Of Failing School Districts And To Clarify Standards For Publication Of Notice Of Failing School Districts; To Amend Section 37-17-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Local School Board Member Or Superintendent Serving At The Time A School District Is Abolished Is Not Eligible To Serve In Any Leadership Capacity In The New School District; To Amend Section 37-61-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Education To Adopt Regulations Prescribing The Method By Which School Districts Ending Fund Balances Are Examined For Fiscal Stability And To Provide Sanctions For Noncompliance And To Delete The Automatic Repealer On This Section; To Amend Section 37-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Limitation On Budgeted School District Expenditures For Administration; To Amend Section 37-177-1 , 37-177-5 And 37-177-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That One Reading Achievement Screening Assessment Shall Be Available To All Schools For Use In Grades K-3 To Be Approved By The State Board Of Education After Receiving Recommendation By The Mississippi Reading Panel; To Repeal Section 37-17-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Exempts School District Participation In Extracurricular Or Athletic Activity From Withdrawal Of Accreditation In Certain Cases, Is Hereby Repealed; And For Related Purposes.

2210.title: Insurance companies; prohibit from designating specific auto body repair businesses.
2210.description: An Act To Prohibit The Designation Of Specific Automobile Body Repair Businesses By An Insurance Company, Including Its Producers And Adjusters, That Issues Or Renews A Policy Of Insurance In This State Covering A Motor Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

2211.title: Cheating on statewide tests; financial responsibilities of local school district, licensure sanctions and criminal penalties.
2211.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower The State Board Of Education To Compel Attendance, Administer Oaths, Take Depositions And Issue Subpoenas, And To Exempt Certain Investigative Records Of The State Department Of Education From The Mississippi Public Records Act; To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add Additional Grounds For Disciplinary Action Against A Licensed Teacher Or Administrator; To Amend Section 37-16-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Certain Powers And Responsibilities Of The State Department Of Education In Cases Of Alleged Statewide Testing Irregularities; To Amend Section 37-16-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Criminal Penalties For Any Person Submitting A False Certification Regarding A Statewide Test; And For Related Purposes.

2212.title: Transportation; require MDOT to develop a complete streets program.
2212.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Complete Streets Legislation; And For Related Purposes.

2213.title: Mississippi Youth Concussion Law; clarify definitions and scope of.
2213.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-24-3, 37-24-5 And 37-24-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Definitions And The Applicability Of Provisions Of The "mississippi Youth Concussion Law"; And For Related Purposes.

2214.title: "Deepwater Horizon Oil Disaster Fund"; all funds received by state shall be appropriated for state and county road maintenance.
2214.description: An Act To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 558, Laws Of 2012, To Provide That All Funds Received By The State Of Mississippi Through A Negotiated Settlement Or Recovery For Damages In Connection With The Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund Called The "deepwater Horizon Oil Disaster Fund" To Be Appropriated By The Legislature For State And County Highway Maintenance; And For Related Purposes.

2215.title: Field trials; Commission on Wildlife, Fisheries & Parks may not impose fees for field trials held on private lands.
2215.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Shall Not Impose Fees For Field Trials Conducted On Private Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2216.title: State income tax deduction; provide for parents who send children to private school or homeschool.
2216.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A State Income Tax Deduction For Parents Who Send Their Children Or Dependents To A Private School Or A Homeschool Program; And For Related Purposes.

2217.title: MS Wireless Communication Commission; revise authority regarding local government entities.
2217.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The Mississippi Wireless Communication Commission To Approve All Wireless Communications Systems Owned Or Operated By Any Local Government Entity; And For Related Purposes.

2218.title: Youth sports concussions and head injuries; provide procedures and education requirements.
2218.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-24-3, 37-24-5 And 37-24-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Definitions And The Applicability Of Provisions Of The "mississippi Youth Concussion Law"; And For Related Purposes.

2219.title: Student test results; testing companies shall notify schools not later than 21st day after the test is given.
2219.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Entity Administering Statewide Student Tests Shall Notify School Districts And Schools Of The Results Of The Assessment Instruments Not Later Than The 21st Day After The Date The Test Is Given; And For Related Purposes.

2220.title: Hunting; require tree stands to be tagged with name and address of owner.
2220.description: An Act To Require A Person To Tag Any Tree Stand Placed On Public Lands Or Lands Of Another Person; And For Related Purposes.

2221.title: Unlawful absences from school; no promotion or graduation if student has accumulated 21 or more absences in preceding school year.
2221.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-16-7 And 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Shall Promote A Compulsory-school-age Student To The Next Grade Level Or Allow Such Student To Graduate If That Student Has Accumulated 21 Or More Unlawful Absences In The Immediately Preceding School Year; To Provide That No School Shall Allow A High School Student To Earn Credit If He Has Accumulated 11 Unlawful Absences; And For Related Purposes.

2222.title: Coast Coliseum Commission; authorize expenditure of money in its trust fund for certain purposes.
2222.description: An Act To Amend Section 55-24-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership And Terms Of The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission; To Amend Section 55-24-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; To Amend Sections 55-24-9 And 55-24-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission And Require That Certain Actions Be Approved By The Harrison County Board Of Supervisors; To Transfer Administration And Management Of The Coliseum Trust Fund To The Harrison County Board Of Supervisors To Be Used Exclusively For Capital Improvements To The Coliseum; To Amend Section 27-104-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude The Coliseum Trust Fund From Those Funds That Require A State Appropriation; And For Related Purposes.

2223.title: Auto liability insurance; allow exclusions & limitations on coverage if approved by Commissioner of Insurance.
2223.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Liability Insurance Required Under The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety-responsibility Law May Contain Exclusions And Limitations On Coverage As Long As The Exclusions And Limitations Language Or Form Has Been Filed And Approved By The Commissioner Of Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

2224.title: Legal notice; political subdivisions may use website as alternative means of dissemination.
2224.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-3-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Political Subdivision To Use Its Website As An Alternative Means Of Dissemination Of Any Summons, Order, Citation, Advertisement Or Other Legal Notice; And For Related Purposes.

2225.title: Infants; to be adjudicated a neglected child if birth mother tests positive for drug use.
2225.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That An Infant Born To A Drug-addicted Mother Be Placed In Foster Care; And For Related Purposes.

2228.title: Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; extend repeal date on MDA's authority to use for certain expenses.
2228.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Authority Of The Mississippi Development Authority To Use Certain Funds From The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Fund For Ordinary And Necessary General Support Of The Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2229.title: Public construction contracts; revise requirement for performance or payment bond.
2229.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-5-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Threshold By Which A Performance Bond Or Payment Bond Is Required For Public Construction Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

2230.title: Government Employees' Deferred Compensation Plan Law; clarify investment options.
2230.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-14-3, 25-14-5, 25-14-7, 25-14-9, 25-14-11 And 25-14-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms In The Government Employees' Deferred Compensation Plan Law; To Clarify Investment Options Under Such Law; To Clarify The Administration Of The Deferred Compensation Plan Administered By The Public Employees' Retirement System And The Administration Of Other Deferred Compensation Plans Authorized Under Such Law; And For Related Purposes.

2231.title: State Liquefied Compressed Gas Board members; allowed to receive per diem expense reimbursement.
2231.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-57-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The State Liquefied Compressed Gas Board Members To Receive Per Diem Expense Reimbursement For Travel Cost Associated With Attending Board Meetings; And For Related Purposes.

2232.title: Towing; limit charges.
2232.description: An Act To Amend Section 85-7-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Towing And Storage Charges For Vehicles Towed At The Direction Of A Law Enforcement Officer To Those Amounts Charged To Customers Generally; And For Related Purposes.

2233.title: Property/casualty insurance; must be written on homes with FORTIFIED Home designation.
2233.description: An Act To Provide That Any Insurance Company That Writes Policies Of Property And Casualty Insurance In The State Of Mississippi Must Write Policies On Homes With A Fortified Home Designation By The Institute For Business And Home Safety; And For Related Purposes.

2234.title: Small loan licensees; remove repealer on authority to sell auto club memberships to borrowers.
2234.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Repealer On The Provision Authorizing Small Loan Licensees To Offer A Borrower The Opportunity To Purchase An Auto Club Membership; And For Related Purposes.

2235.title: State employees; clarify administrative leave policy during extreme weather conditions, disasters or emergencies.
2235.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Administrative Leave Policy For State Employees During Extreme Weather Conditions, Or Man-made, Technological Or Natural Disasters Or Emergencies; And For Related Purposes.

2236.title: Voyeurism; revise penalty for.
2236.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-29-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For Voyeurism; And For Related Purposes.
