2237.title: National Guard militia; clarify immunity for members serving in federally funded duty status during declared emergencies.
2237.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-7-311, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That National Guard Service Members Serving In A Federally Funded Duty Status During Declared Emergencies Shall Be Immune Civilly And Criminally For Acts Or Omissions During The Performance Of Their Military Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2238.title: Federal Food Safety Modernization Act; State Dept of Health & State Dept of Ag/Commerce shall publish any agreement to enforce.
2238.description: An Act To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Health And The Mississippi Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Publish Any Agreement Or Memorandum Or Contract To Implement Or Enforce Any Provision Of The Federal Food Safety Modernization Act For Public Comment; To Amend Section 25-43-4.103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2239.title: MS Military Family Relief Fund; allow utilization by Mississippi National Guardsmen regardless of mobilization status.
2239.description: An Act To Amend Section 33-4-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Mississippi Military Family Relief Fund To Be Utilized By Members Of The Mississippi National Guard Regardless Of Mobilization Status; And For Related Purposes.

2240.title: Motor vehicle; titles of scrapped vehicle don't have to be cancelled if model year is 1969 or earlier or no tag has been issued in 2 years.
2240.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-21-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Owner Of A Motor Vehicle That Has A Model Year Of 1969 Or Earlier Or That Has Not Been Issued A License Tag Or Decal In The Last Two Years, Who Scraps, Dismantles Or Destroys Such A Vehicle, Or A Person Who Purchases Such A Vehicle As Scrap Or To Be Dismantled Or Destroyed, Shall Be Exempt From The Requirement That The Certificate Of Title Be Delivered To The Department Of Revenue For Cancellation; And For Related Purposes.

2241.title: Transportation safety; presence of law enforcement officers in highway construction work zones.
2241.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Public Safety And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Have Law Enforcement Officers At The Site Of Work Zones; And For Related Purposes.

2242.title: Licensed professional counselors; clarify license renewal fee.
2242.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-30-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Biennial License Renewal Fee For Licensed Professional Counselors Shall Be $200.00; And For Related Purposes.

2243.title: MDOC Early Release Programs; prohibit participation in by offenders convicted of house burglary.
2243.description: An Act To Prohibit Any Offender Who Was Convicted Of Burglary Under Section 97-17-23 From Participating In Any Early Release Program Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; To Amend Sections 47-5-138.1, 47-5-139 And 47-5-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2244.title: Memorial highways; designate a certain segment of MS Highway 30 in Lafayette County as the William Faulkner Memorial Highway.
2244.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 30 In Lafayette County As The William Faulkner Memorial Highway; And For Related Purposes.

2245.title: 16th section lands in failing school districts; Secretary of State to act as trustee.
2245.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Secretary Of State To Act As A Supervisory Trustee And Manage All Leasing Of 16th Section Lands Belonging To School Districts Being Supervised And Managed Pursuant To A Declaration Of A State Of Emergency For Failing School Districts As Provided In Section 37-17-6; And For Related Purposes.

2246.title: Bonds; authorize to assist Lafayette County in extending West Oxford Loop.
2246.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lafayette County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Extending West Oxford Loop To College Hill Road; And For Related Purposes.

2247.title: Children; clarify reporting of certain crimes against.
2247.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Reporting Of Child Abuse, Child Sexual Abuse, Child Neglect And Sex Crimes Against A Minor By Mandatory Reporters; To Specify That Except As Provided By Sections 43-21-353 And 97-5-51, School Employees Shall Report Unlawful Activity On Educational Property Or During A School-related Activity To The Superintendent Or His Designee Who Shall Notify Law Enforcement; To Clarify That A Public Or Private School Employee As A Mandatory Reporter Under Section 43-21-353 Shall Report Child Abuse, Child Sexual Abuse And Child Neglect As Specified Under The Youth Court Act; To Clarify That A Staff Member Of A Public Or Private School Shall Report Sex Crimes Against A Minor As Defined By And In Accordance With Section 97-5-51; To Provide That A Mandatory Reporter Shall Not Delegate To Any Person The Responsibility To Report, But Shall Make The Report Personally In All Cases Of Child Abuse, Child Sexual Abuse, Child Neglect Or A Sex Crime Against A Minor As Well As Report To The School; And For Related Purposes.

2248.title: Arrest of students on school property; provide for collection of data.
2248.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Collection Of Data Related To The Arrest Of Students On School Property; And For Related Purposes.

2249.title: Dyslexia therapy services; authorize SDE to provide funding to public schools for placement of dyslexia therapists.
2249.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Provide Financial Assistance To Any Public School District For The Recruitment, Placement And Curriculum Support For Dyslexia Therapy Services; And For Related Purposes.

2251.title: Sales tax; increase the diversion to cities.
2251.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From 18-1/2% To 20% The Percentage Of Total Sales Tax Revenue Collected In Municipalities That Is Diverted To Municipalities Within The State; And For Related Purposes.

2252.title: Alcoholic beverage retailers; may be required under local law to use electronic identification verification devices.
2252.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Body Of Any Municipality Or County To Adopt And Enforce Ordinances Requiring Retailers Of Light Beer And Wine Or Alcoholic Beverages To Swipe A Driver's License Or Identification Card In An Electronic Device To Verify A Patron's Age Or The Authenticity Of The Driver's License Or Identification Card; To Amend Sections 67-1-71 And 67-3-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Revocation Or Suspension Of The Permit Of Any Retailer Of Light Beer And Wine Or Alcoholic Beverages For Failure To Comply With Such An Ordinance; And For Related Purposes.

2253.title: Mississippi Charter Schools Act of 2013; make technical amendments relating to state and local funding.
2253.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-28-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To The Payment Of Funds To Mississippi Charter Schools To Provide That State Fund Payments Are Based On Accurate Enrollment Projections, To Clarify The Calculation And Distribution Of The Local Ad Valorem Tax Portion Of The Charter School Per Pupil Funding And To Provide That The State Department Of Education May Withhold That Amount From The Adequate Education Program Payments To The School District In Which The Student Resides And Pay The Amount Directly To The Charter School; To Amend Section 37-28-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Use Of Monies Remaining In The Accounts Of A Legal Entity Operating A Charter School; And For Related Purposes.

2254.title: Uniform Interstate Family Support Act; create (corrected).
2254.description: An Act To Create The Uniform Interstate Family Support Act To Replace The Uniform Interstate Family Support Act That Exists Before The Effective Date Of This Act; To Enact Definitions And Provide For Cumulative Remedies; To Define Jurisdiction And Specify Bases Of Jurisdiction Over Nonresidents; To Make Civil Provisions Of General Application; To Provide For The Establishment Of A Support Order And Determination Of Parentage; To Allow Enforcement Of A Support Order Without Registration; To Allow For Registration, Enforcement And Modification Of A Support Order; To Provide For The Application Of The Act To Foreign Support Orders; To Provide For Interstate Rendition; And For Related Purposes.

2255.title: Salary supplement for National Board Certified teachers who teach in critical teacher shortage areas; authorize.
2255.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Provide For A Salary Supplement For National Board Certified Teachers Employed In A Public School District Located In A Geographic Area Of The State Designated As A Critical Teacher Shortage Area By The State Board Of Education; To Increase The Number Of Board Certified School Nurses Eligible For Salary Supplement; To Amend Section 37-106-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Award And Qualifications For Applicants To The Teaching Fellows Program, Clarify Repayment Terms And Authorize The State Board Of Education And The Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance Board To Set Regulations Regarding Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2256.title: Selection of county superintendent of education; change from elective to appointive method in certain counties.
2256.description: An Act To Change The Manner Of Selecting The County Superintendent Of Education In A Certain County From The Elective Method To The Appointive Method; And For Related Purposes.

2257.title: County purchasing; clarify the responsibility of purchase clerk for purchases made without a requisition or binding contract.
2257.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Responsibility Of The County Purchase Clerk For The Purchase Of Items Or Services Made Without A Purchase Requisition Or Binding Contract; And For Related Purposes.

2258.title: Commercial driver's license testing sites; prescribe locations of.
2258.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-226, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Location Of Commercial Driver's License Testing Stations; And For Related Purposes.

2259.title: Expunction of record; allow filing fee in municipal court.
2259.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Filing Fee To Be Charged In Municipal Court For A Petition For Expunction; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2260.title: Salary supplement for licensed school nurses; increase number of nurses eligible.
2260.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Number Of Licensed School Nurses Eligible For A Salary Supplement; And For Related Purposes.

2261.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2261.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Governmental Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity For The Officer's Law Enforcement Training; And For Related Purposes.

2262.title: Board of supervisors; may assess homeowners based on pro rata platted lot area after taking ownership of a private street.
2262.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors, Upon Taking Ownership Of A Private Street Or Roadway, To Assess Each Homeowner Fronting That Street Based On The Homeowner's Pro Rata Platted Lot Area; And For Related Purposes.

2263.title: Mississippi Uniform Limited Partnership Act; revise and expand.
2263.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Uniform Limited Partnership Act; To Enact Definitions And Other General Provisions; To Specify The Governing Law And Scope Of A Limited Partnership Agreement; To Provide A Default Duration For A Limited Partnership; To Create Transition Provisions; To Specify Permitted Names And Reservation Of Names; To Provide For The Formation And Certification Of Limited Partnerships And Limited Liability Limited Partnerships; To Provide For Other Filings Including Amendments Or Restatement Of The Certificate; To Assign Liability For Inaccurate Information In Filings; To Specify Limited Partners' Rights And Obligations; To Provide For General Partners Of A Limited Partnership; To Specify The Rights And Obligations Of A General Partner; To Specify The Form Of Contributions And Liability Therefor; To Create A Right Of Distribution Before Dissolution And Limitation On And Liability For Distributions; To Provide For Dissociation; To Specify The Nature Of Transferable Interests And The Rights Of Transferees And Creditors; To Provide For Dissolution And Winding Up Of A Limited Partnership; To Allow Reinstatement After Administrative Dissolution; To Provide For Actions By Partners; To Make Provision Concerning Foreign Limited Partnerships; To Provide For Merger And Allow For Merger Under Other Law; To Reenact The Text Of The Fees Formerly Set Forth At Section 79-14-1104; To Amend Sections 79-13-901, 79-13-1005, 79-13-1106, 79-13-1107 And 79-35-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform References; To Repeal Sections 79-14-101 Through 79-14-1107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Comprise The Mississippi Limited Partnership Act; And For Related Purposes.

2264.title: Civil liability; prohibit damages for wrongful birth or wrongful life.
2264.description: An Act To Create New Section 15-1-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Damages For Wrongful Birth Or Wrongful Life; And For Related Purposes.

2265.title: Income tax; authorize credits for certain prekindergarten child care/education expenses and repeal prekindergarten grant program.
2265.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers In An Amount Equal To Expenses Paid By Taxpayers For Child Care And Education For Their Children By Prekindergarten Providers; To Provide Definitions; To Provide Individual Credit Limitations; To Provide That The Aggregate Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Awarded For Prekindergarten Costs Shall Be Equal To The Amount Of Funds Dedicated By The State Of Mississippi To The Early Learning Collaborative Act Program; To Repeal Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Early Learning Collaborative Act Of 2013 Grant Program; And For Related Purposes.

2266.title: Acknowledge traditional winter holidays on public school grounds; authorize school districts to.
2266.description: An Act Relating To A School District's Recognition Of And Education Regarding Traditional Winter Celebrations; And For Related Purposes.

2267.title: Garbage fees; allow collection of unpaid fees at the time of a tax sale of the property.
2267.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Collection Of Garbage Fees And Special Assessments Due And Unpaid To Be Collected At The Tax Sale Of The Property And Remitted To The County; To Amend Sections 27-41-59 And 27-45-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2268.title: New Start School Program for failing schools; make technical amendments and clarify administrative authority of SDE.
2268.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-167-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Provisions Of The New Start School Program For Public Schools Who Are Considered Failing For A Minimum Of 2 Consecutive School Years, To Direct Local School Districts To Fund Operations At Any New Start School At Sufficient Levels, To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Escrow State Funds If Corrective Action Is Not Taken At Any New Start School, And To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Contract With Private Entities To Administer Any Part Of The New Start School Program; And For Related Purposes.

2269.title: Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act of 2013; create.
2269.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Mineral Rights Reform Act Of 2015; To Require Registration Of Severed Mineral Interests In The Office Of The Chancery Clerk Of The County In Which The Mineral Interest Is Located; To Provide For Forfeiture To The State Of Any Severed Mineral Interest Not So Registered; And For Related Purposes.

2270.title: Seismic operations; provide permit process and protections for surface owners.
2270.description: An Act To Regulate The Seismological Exploration For Oil, Gas Or Other Minerals; To Define Terms; To Direct The Oil And Gas Board To Promulgate Rules Governing Seismographic Exploration; To Require Seismographic Operators To Register; To Require A Permit For Each Seismic Operation; To Require The Posting Of A Security Bond To Guarantee Performance And For Reparation Of Damages; To Require That Surface Owners Be Notified Before Seismic Operations Are Conducted; To Prohibit Fraudulent Applications And Reports; To Prohibit Test-hole Blasting Within A Certain Distance Of Buildings Or Water Wells; To Provide The Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2271.title: Marihuana; allow medical use by seriously ill patients under doctor's supervision.
2271.description: An Act To Authorize The Medical Use Of Marihuana By Seriously Ill Patients Under A Physician's Supervision; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide An Exemption From Criminal And Civil Penalties For The Medical Use Of Marihuana; To Provide Limitations On The Medical Use Of Marihuana; To Provide A Legal Defense For Patients And Primary Caregivers; To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Marihuana From Schedule I To Schedule Ii Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marihuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2272.title: Acupuncture Practice Act; delete requirement for physician referral or prescription and require recertification.
2272.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-71-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Acupuncture Practitioners To Recertify Every Four Years According To The Current Requirements Of The National Certification Commission For Acupuncture And Oriental Medicine (nccaom); To Repeal Sections 73-71-7 And 73-71-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Written Referral Or Prescription For Acupuncture From A Physician And Require The Physician To Perform A Medical Diagnostic Examination Prior To Such Referral Or Prescription; And For Related Purposes.

2273.title: English language learners (ELL); dedicate Education Enhancement Funds for.
2273.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-177-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Proportionate Share Of The Residual Funds In The Education Enhancement Fund Prescribed For Use For Other Educational Needs Shall Be Appropriated For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funding For Educational Support And Teacher Resources To School Districts With Twenty Percent Or More Of Its Student Enrollment Comprised Of English Language Learners; To Amend Section 37-61-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2274.title: English language learners (ELL); provide waiver of school district assessment requirements.
2274.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education, Through The Commission On School Accreditation, And With Approval Of The State Board Of Education, To Grant A Waiver Of Accountability And State Assessment Requirements To Those School Districts Whose Total Student Enrollment Is Comprised Of 25% Or More Of English Language Learners; To Require The Commission To Only Waive Accountability Requirements For English Language Learners Enrolled In Grades 9-12 Only When Determining The District's Accreditation Level On The Performance And Accountability Rating Model; To Amend Section 37-13-80, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Such School Districts Shall Be Held Harmless When Calculating Graduation Rates, Dropout Rates And Completion Rates For Cohort Classes In Grades 9-12 Beginning With The 2015-2016 Scholastic Year By Discounting The Number Of English Language Learners Enrolled Therein For Four Years; And For Related Purposes.

2275.title: MS Workers' Compensation Assigned Risk Plan; certain insurers must provide notice that minimum premium is fully earned.
2275.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, Whenever A Policy Is Purchased Under The Mississippi Assigned Risk Pool And A Minimum Premium Applies To The Policy, The Insured Shall Provide Written Notice To The Insured That The Minimum Premium Is Fully Earned; And For Related Purposes.

2276.title: Death benefits trust fund; create for beneficiaries of local emergency management officials, coroners & deputy coroners.
2276.description: An Act To Create New Section 45-2-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Death Benefits Trust Fund To Provide Death Benefits To The Beneficiaries Of Directors And Assistant Directors Of Local Emergency Management Organizations, And Coroners And Deputy Coroners Who Are Killed While Engaged In The Performance Of Their Official Duties; To Provide That The Department Of Public Safety Shall Manage The Trust Fund And Disburse Benefits From The Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2277.title: Medical and pharmacist licensure; provide expedited application process in underserved areas of the state.
2277.description: An Act To Provide An Expedited Medical License And Pharmacist License Application Process For Physicians And Pharmacists Seeking To Practice In Underserved Areas Of The State Of Mississippi; To Amend Sections 73-43-11 And 73-21-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2279.title: State income tax; phase out over a five-year period.
2279.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The State Income Tax Over A Five-year Period; And For Related Purposes.

2280.title: Distinctive license tag; Purple Heart tag may bear the International Symbol of Access for persons with disabilities.
2280.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags Identifying A Person As A Recipient Of The Purple Heart Medal To Bear The International Symbol Of Access Adopted By Rehabilitation International In 1969 At Its Eleventh World Congress On Rehabilitation If The Applicant For Such Tag Is Eligible To Receive A Distinctive Tag Under Section 27-19-56; To Amend Section 27-19-56, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2281.title: Memorial highway; designate segment of I-59 in Pearl River County as the Deputy Len J. Rowell Memorial Highway.
2281.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-3-71.94, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate A Certain Segment Of Interstate 59 In Pearl River County As The "deputy Len J. Rowell Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2282.title: Tim Tebow Act; authorize interscholastic extracurricular activity participation of students enrolled in homeschools.
2282.description: An Act Entitled The "tim Tebow Act"; To Authorize Interscholastic Extracurricular Activity Participation Of Students Enrolled In Homeschools; To Define "homeschool" And "interscholastic Extracurricular Activity"; To Identify The Conditions Under Which A Student Enrolled In A Homeschool May Participate In Interscholastic Extracurricular Activities; To Prohibit Discrimination Against Homeschool Student Selection Or Participation In Such Activities; To Specify Waiting Period For Participation When A Student Transfers From A Public School To A Homeschool; To Provide That Participation In Extracurricular Activity Is A Privilege And Not A Right; And For Related Purposes.

2283.title: Probation/parole fees; extend date of repeal on MDOC's authority to collect from offenders under field supervision.
2283.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal To June 30, 2018 On The Authority Of The Community Services Division Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Collect Monthly Fees From Offenders Under Field Supervision; And For Related Purposes.

2284.title: Bolivar County Regional Facility; extend date of repeal on drug and alcohol treatment program.
2284.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-940, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal To July 3, 2017 On The Drug And Alcohol Treatment Program Operated At The Bolivar County Regional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2285.title: School Resource Officers; require uniform statewide training program.
2285.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To School Resource Officer Qualifications To Require That All School Resource Officers Complete A Uniform Statewide Training Prior To Being Permitted To Serve In A School; To Amend Section 37-3-82, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Expenditure Of Mississippi Community Oriented Policing Services In Schools (mcops) Grant Funds For The Required Training; And For Related Purposes.

2287.title: Tenth Circuit District; create subdistrict and additional judge.
2287.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-7-31 And 9-7-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Subdistricts Within The Tenth Circuit Court District And To Revise The Number Of Circuit Court Judges In That District; To Provide For Precinct Boundaries; To Provide For Candidacy For Election For Judgeships Before To The Inception Of The Judgeship; And For Related Purposes.

2289.title: Workers' compensation; increase maximum total recovery and remove cap on permanent total disability compensation.
2289.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-3-13, 71-3-17, 71-3-21 And 71-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Total Compensation That An Employee May Recover Under The Workers' Compensation Law, And To Provide That Compensation For Permanent Total Disability Shall Be Paid To The Employee Until His Death; And For Related Purposes.

2293.title: Charitable solicitation; revise reporting period.
2293.description: An Act To Amend Sections 79-11-507, 79-11-513, 79-11-515 And 79-11-517, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Reporting Period Applying To The Filing Of Financial Statements By Charitable Organizations That Solicit Donations; And For Related Purposes.

2294.title: Statutory rape; must be knowing and willful.
2294.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Knowledge And Willfulness In Order To Convict For Statutory Rape; And For Related Purposes.

2295.title: Divorce; create bona fide separation as the 13th ground.
2295.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create As A Thirteenth Ground For Divorce The Bona Fide, Complete Separation Of The Parties For A Certain Period Of Time; To Enact Certain Restrictions; And For Related Purposes.

2296.title: Alcohol-free motor fuels; ensure the availability of.
2296.description: An Act To Require Retail Dealers And Distributors Of Gasoline To Offer For Sale Or Use Nonethanol-blended Unleaded Regular Grade Gasoline; And For Related Purposes.

2297.title: Carbon monoxide detectors in all public and nonpublic schools; require.
2297.description: An Act To Require Carbon Monoxide Detectors In All Public And Nonpublic Schools In Mississippi; To Authorize And Direct The State Fire Marshall To Provide Requirements For Testing And Inspecting Carbon Monoxide Detection And Warning Equipment Installed In Public Or Nonpublic School Buildings; And For Related Purposes.

2300.title: Digital privacy; labor and employment protections.
2300.description: An Act To Prohibit An Employer From Requesting Or Requiring That An Employee Or Applicant Disclose Any User Name, Password Or Other Means Accessing A Personal Account Or Service Through Certain Electronic Communications Devices; To Prohibit An Employer From Taking, Or Threatening To Take, Certain Disciplinary Actions For An Employee's Refusal To Disclose Certain Password And Related Information; To Prohibit An Employer From Failing Or Refusing To Hire An Applicant As A Result Of The Applicant's Refusal To Disclose Certain Password And Related Information; To Prohibit An Employee From Downloading Certain Unauthorized Information Or Data To Certain Websites Of Web-based Accounts; To Provide That An Employer, Based On The Receipt Of Certain Information Regarding The Use Of Certain Websites Or Certain Web-based Accounts, Is Not Prevented From Conducting Certain Investigations For Certain Purposes; To Define Certain Terms; And For Related Purposes.

2301.title: Court administrators; revise continuing education requirements.
2301.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-17-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise And Clarify The Number Of Hours Of Annual Continuing Education Required Of A Court Administrator; And For Related Purposes.

2302.title: High-school testing requirements; replace PARCC and SATP2 with ACT assessment on phased-in basis.
2302.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Replace Subject Area Testing Requirements (satp2) And Parcc Student Assessments With The American College Testing (act) Assessment On A Phased-in Basis; To Amend Section 37-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Require The Act College Readiness Test And Precursor Diagnostic Tests To Be Administered Beginning In The 2017-2018 School Year With Results To Be Included In Each School District's Accountability Report; To Direct The State Superintendent Of Education To Take Immediate Action To Withdraw From The Partnership For Assessment Of Readiness For College And Careers (parcc); To Amend Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2303.title: School district expenditures; require school boards to adopt an annual balanced budget.
2303.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-61-9 And 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Adopt An Annual Balanced Budget To Be Submitted To The Levying Authority And To The State Board Of Education And To Clarify That School District Budgets Shall Limit Fund Expenditures To The Revenue Resources Available To That Fund Which Shall Not Include Transfers From Other Fund Balances; To Amend Section 37-61-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Fund Shall Have A Negative Balance At The End Of The School Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

2304.title: Requirements for enrollment of children in public schools in MS border counties; include proof of purchase of car tag in proper county.
2304.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Proof Of Purchase Of A Car Tag In The Proper County Or An Affidavit By The Parent Or Guardian Is A Requirement For Enrollment Of Children In Public Schools Located In Counties On The Mississippi Border; And For Related Purposes.

2305.title: Open Meetings Act; revise definitions.
2305.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "meeting" For The Purposes Of The Open Meetings Act; And For Related Purposes.

2307.title: Judges; ineligible for office under certain conditions.
2307.description: An Act To Impose Eligibility Requirements In Order For A Person To Serve As A Judge In Any Court; And For Related Purposes.

2310.title: Firefighters; revise service obligation.
2310.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-25-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Service Obligation For Firefighters Who Obtain Certification At The Expense Of A Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2311.title: Public Service Commission; shall not have jurisdiction over the internal affairs of cooperative gas or electric power associations.
2311.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Service Commission Shall Not Have Jurisdiction Over The Governance, Management Or Other Internal Affairs Of Cooperative Gas Or Electric Power Associations; And For Related Purposes.

2313.title: Eminent Domain Intrastate Pipeline Clarification Act; enact.
2313.description: An Act To Create The "eminent Domain Intrastate Pipeline Clarification Act"; To Codify New Sections 77-11-401, 77-11-403, 77-11-405, 77-11-407, 77-11-409 And 77-11-411, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Open Access Of Intrastate Gas Pipelines And Intrastate Gas Gathering Systems To Encourage And Facilitate The Gathering, Transportation, Sale And Use Of Carbon Dioxide In Mississippi; To Provide Certain Definitions Under This Newly Created Article; To Provide That Intrastate Gas Pipelines Constructed Using Eminent Domain Shall Be Deemed A Common Carrier Of Gas For Certain Purposes; To Provide That Gas Gatherers Shall Be Subject To This Article For Certain Purposes; To Provide The State Oil And Gas Board With Jurisdiction And Certain Rulemaking Powers And Duties Under This Article; To Prescribe Proceedings For The Board As They Relate To This Article; To Provide That Certain Entities Shall Not Be Subject To This Article; To Bring Forward Sections 11-27-47 And 53-3-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

2314.title: Health insurance plans; require insurer cost parity for oral anti-cancer medications.
2314.description: An Act To Prohibit Private Health Insurance Plans From Requiring The Insured To Pay A Higher Co-payment, Deductible Or Coinsurance For Orally Administered Anti-cancer Medications Than Is Required For Anti-cancer Medications Injected Or Intravenously Administered; And For Related Purposes.

2315.title: Gulf States Marine Fisheries Commission; allow Mississippi members to appoint proxies.
2315.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Mississippi Members Of The Gulf States Marine Fisheries Commission To Appoint Proxies; And For Related Purposes.

2317.title: Real property liens; clarify Notice of Contest of Lien form.
2317.description: An Act To Amend Section 85-7-433, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The "notice Of Contest Of Lien" Form To Clarify The Time In Which The Notice Is To Be Filed And To Conform The Form To Section 85-7-423; And For Related Purposes.

2318.title: Appropriation FY16; complete Tupelo Veterans Plaza construction.
2318.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Create Foundation, For The Purpose Of Completing The Staging Of An F105 Plane And The Construction Of A Vietnam Veteran's Wall At The Tupelo Veterans Plaza; And For Related Purposes.

2319.title: Drug forfeiture laws; delete repeal on administrative forfeiture provisions.
2319.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Advertising For The Administrative Forfeiture Of Property Under The Controlled Substances Act; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 484, Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Section 5, Chapter 501, Laws Of 2014, To Delete The Repeal Clause On Section 41-29-176; And For Related Purposes.

2320.title: "Emergency Response and Overdose Prevention Act"; authorize health care providers to treat opioid overdose.
2320.description: An Act Entitled The "emergency Response And Overdose Prevention Act"; To Authorize Health Care Providers To Prescribe And Administer An Opioid Antagonist To Person At Risk Of Experiencing An Opioid-related Overdose And To Provide Civil Or Criminal Immunity For Such Action; And For Related Purposes.

2321.title: School district reporting on academic performance of student athletes; require SDE to develop regulations.
2321.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Commission On School Accreditation To Develop Rules Governing School District Reporting Of Information On The Academic Performance Of Athletes And Other Persons Involved In School Extracurricular Activities; To Authorize The Commission To Share Such Information With The Mississippi High School Activities Association; To Require The Commission To Work With The Mississippi High School Activities Association In The Development Of Rules Regarding The Collection Of Performance Information; And For Related Purposes.

2322.title: Death penalty; eliminate for persons with mentally retardation.
2322.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The Death Penalty For Individuals With Mental Retardation; And For Related Purposes.

2323.title: Division of Medicaid; clarify meetings of Pharmacy and Therapeutics (PNT) Committee.
2323.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 545, 2015 Regular Session, To Authorize The Pharmacy And Therapeutics Committee Of The Division Of Medicaid To Meet As Necessary To Fulfill Its Responsibilities; To Revise The Composition And The Duties Of The Medical Care Advisory Committee; And For Related Purposes.

2324.title: Public school student dyslexia program; clarify school district responsibilities.
2324.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-173-15, 37-173-19 And 37-173-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Student Enrolled In A Public School Fails The Screening For Dyslexia The School District Is Required To Perform A Comprehensive Dyslexia Evaluation At No Cost To The Student And To Place A Diagnosed Student In A Dyslexia Therapy Program With A Certified Dyslexia Therapist Or Other Such Qualified Professional; To Provide Standards For The Administration Of The Dyslexia Screener And Dyslexia Therapy Services; And For Related Purposes.

2325.title: Early Intervention Act for Infants and Toddlers; use of private health insurance shall not adversely affect benefits.
2325.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-87-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Use Of Private Health Insurance To Pay For Services Under The Federal Individuals With Disabilities Education Act (idea) Shall Not Adversely Affect The Availability Of Benefits Or The Cost Of Health Insurance To The Infant Or Toddler With A Disability; And For Related Purposes.

2326.title: Sales tax; reduce the rate on motorcycles from 7% to 5%.
2326.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Sales Tax Rate On Retail Sales Of Motorcycles From Seven Percent To Five Percent ; And For Related Purposes.

2328.title: State lands; revise procedure for collection of purchase money for.
2328.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure For Collection Of Purchase Money For State Lands And For Refunds Of Such Money If The Patent Is Not Timely Completed; And For Related Purposes.

2329.title: Memorial bridge; designate a certain bridge in Marshall County as the Charles Foster Memorial Bridge.
2329.description: An Act To Designate The Bridge That Spans The Coldwater River On Mississippi Highway 309 In Marshall County As The Charles Foster Memorial Bridge; And For Related Purposes.

2330.title: Statewide monetary assessments; revise.
2330.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Statewide Monetary Assessment Imposed For The Benefit Of The Crime Victim' Compensation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2331.title: Enrollment of children in public schools; informal kinship caregiver may enroll.
2331.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Local School Districts To Allow Relative Caregivers To Enroll Children In The Schools Of Their Residence In Circumstances Where The Relative Verifies The Informal Kinship Care Relationship Through A Sworn Affidavit; And For Related Purposes.

2332.title: Unused leave accumulated by teacher who transfers to another school district; may be credited for retirement purposes.
2332.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Event A Public School Teacher Transfers From One Public School District In Mississippi To Another, Any Unused Portion Of The Total Sick Or Personal Leave Allowance Credited To Such Teacher Shall Be Credited In The Computation Of Unused Leave For Retirement Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2333.title: Auto liability insurance; insurance card may be displayed on cellular phone when providing proof of insurance.
2333.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Insurance Card May Be Displayed By Electronic Image On A Cellular Phone Or Other Type Of Electronic Device When Providing Proof Of Auto Liability Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

2334.title: Public records law; exempt certain hunting license record of the Department of Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks.
2334.description: An Act To Exempt Certain Hunting License Records Of The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks From The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; And For Related Purposes.

2336.title: Retirement; all members of PERS vest after 4 years of membership regardless of the date they became members.
2336.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-11-103, 25-11-105, 25-11-109, 25-11-111, 25-11-113, 25-11-114, 25-11-117, 25-11-311 And 25-11-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Number Of Years Of Membership Service Required To Vest In The Public Employees' Retirement System For All Members Regardless Of The Date Upon Which They Became A Member Shall Be Four Years; And For Related Purposes.

2337.title: Division of Medicaid information system and support contracts; authorize optional extension.
2337.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division Of Medicaid In The Office Of The Governor To Extend Certain Management Information System And Support Contracts For A Period Not Exceeding 5 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2338.title: Utility worker; killing of shall be capital murder.
2338.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Killing Of A Utility Worker In The Definition Of Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

2340.title: State Superintendent of Education and Commissioner of Higher Education; establish maximum salary for.
2340.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education Shall Be Set By The State Board Of Education Subject To The Approval Of The State Personnel Board And Subject To A Maximum Amount; To Amend Section 37-101-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of The Commissioner Of Higher Education Shall Be Set By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Subject To A Maximum Amount; And For Related Purposes.

2343.title: Service of process; sheriff may retain fee for attempt to serve.
2343.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Sheriff Or Deputy Sheriff To Retain Fees Submitted For Service Of Process In Cases Where The Person Sought To Be Served Is Not Found; And For Related Purposes.

2344.title: Election managers; municipalities may increase discretionary pay and may compensate those who attend training sessions.
2344.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-229, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Amount Of Additional Compensation Which May Be Paid To Election Managers By A Governing Authority Of A Municipality; To Amend Section 23-15-239, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Compensate Election Managers Who Attend Training Sessions; And For Related Purposes.

2345.title: Tax assessors and collectors; increase salaries.
2345.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Tax Assessors And Collectors; And For Related Purposes.

2346.title: Legislative Budget Office; shall publish on its website budget requests submitted by state agencies.
2346.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Legislative Budget Office To Publish On Its Website The Budget Requests Submitted Under The Authority Of This Section By State Agencies, Special-fund Agencies And General-fund Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

2347.title: Concealed weapons law; decrease certain fees for licensees.
2347.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Decrease Certain Fees For Licensees Under The Concealed Weapons Law; To Exempt Active Duty Members Of The Armed Forces Of The United States From Payment Of The License Fee And Renewal Fee; To Require The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Create Rules And Regulations For Licenses Issued To Retired Law Enforcement Officers; To Provide Guidelines For Receipt Of Such Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2348.title: Wireless Communication Commission; revise membership of.
2348.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Wireless Communication Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2349.title: Marriage licensee; increase fee charges by circuit clerks.
2349.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Marriage License Fee Charged By Circuit Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2350.title: Public purchasing; require competitive bidding for the purchase of telecommunications services by school districts and libraries.
2350.description: An Act To Prohibit Any School District Or Public Library From Entering Into Any Multiyear Contract Or Service Agreement For The Purchase Of Telecommunications Services Without Completing A Competitive Bidding Process For Those Services; To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2353.title: Government purchasing; place restrictions on emergency and single source purchases.
2353.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Place Restrictions On The Use Of Emergency And Single Source Purchases Of Commodities And Repair Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

2354.title: State agencies; prohibit certain publications except those required by law.
2354.description: An Act To Create A New Section To Prohibit Certain Publications By State Agencies Except Those Required By Law; And For Related Purposes.

2355.title: State funds; prohibit expenditure on membership in professional associations for state employees.
2355.description: An Act To Prohibit The Expenditure Of State Funds For The Payment Of Professional, Occupational Or Trade License, Certificate, Permit Or Registration For Any State Employee Or Officer, Except In Certain Instances; And For Related Purposes.

2357.title: Appropriation FY2016; MDOT for three-lane Highway 16 in Kemper County.
2357.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Purpose Of Converting Portions Of Highway 16 In Kemper County From Two-lane To Three-lane For Fy2016; And For Related Purposes.

2358.title: Board of supervisors; authorize Madison County to employ an assistant county prosecuting attorney.
2358.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors In Madison County To Employ An Assistant County Prosecuting Attorney On A Full-time Or Part-time Basis; And For Related Purposes.

2359.title: Crime laboratory fee; revise imposition of.
2359.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Imposition Of A Crime Laboratory Service Fee In Certain Cases; And For Related Purposes.

2360.title: Community hospitals; revise provisions concerning transparency.
2360.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Board Of Trustees Of A Community Hospital Is A Public Body For The Purposes Of The Open Meetings Act; To Amend Section 25-41-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Ability Of The Board Of Trustees To Go Into Executive Session For Matters Concerning The Operation Of The Hospital As A Business Entity; To Amend Section 25-61-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Records Containing Information Concerning Trade Secrets And Confidential Commercial And Financial Information Of A Proprietary Nature Developed By A Public Hospital Are Not Subject To The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; To Amend Section 25-61-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Federal Statutory Law Imposing Confidentiality Upon A Record Will Exempt The Record From The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; To Amend Section 25-61-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Records Relating To The Business Development Of A Public Hospital Are Not Subject To The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; To Amend Section 41-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications Of Persons To Be Appointed To The Board Of Trustees Of A Community Hospital; To Authorize The Hospital Owner To Remove A Trustee For Good Cause Shown; To Impose A Greater Range For The Performance Bond To Be Secured On Behalf Of Trustees Of A Community Hospital; To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Owner Of A Community Hospital To Create And Maintain A Transparency And Accountability Website For The Hospital; To Amend Section 41-9-68, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Public Hospital Records That Are Exempt From The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; To Create New Sections 41-13-49 And 41-13-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Any Defined Benefit Retirement Plan Maintained By A Community Hospital For Its Employees, Whether The Membership Of The Plan Is Open Or Closed To New Members, To Disclose Certain Information To The Public And Provide Certain Information To Participants; To Require The Administrator Of The Retirement Plan To Disseminate To The Public A Summary Plan Description, Annual Disclosure Of Financial And Actuarial Status, And An Annual Report; To Require The Administrator Of The Retirement Plan To Furnish To Each Participant And Beneficiary Who Is Receiving Benefits Under The Plan Certain Information About The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

2361.title: Habitual offender; revised sentencing.
2361.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Computation Of Prior Offenses For Sentencing As An Habitual Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2362.title: Tort Claims Act; clarify governmental immunity.
2362.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Exemption Of Governmental Entities From Tort Claims Liability On Claims Based On Specified Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2363.title: Child restraints in youth court; require hearing.
2363.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Instruments Of Restraint Upon Any Child Who Appears Before Youth Court Unless Certain Findings Are Made By The Youth Court Judge; To Provide, Whenever Practicable, That All Parties May Be Heard By The Youth Court On The Proposed Use Of Such Restraints; To Require That If Instruments Of Restraints Are Used, Then The Youth Court Judge Must Make A Written Findings Of Fact In Support Of The Order; And For Related Purposes.

2364.title: Adoption; clarify termination of parental rights.
2364.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-15-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Grounds For Termination Of Parental Rights In Order That A Child May Be Adopted When That Is In The Best Interests Of The Child; And For Related Purposes.

2365.title: All-terrain vehicles; provide landowner immunity in certain situations.
2365.description: An Act To Create A Limitation Of Liability For A Landowner As Against A Person Who Is Operating Or Riding An All-terrain Vehicle On The Landowner's Property; To Specify Situations In Which The Liability Will Not Be Waived And The Landowner Will Not Be Immune; And For Related Purposes.

2366.title: Sexual assault; extend statute of limitations for civil suit.
2366.description: An Act To Amend Section 15-1-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Statute Of Limitations For A Civil Suit Based On A Sexual Assault; And For Related Purposes.

2367.title: Youth courts; A.O.C. require use of MS Youth Courts Information Delivery System (MYCIDS).
2367.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-21-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That All Youth Courts Of The State Use The Mississippi Youth Court Case Information Delivery System, And Be Responsible For The Accurate And Timely Entry Of Information Into Such System; To Amend Section 43-21-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Administrative Office Of The Courts' Grants To Youth Courts Be Used To Provide Compensation To Intake Officers Of The Youth Courts; To Amend Section 9-21-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Thereto; To Amend Section 43-21-351, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That There Shall Be An Intake Officer In Each Youth Court Responsible For Entering All Intake And Case Information Into The Mississippi Youth Court Case Information System Accurately And Timely; And For Related Purposes.

2368.title: Court reporting; revise definition of.
2368.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-13-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Court Reporters' Board To Issue Permits To Out-of-state Court-reporting Firms; To Amend Section 9-13-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend State Standards To Out-of-state Court-reporting Firms; To Amend Section 9-13-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Court-reporting Firm; And For Related Purposes.

2369.title: Appropriation FY16; City of Saltillo for traffic signals.
2369.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The City Of Saltillo, Mississippi, For The Purpose Of Adding Traffic Signals To The Intersection Of Highway 145 And Highway 45 For Fiscal Year 2016; And For Related Purposes.

2370.title: Salary realignment for certain MDOC correctional officers; authorize.
2370.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Personnel Board To Amend The Variable Compensation Plan As Necessary To Award A 15% Salary Realignment To Each Mississippi Department Of Corrections Correctional Officer, Probation And Parole Officer Whose Salary Is Less Than $40,000.00 And Funded By The State General Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2371.title: Habitual offender; offenses that trigger enhanced sentencing must have been committed when a person was 18 years of age or older.
2371.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Felony May Be Counted For The Purposes Of Sentencing A Person As A Habitual Offender If The Felony Was Committed When The Person Was 18 Years Of Age Or Older; And For Related Purposes.

2372.title: Water resources; authorize municipality to determine the location and well spacing of private wells in its jurisdiction.
2372.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Municipality To Determine Who May Drill A Private Well And The Location And Well Spacing Of Private Wells Drilled Within Its Jurisdiction; To Provide For Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2373.title: Highway Patrol Trooper Training Fund; create and fund from a portion of motor vehicle inspection and window tint fees.
2373.description: An Act To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury Designated As The "highway Patrol Trooper Training Fund"; To Provide That The Money In The Fund Shall Be Used By The Department Of Public Safety, Upon Appropriation By The Legislature, To Conduct A Highway Patrol Training School When There Is Sufficient Money In The Fund To Conduct Such A Class; To Amend Section 63-13-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Fee Collected From The Issuance Of A Motor Vehicle Certificate Of Inspection Shall Be Deposited Into Such Fund; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Fee Collected Upon The Issuance Of Motor Vehicle Window Tint Inspection Labels Shall Be Deposited Into Such Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2374.title: Health care certificate of need; exempt relocation of certain nursing facilities within same long-term care planning district.
2374.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Relocation Of Certain Existing Nursing Home Facilities To A New Facility Located Within The Same Long-term Care Planning District Without The Requirement Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need; And For Related Purposes.

2375.title: Wills and estates; fast-track administration available for certain small estates.
2375.description: An Act To Create New Section 91-7-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Summary Administration For Certain Small Estates Whether The Decedent Died Testate Or Intestate; And For Related Purposes.

2376.title: CON; authorize transfer of beds from Hancock County and new CON in Lamar County.
2376.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Transfer And Relocate Nursing Facility Beds Formerly Licensed In Hancock County To Three Locations In Stone, Lamar And Hancock Counties; To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For Nursing Facility Beds In Lamar County; And For Related Purposes.

2377.title: Contractors; require interest-bearing accounts for retainage withheld.
2377.description: An Act To Create New Section 87-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Contractors To Deposit Retainage In An Interest-bearing Account; And For Related Purposes.

2378.title: Trusty status; offenders ineligible to work at Governor's Mansion if incarcerated for a violent crime.
2378.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-138.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Offender In Trusty Status Who Was Convicted Of A Crime Of Violence Shall Be Ineligible To Participate In Any Program At The Governor's Mansion; And For Related Purposes.

2379.title: Legislature; create the Joint Legislative Committee on Federalism.
2379.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Balance Of Powers Act; To Create A Joint Legislative Committee On Federalism; To Provide That The Committee May Determine If A Federal Action Is An Unconstitutional Federal Action; To Provide That The Legislature May Vote Whether A State Agency Or Political Subdivision Shall Plan, Assign, Implement Or Cooperate With The Unconstitutional Federal Action; And For Related Purposes.

2380.title: Appropriation FY16; reimburse City of Jackson for infrastructure and law enforcement.
2380.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, For The Purpose Of Reimbursing The City For Emergency Management And Other Infrastructure In Fiscal Year 2016; And For Related Purposes.

2382.title: Cell phones; prohibit warrantless tracking of by law enforcement.
2382.description: An Act To Require A Government Entity To Obtain A Search Warrant Before Obtaining The Location Information Of An Electronic Device; To Define Terms; To Provide Exceptions For Emergencies; And For Related Purposes.

2384.title: Public utility; value of certain utilities in eminent domain actions by municipalities shall not exceed utility's outstanding debt.
2384.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Value Of A Public Corporation Utility In Eminent Domain Proceedings By A Municipality Shall Not Exceed The Public Corporation's Outstanding Debt; And For Related Purposes.

2385.title: Speed limits; local governments may lower without conducting an engineering and traffic investigation.
2385.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-511, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That The Governing Authority Of A Municipality Or County Must Base A Decision To Lower Speed Limits On An Engineering And Traffic Investigation; And For Related Purposes.

2386.title: Municipalities; may restrict or regulate parking without posting signage.
2386.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-19-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Restrict Or Regulate Parking On Any Public Street Or Roadway Without Posting Signage That Describes The Parking Restriction Or Regulation; And For Related Purposes.

2387.title: Municipal ordinances; revise enforcement procedures.
2387.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authority Of A Municipality To Adopt An Ordinance Establishing A System By Which Municipal Law Enforcement Officers, Municipal Law Enforcement Employees And Other Municipal Employees May Issue Citations For Violations Of Certain Municipal Ordinances; To Provide That Notice Of Violation Of Certain Municipal Ordinances Shall Be Given By Affixing Or Posting A Citation To The Property In Violation Of The Ordinance; To Provide That The Owner Of Record Of The Property Shall Be Presumed To Be The Individual Causing The Violation; And For Related Purposes.

2388.title: Municipal utility commission; provide for exclusive right to serve areas within corporate boundaries.
2388.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-27-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Municipal Utility Commission Shall Have The Exclusive Right To Provide Services Within The Corporate Boundaries Of The Municipality That It Serves; To Authorize Any Municipal Utility Commission To Acquire The Facilities And Obligations Of A County Utility District Providing Services To An Area Within The Boundaries Of Such Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2389.title: Pascagoula Street property; authorize DFA to transfer to MDOC.
2389.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Transfer Certain Real Property In Jackson, Mississippi, To The Department Of Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

2390.title: State land acquisition fund; may be used to repair and renovate facilities on land acquired with monies from fund.
2390.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Monies Derived From The Sale Of Certain State-owned Lands Shall Be Deposited Into The State Land Acquisition Fund; To Provide That The Department Of Finance And Administration, With Legislative Approval, May Expend Monies From The Fund To Purchase Additional State Lands And Make Repairs And Renovations To Facilities On Such Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2391.title: Cat Island; authorize Secretary of State to exchange certain property located on with National Park Service.
2391.description: An Act To Authorize The Secretary Of State, With The Approval Of The Governor, To Enter Into Agreements With The United States Of America And Its Agencies For The Purpose Of Consolidating Their Respective Holdings Into Contiguous Tracts; And For Related Purposes.

2392.title: Department of Finance & Administration; include the Crime Lab Building under the jurisdiction of DFA to enforce laws.
2392.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Crime Lab Building Under The Jurisdiction Of The Department Of Finance And Administration To Enforce Laws Of The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2393.title: Professional bail agents; increase amount of qualification bond required for licensure.
2393.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-39-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Qualification Bond Required For Each Applicant For A Professional Bail Agent License Who Acts As Personal Surety; And For Related Purposes.

2394.title: Provider-sponsored health plans; authorize formation of/provide certification process.
2394.description: An Act To Authorize The Formation Of Provider-sponsored Health Plans; To Define The Term "provider-sponsored Health Plan"; To Require The Department Of Insurance To Establish A Process For The Certification Of Provider-sponsored Health Plans; To Provide Certain Minimum Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2395.title: Mississippi Auto Liability Insurance No Pay - No Play Act; create.
2395.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Auto Liability Insurance No Pay - No Play Act"; To Provide That There Shall Be No Recovery For The First $10,000.00 Of Bodily Injury And No Recovery For The First $10,000.00 Of Property Damage Based On Any Cause Or Right Of Action Arising Out Of A Motor Vehicle Accident If The Owner Or Operator Of The Motor Vehicle Fails To Have Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance; To Provide For A Decreased Rate For Certain Uninsured/underinsured Motorist Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2397.title: Hunting; a resident or nonresident guest of the title owner of land does not have to have a hunting license when hunting on those lands.
2397.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Resident Or Nonresident Guest Of A Landowner Does Not Have To Purchase Or Have In His Possession A Hunting License When Hunting On The Landowner's Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2399.title: Hunting and fishing licenses; abolish resident hunting and fishing licenses and fees.
2399.description: An Act To Repeal Section 49-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Resident Hunting And Fishing Licenses And The Fee For Each License; To Repeal Section 49-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Resident Fishing Licenses And The Fee For Each License; To Amend Section 49-7-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Hunter Education Requirements; To Amend Section 49-7-20.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Requirements That Certain Children Who Are Required To Be Supervised By Hunter Over The Age Of 21; To Amend Section 49-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Resident Hunting License And Fee; To Amend Section 49-7-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2400.title: Habitual offenders; revise method of determining whether a felony triggers sentencing as.
2400.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person May Be Sentenced As A Habitual Offender Only If He Has Been Sentenced To And Served Separate Terms Of One Year Or More In A State Or Federal Correctional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2402.title: Regional/county correctional facilities; MDOC may pay base contract price to house state offenders plus 3% inflation increase.
2402.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-933, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Corrections To Pay A Cost Of Inflation Increase In Addition To The Per Day Fee Paid To House State Offenders In Regional Or County Correctional Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2403.title: Mississippi Law Enforcement Accreditation Commission; create one-time bonus for law enforcement officers achieving certification.
2403.description: An Act To Create New Section 45-1-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Law Enforcement Accreditation Incentive Fund For The Purpose Of Awarding A One-time Bonus To Mississippi Law Enforcement Officers Who Achieve Certification Under The Program Offered By The Mississippi Law Enforcement Accreditation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2404.title: Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program; earmark minimum number of awards for teachers of advanced placement courses.
2404.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2015-2016 School Year At Least Two Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program Awards Shall Be Made In Each Mississippi Congressional District For Teacher Education Students Who Agree To Teach Advanced Placement Courses; And For Related Purposes.

2406.title: Interstate reciprocity agreements; to be administered by Commission on College Accreditation.
2406.description: An Act To Authorize The Commission On College Accreditation To Administer Interstate Reciprocity Agreements That Will Allow Approved Institutions Of Higher Learning And Registered Proprietary Schools To Offer Postsecondary Distance Education; And For Related Purposes.

2407.title: Madison County; create Twenty-third Circuit Court District.
2407.description: An Act To Enact Trial Court Redistricting; To Amend Section 9-7-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Twentieth Circuit Court District Shall Consist Solely Of Rankin County; To Amend Section 9-7-54, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Judges To Serve The Twentieth Circuit Court District; To Create New Section 9-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Twenty-third Circuit Court District And To Provide For Judges To Serve The Twenty-third Circuit Court District; To Provide For The Election And Term Of The Initial Holder Of The Office Of District Attorney For The Newly Created Twenty-third Circuit Court District; To Amend Section 25-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Number Of Legal Assistants To District Attorneys To Conform; To Amend Section 25-31-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Number Of Criminal Investigators For District Attorneys To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2408.title: Natchez Trace Parkway property; MDOT and Secretary of State may transfer portion of to the governing authority of the City of Natchez.
2408.description: An Act To Authorize The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, On Behalf Of The Mississippi Transportation Commission, And The Secretary Of State To Transfer And Convey Certain Excess Real Property Located Within Natchez, Adams County, Mississippi, To The Mayor And The Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2409.title: Levee districts; authorize the Board of MS Levee Commissioners to enter into agreements with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers.
2409.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of The Mississippi Levee District To Enter Into Agreements For The Management Of Lands Held By The United States Army Corps Of Engineers For The Management Of Levee Projects, Drainage And Flood Control Within The Levee District; And For Related Purposes.

2410.title: Employment Security Law; create the Mississippi Works Fund to fund strategic workforce training needs.
2410.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Mississippi Works Fund In The Mississippi Employment Security Law; To Provide That Contributions To Such Fund Shall Be Made In Calendar Years 2015 And 2016 And To Provide The Amount Of Contributions And The Payment Of Contributions To Such Fund; To Establish The Contribution Rate For Calendar Years 2015 And 2016; To Provide That Mississippi Works Funds And State Workforce Investment Funds Shall Be Transferred To The State Workforce Investment Board Bank Account; To Provide That All Funds Deposited Into The State Workforce Investment Board Bank Account From The Mississippi Works Fund Shall Be Allocated Exclusively By The State Workforce Investment Board To Make Strategic And Targeted Investments In The Mississippi Workforce To Encourage The Growth Of Better Paying, Higher Skilled In-demand Jobs, With A Focus On High Growth Industries, By Quickly Linking Training Funds To Other Economic Incentives For The Purpose Of Meeting Immediate Training Needs; To Amend Section 71-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Experience Rate For Rate Years 2015 Amd 2016 Shall Be Zero; To Provide For An Increase In The General Experience Rate In 2015 And 2016 Under Certain Circumstances; To Amend Section 71-5-453, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The State Workforce Investment Board; To Revise The Duties Of Such Board; To Provide That The State Workforce Investment Executive Committee, In Consultation With The Full Board, Shall Be Designated As The Body With The Sole Authority To Make Allocations From The Mississippi Works Fund; To Provide That The State Workforce Investment Board Shall Create And Implement Performance Metrics For The Mississippi Works Fund To Determine The Added Value To The Local And State Economy And The Contribution To The Future Growth Of The State Economy; To Provide That A Report On The Performance Of The Fund Shall Be Made To The Governor, The Lieutenant Governor And The Speaker Of The House Annually Throughout The Life Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2412.title: Community redevelopment areas authorize creation in urban renewal areas; increase in sales taxes to be used for redevelopment.
2412.description: An Act To Authorize Certain Municipalities To Establish Community Redevelopment Areas Within Existing Urban Renewal Areas; To Require Redevelopment Trust Funds To Be Created For Such Areas; To Provide The Purposes For Which Funds In Such Trust Funds May Be Utilized, Including The Awarding Of Grants To Private Real Property Owners To Pay The Cost Of Exterior And Interior Improvements To Property In The Community Redevelopment Area That Will Result In The Improved Appearance And Functionality Of The Property; To Provide That Any Increase In The Sales Taxes Collected In The Community Redevelopment Area And Diverted To The Municipality Shall Be Deposited Into The Redevelopment Trust Fund For The Community Redevelopment Area To Fund The Grants Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2413.title: Surplus school buildings; establish a tax credit program for development and rehabilitation of.
2413.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-485, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Income Tax Credit For The Cost Of Development And Rehabilitation Of Surplus School Buildings For Teacher Housing And Economic Development Purposes; To Provide An Income Tax Credit To Be Used As A Subsidy For The Rent Of Public Schoolteachers Who Are Tenants In Such Property; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Establish Fees For Services Under This Redevelopment Program And To Establish A Special Fund Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2414.title: Local option law; cert. qualified resort areas may specify hours, food sale amounts & locations of facilities selling alcohol.
2414.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "qualified Resort Area" Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; To Authorize Certain Municipalities That Fall Within Such Definition To Specify The Hours Of Operation Of Facilities That Offer Alcoholic Beverages For Sale In Such Municipality, To Specify The Percentage Of Revenue That Facilities That Offer Alcoholic Beverages For Sale In Such Municipality Must Derive From The Preparation, Cooking And Serving Of Meals And Not From The Sale Of Beverages And To Designate The Areas In Which Facilities That Offer Alcoholic Beverages For Sale May Be Located; And For Related Purposes.

2415.title: Income tax; exempt income of certain physicians, physician assistants and nurses practicing in critical physician shortage areas.
2415.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Critical Physician, Physician Assistant And Nurse Shortage Incentive Act Of 2015"; To Provide That The Gross Income Of Newly Licensed Physicians, Physician Assistants And Nurses Practicing Medicine In Critical Physician Shortage Areas Shall Not Include Any Income Derived From Providing Medical Services In Critical Physician Shortage Areas; To Provide That The Exemption From Gross Income Authorized By This Act May Be Utilized By The Qualifying Physician, Physician Assistant Or Nurse For Ten Consecutive Years If The Physician, Physician Assistant Or Nurse Practices In Such An Area For That Period Of Time; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2416.title: Uniform Management of Public Employee Retirement Systems Act; create.
2416.description: An Act To Be Known As The Uniform Management Of Public Employee Retirement Systems; To Provide That The Act Applies To All Retirement Programs And Retirement Systems Maintained By The State Or Any Political Subdivision Or Instrumentality Of The State, With Certain Exceptions; To Provide That All Assets Of A Retirement System Are Held In Trust, And The Trustee Of The Retirement System Has The Exclusive Authority To Invest And Manage Those Assets; To Authorize The Trustee To Establish An Administrative Budget Sufficient To Perform The Trustee's Duties And Draw Upon Assets Of The Retirement System To Fund The Budget; To Authorize The Trustee To Obtain By Employment Or Contract The Services Necessary To Exercise The Trustee's Powers And Perform The Trustee's Duties; To Authorize The Trustee To Delegate Certain Functions; To Prescribe The General Duties Of The Trustee And Prescribe The Duties Of The Trustee In Investing And Managing The Assets Of The Retirement System; To Provide That A Trustee Who Breaches A Duty Imposed By This Act Is Personally Liable To A Retirement System For Any Losses Resulting From The Breach And Any Profits Made By The Trustee Through Use Of Assets Of The System By The Trustee; To Provide That An Agreement That Purports To Limit The Liability Of A Trustee For A Breach Of Duty Under This Act Is Void; To Require The Administrator Of A Retirement System To Disseminate To The Public A Summary Plan Description, Annual Disclosure Of Financial And Actuarial Status, And An Annual Report; To Require The Administrator Of A Retirement System To Furnish To Each Participant And Beneficiary Who Is Receiving Benefits Under A Retirement Program Certain Information About The Program; To Require The Administrator Of A Retirement System To File Certain Information With The Retirement System; To Authorize Enforcement Of The Provisions Of This Act By An Action Maintained By The State Or A Political Subdivision Of The State Or By A Participant Or Beneficiary; To Bring Forward Sections 25-11-15, 25-11-101, 25-11-121, 25-11-123, 25-11-129, 25-11-133, 25-11-317, 25-11-319, 25-13-25, 25-13-31, 25-13-33, 21-29-11, 21-29-107, 21-29-125, 21-29-209, 21-29-227, 21-29-257 And 21-29-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2417.title: Federal Workforce Investment Act; Hinds County is separate workforce investment area.
2417.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Hinds County Shall Be A Separate Workforce Investment Area Under The Federal Workforce Investment Act; And For Related Purposes.

2418.title: Mississippi Youth Concussion Law; clarify protocol for child's return to school sport.
2418.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-24-3 And 37-24-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Athlete Who Reports Or Displays Any Symptoms Or Signs Of A Concussion In A Practice Or Game Setting Should Be Removed Immediately And Evaluated By A Licensed, Qualified Medical Professional Working Within Their Scope Of Practice As Soon As Can Be Practically Arranged; And For Related Purposes.

2419.title: Antibullying prohibitions in the public schools; revise definitions and provide responsibilities of SDE and local schools.
