To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lowndes County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of An Equine Center And Related Facilities In Lowndes County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Calhoun County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Repair, Renovation And Rehabilitation Of A Multipurpose Building In The County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping A New Fire Station; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The Amite County School District In Paying The Costs Associated With The Repair, Renovation, Rehabilitation And/or Replacement Of The Heating, Ventilating And Air-conditioning System (hvac) Of The Amite County Elementary School Building; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Utica, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Repair, Renovation And Rehabilitation Of A Community Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Bolton, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Repair, Renovation And Rehabilitation Of A Community Center And Jimmie Lewis Park; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist In Paying The Costs Of Repair, Renovation And Rehabilitation Of The Chickasaw County Heritage Museum In Houston, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Gulfport, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction Of An Aquarium Facility In The City Of Gulfport; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Clinton, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Purchasing And Erecting Markers And Making Improvements To Northside Park; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Grammy

2860.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for the Marty Stuart Center and Congress of Country Music Hall.
2860.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Marty Stuart Center And Congress Of Country Music Hall In Philadelphia, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2862.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Pat Harrison Waterway District improvement.
2862.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Pat Harrison Waterway District In Paying Costs Associated With Capital Improvements To District Properties; To Amend Chapter 464, Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Section 2, Chapter 553, Laws Of 2010, To Revise The Purposes For Which Bond Proceeds Deposited Into The Pat Harrison Waterway District Lake Improvements Fund May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

2863.title: City of Jackson; extend the repeal date on the Jackson Convention and Visitors Bureau and the tax that supports it.
2863.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Chapter 954, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Until July 1, 2018, The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law Which Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Impose A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

2864.title: Bonds; issue general obligation bonds for improvements at the state-owned shipyard located in Jackson County.
2864.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; And For Related Purposes.

2865.title: City of Houston; authorize the imposition of a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants to promote tourism and parks and recreation.
2865.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Houston, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2866.title: City of Quitman; authorize the imposition of a sales tax to fund additions and improvements to the city's sports complex.
2866.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Quitman, Mississippi, To Levy A Special Sales Tax If The Levy Of The Tax Is Approved By 3/5 Of The Qualified Electors Of The City Voting At An Election Called For Such Purpose To Be Held On November 4, 2015; To Exempt Certain Sales From The Special Sales Tax; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Utilized To Fund Additions And Improvements To The City's Sports Complex; And For Related Purposes.

2867.title: Monroe County; authorize the establishment of a county beautification commission.
2867.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County, Mississippi, To Create The Monroe County Beautification Commission; To Prescribe The Membership Of The Commission; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County To Make Annual Contributions To The Commission; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Monroe County To Make Annual Appropriation To The Commission From The Road And Bridge Fund Of Monroe County, When Necessary For An Expenditure By The Commission For Any Beautification Project Of The Commission Related To County Roads; And For Related Purposes.

2868.title: City of Pascagoula; authorize the creation of community redevelopment areas within existing urban renewal areas in the city.
2868.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Establish Community Redevelopment Areas Within Existing Urban Renewal Areas In The City; To Require Redevelopment Trust Funds To Be Created For Such Areas; To Provide The Purposes For Which Funds In Such Trust Funds May Be Utilized, Including The Awarding Of Grants To Private Real Property Owners To Pay The Cost Of Exterior And Interior Improvements To Property In The Community Redevelopment Area That Will Result In The Improved Appearance And Functionality Of The Property; To Provide That Any Increase In The Sales Taxes Collected In The Community Redevelopment Area And Diverted To The City Shall Be Deposited Into The Redevelopment Trust Fund For The Community Redevelopment Area To Fund The Grants Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2869.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize to assist in the construction, equipping or furnishing of a recreational center or area in Town of Tutwiler.
2869.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Assist The Town Of Tutwiler, Mississippi, In The Construction, Equipping Or Furnishing Of A Recreational Center Or Area In Such Town; And For Related Purposes.

2870.title: Bolivar County; may enter into certain road and bridge construction contracts even if they extend 30 days beyond board's term.
2870.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Bolivar County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Certain Road Improvement Contracts Regardless Of Whether The Contracts May Extend Beyond 30 Days From The Termination And End Of The Term Of Office Of The Members Of The Board Of Supervisors Awarding The Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

2872.title: City of Starkville; remove repeal date on the city's economic development, tourism and convention tax.
2872.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 950, Local And Private Laws Of 1994, As Amended By Chapter 1014, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Remove The Repeal Date On The Economic Development, Tourism And Convention Tax Imposed By The City Of Starkville, Mississippi, On The Gross Income Of Restaurants From The Sale Of Prepared Food, Alcoholic And Nonalcoholic Beverages; And For Related Purposes.

2873.title: Forrest County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
2873.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Forrest County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Association For Retarded Citizens, Big Brothers/big Sisters Of Southeast Mississippi, The Boy Scouts Of America, The Gulf Pine Girl Scout Council, The Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Inc., The Salvation Army, Pearl River Valley Opportunity, The Hattiesburg Little League Baseball Association, Petal Optimist Club Baseball, First Tee And The Aids Services Coalition; And For Related Purposes.

2876.title: Washington County; extend the repeal date on the tax on hotels and motels.
2876.description: An Act To Extend Until July 1, 2018, The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Washington County, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Of Up To Two Percent On The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals Within The County, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Establish A Sports Complex For Youth Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

2877.title: City of New Albany; authorize expansion of gas distribution system into certain areas in Union and Marshall Counties.
2877.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of New Albany In Union County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Into Certain Areas In Union County, Mississippi, And Marshall County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2878.title: City of Oxford; authorize the use of the dual-phase design-build method of construction contracting for parking facilities.
2878.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Utilize The Dual-phase Design-build Method Of Construction Contracting For The Construction Of Parking Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2879.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants for recreation and tourism venues and facilities.
2879.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Sales Tax Of Not More Than 2% On The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Recreation And Tourism Facilities; To Authorize Such Governing Authorities To Issue Bonds For A Term Not To Exceed 20 Years For The Purpose Of Purchasing Property, Constructing Or Leasing A Sports Complex And To Authorize The Governing Authorities To Lease City-owned Property For A Term Not To Exceed 20 Years For A Nominal Fee; And For Related Purposes.

2880.title: Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention and Visitors Bureau; give Jackson County additional time to provide tourism funding.
2880.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 58, Laws Of The Extraordinary Session Of 1954, As Last Amended By Chapter 926, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Increase The Initial Term Of The Members Appointed From Jackson County, Mississippi, To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Extend The Time During Which Jackson County Must Identify And Committee-appropriate Sources Of Tourism Funding; And For Related Purposes.

2881.title: City of Jackson; may regulate and prohibit private water wells in the municipal service utility area.
2881.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Regulate And Prohibit The Placement And Use Of Private Water Wells Within The Boundaries Of The Municipal Utility Service Area; To Provide That Certain Water Wells Shall Be Exempt From Any Regulation And Prohibition Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2882.title: Lincoln County; authorize contracts for naming rights for the county's park buildings and structures.
2882.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of The Lincoln County, Mississippi, To Contract For Naming Rights For The County's Park Buildings And Structures; And For Related Purposes.

2883.title: Claiborne County; authorize the transfer of certain property in industrial part to Theater Plus, Inc.
2883.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Claiborne

2884.title: Jackson County; authorize tax on hotels & motels with revenue paid to the Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention and Visitors Bureau.
2884.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In Jackson County If The Levy Of The Tax Is Approved By 60% Of The Qualified Electors Of The County Voting At An Election Called For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Paid To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Regional Convention And Visitors Bureau To Be Used For The Promotion Of Tourism On The Mississippi Gulf Coast; And For Related Purposes.

2885.title: Recognize public and private health providers in Mississippi for highest kindergarten vaccination rates nationwide.
2885.description: A Resolution Recognizing Public And Private Health Providers In Mississippi For Having The Highest National Kindergarten Vaccination Rates.

2886.title: Commend public service of Senator Perry Lee.
2886.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Perry Lee For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

2887.title: Commend public service of Senate President Pro Tempore Giles K. Ward.
2887.description: A Resolution To Commend Senate President Pro Tempore Giles K. Ward For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

2888.title: Commend public service of Senator Kelvin Butler.
2888.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Kelvin E. Butler For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

2889.title: Commend public service of Senator Tony Smith.
2889.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Tony Smith For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

2890.title: Commend public service of Senator Haskins Montgomery.
2890.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Haskins Montgomery For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

2891.title: Commend and congratulate Kossuth High School Cheerleading Team upon winning State Championship.
2891.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Kossuth High School Aggies Cheerleading Team And Sponsor Renee Turner For Winning The 2014 Mississippi High School Activities Association State Cheerleading Championship.

2892.title: Recognize the mission of the new Mississippi Wildlife Heritage Museum in Leland.
2892.description: A Resolution To Recognize And Support The Mission Of The New Mississippi Wildlife Heritage Museum In Leland, Mississippi, And Urge Sportsmen To Join In The Enjoyment That This State-of-the-art Facility Will Bring To Our Citizens.

2893.title: Commend life and public service of Senate President Pro Tempore Terry W. Brown.
2893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Senate President Pro Tempore Terry W. Brown, Longtime Legislator From Columbus, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2894.title: Mourn the loss and commend dedicated service of former State Senator John Ed Lee.
2894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Dedicated Public Service Of Former State Senator John Ed Lee Of Morton, Mississippi, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2895.title: Mourn the passing and commend public service of former State Senator Joe Mulholland of Neshoba County, Mississippi.
2895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing And Commending The Public Service Of Former State Senator Joe Mulholland Of Neshoba County, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2896.title: Mourn the loss of former State Senator and Representative Jay Disharoon of Port Gibson, Mississippi.
2896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Former State Senator And Representative James Dudley (jay) Disharoon Of Port Gibson, Mississippi, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2897.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator and Judge Ray Montgomery.
2897.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator And Judge Ray Hilman Montgomery Of Canton, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

2898.title: Mourn the passing and commend the educational leadership of former ECCC President Dr. Eddie M. Smith of Decatur.
2898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing And Commending The Life And Educational Service Of Former Longtime East Central Community College President Dr. Eddie M. Smith Of Decatur, Mississippi.

2899.title: Commend the judicial service of veteran Hinds Circuit Court Judge William F. Coleman and expressing sympathy of the Legislature.
2899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Judicial Service Of Veteran Hinds Circuit Court Judge William F. "bill" Coleman Of Madison, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2900.title: Mourn the passing of former First Lady Carroll O. Waller.
2900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Former First Lady Carroll Overton Waller And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2901.title: Commend life and public service of former Hattiesburg Mayor and Mississippi Icon Bobby Lee Chain.
2901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Dedicated Public Service And Business Legacy Of Former Hattiesburg Mayor And Mississippi Icon Bobby Lee Chain.

2902.title: Commend service of fallen Conservation Master Sergeant John Collum of Fulton, MS, and extend sympathy of Legislature.
2902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Service Of Fallen Conservation Master Sergeant John Collum Of Fulton, Mississippi, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2903.title: Pay tribute to former "Voice of the Mississippi State Bulldogs" Jack Cristil and extend the sympathy of the Legislature.
2903.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To Former "voice Of The Mississippi State Bulldogs" Jack Cristil And Extending The Condolences Of The Mississippi Legislature To His Surviving Family.

2904.title: Remember life and legacy of Mississippi's First Miss America Mary Ann Mobley.
2904.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Remembering The Historical And Charitable Legacy Of Mississippi's First Miss America Mary Ann Mobley.

2905.title: Mourn the loss and commend dedicated service of former State Senator and Representative Vince Scoper.
2905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Dedicated Public Service Of Former State Senator And Representative Vincent Gradie Scoper Of Laurel, Mississippi, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2908.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule 20 To Require A Fiscal Note On Any Bill Increasing Or Decreasing The Revenue Of The State Upon The Request Of Any Member And To Provide That Consideration Of The Bill Cannot Proceed Without Such Fiscal Note Unless 2/3 Of That House Vote To Dispense.

2911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Collins High School "tigers" Football Team And Coach Ryan Earnest For Their First Class 3a State Championship In 12 Years.

2912.title: Recognize Bassfield High School "Yellowjackets" Football Team for Class 2A three-peat State Championship.
2912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Bassfield High School "yellowjackets" Football Team And Head Coach Lance Mancuso For Winning Their Third Consecutive Mhsaa Class 2a State Championship.

2925.title: Unfunded state mandates; amend Constitution to prohibit.

2926.title: Constitution; mineral estate to revert to surface.
2926.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Create New Section 112a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For An Annual Assessment On Certain Nonproducing Mineral Estates; To Provide That Failure To Pay The Assessment Shall Result In The Reversion Of The Title And Interest In The Mineral Estate To The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Redemption Of The Mineral Estate; And For Related Purposes.

2927.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to propose amendment to restrict federal/regulatory authority.

"billy" Orr Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The Longtime Executive Director Of The Mississippi State Fair Commission And Thanking Him For His Leadership During A Period Of Unparalleled And Exciting Growth Of The Largest Fair In The Deep South.

3008.description: A Concurrent Resolution Welcoming Former Nasa Apollo Astronaut Fred Wallace Haise, Jr., To His Native State Of Mississippi On The Occasion Of The Partners For Stennis Space Center Capitol Day.

3009.title: Urge United States Congress to take immediate action to prevent Bureau of ATF from banning common rifle ammunition.
3009.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The United States Congress To Take Immediate Legislative Action To Prevent The Bureau Of Alcohol, Tobacco And Firearms From Banning Common Rifle Ammunition And To Affirm That Mississippi Law Will Control The Definition Of Armor-piercing Ammunition.

3010.title: Recognize achievements of Jackson business and civic leader Carl Herrin and extend condolences on his passing.

3011.title: Commend "W.C." Gorden for induction into the Black College Football Hall of Fame.

3012.title: Designate March 2015 as "American Red Cross Month" in Mississippi.
3012.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Designate March 2015 As "american Red Cross Month" In Mississippi.

3013.title: Recognize Jackson Prep "Patriots" Soccer Team for 5th straight MAIS Title and Coach Duncan for 500th win.
3013.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Recognize And Salute The Jackson Preparatory School "patriots" Boys Soccer Team For Its 5th Consecutive Mais Class Aaa Title And Coach Jon Marcus Duncan For His Milestone 500th Victory.

3014.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison-ridgeland Academy "lady Patriots" Basketball Team And Coach Stephen Force For Winning The Mais Aaa State Championship And For The Mais Overall State Championship.

3015.title: Recognize 125th Anniversary of First Baptist Church of Madison.

3016.title: Recognize Roy Thigpen, Sr., of Montrose in Jasper County as 2014 MFA "Outstanding Tree Farmer of the Year."
3016.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Roy Thigpen, Sr., Of Montrose In Jasper County, Upon His Receipt Of The 2014 Mississippi Forestry Association (mfa) "outstanding Tree Farmer Of The Year" Award.

3017.title: Commend Callaway High School "Chargers" Boys Basketball Team for fourth straight Class 5A State Championship.
3017.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Callaway High School "chargers" Boys Basketball Team And Head Coach David Sanders For Winning Their 4-peat Class 5a State Championship And Sixth Championship In Seven Years.

3018.title: Commend and recognize 17 Senior Class Eagle Scouts from Jackson Academy.
3018.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The 17 Eagle Scouts From The 2014-2015 Senior Class At Jackson Academy And Commending The Rich Scouting Tradition At This Excellent Institution.

3019.title: Commend Velma Jackson High School Basketball for 3-Peat Class 3A State Championship.
3019.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Velma Jackson High School "falcons" Boys Basketball Team And Head Coach Anthony Carlyle For Winning Their Third Straight (3-peat) Class 3a State Championship.

3020.title: Recognize John Michael (Mike) Allen for 35 years of dedicated service to the Mississippi Crime Laboratory.
3020.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing John Michael (mike) Allen For 35 Years Of Dedicated Professional Service To The Mississippi Crime Laboratory.

3021.title: Commend Belmont High School "Lady Cardinals" Girls Basketball Team and Coach Chris Higginbottom for Class 3A State Title.
3021.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Belmont High School "lady Cardinals" Girls Basketball Team And Coach Chris Higginbottom For Winning The Mhsaa Class 3a State Championship.

3022.title: Commend Starkville High School "Yellow Jackets" Boys Basketball Team for Class 6A State Championship.
3022.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Starkville High School "yellow Jackets" Boys Basketball Team And Head Coach Greg Carter For Winning The Class 6a State Championship.

3023.title: Commend McComb High School "Tigers" Boys Basketball Team and Coach Hilton Harrell for back-to-back State Championships.
3023.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mccomb High School "tigers" Boys Basketball Team And Coach Hilton Harrell For Capturing Back-to-back 4a State Championships.

3024.title: Commend Pelahatchie High School "Lady Chiefs" Girls Basketball Team for winning its first State Title in 46 years.
3024.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pelahatchie High School "lady Chiefs" Girls Basketball Team And Coach Pearlene Fairley For Winning Their First Class 1a State Championship In 46 Years.

3025.title: Commend East Webster High School "Wolverines" Girls Basketball Team for Class 2A State Championship in honor of late Coach.
3025.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The East Webster High School "wolverines" Girls Basketball Team And Head Coach/principal Bill Brand For Winning The Class 2a State Championship In Honor Of Their Late Coach Stan Hughey.

3026.title: Commend Horn Lake High School "Lady Eagles" Girls Basketball Team for second straight Class 6A State Championship.
3026.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Horn Lake High School "lady Eagles" Girls Basketball Team And Coach Janna Thompson For Their Second Consecutive Class 6a State Championship.

3027.title: Commend East Webster High School Cheerleading Team for third consecutive State Championship.
3027.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The East Webster High School "wolverines" Cheerleading Squad And Coach Shawna Williams For Winning Their Third Consecutive Mhsaa Class 1a Through 3a Non-tumbling State Championship.

3028.title: Commend Natchez High School "Lady Bulldogs" Girls Basketball Team for winning second straight Class 5A State Championship.
3028.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Natchez High School "lady Bulldogs" Girls Basketball Team And Head Coach Alphaka Moore For Winning Their Second Straight Mhsaa Class 5a State Championship.

3029.title: Urge EPA to withdraw proposed Clean Power Plan.
3029.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Federal Administration To Withdraw And Reconsider The Proposed Clean Power Plan; Supporting The Comments Submitted To The United States Environmental Protection Agency (epa) By The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality (mdeq), And The Mississippi Public Service Commission (psc) On The Clean Power Plan; Encouraging Congress And The President Of The United States To Enact Legislation Delaying Implementation Of The Final Clean Power Plan Until Certain Criteria Are Met; And For Related Purposes.

3030.title: Recognize Winston Academy 8th Grader Dev Jaiswal for winning the 2015 Mississippi Spelling Bee.
3030.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Winston Academy 8th Grader Dev Jaiswal For Winning The 2015 Mississippi Spelling Bee Held At Mississippi Public Broadcasting.

3031.title: Congratulate 2015 AKA Sorority on Policy Impact Day at the Capitol.
3031.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated, On The Occasion Of Its Policy Impact "2015 Aka Day At The Mississippi State Capitol" To Promote Advocacy And Take Action For Civil Rights, Social Justice And Family Strengthening Initiatives.

3032.title: Commend Belhaven Baseball Coach Hill Denson for his 1,000th collegiate victory.
3032.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi Hall Of Fame Belhaven Baseball Coach Hill Denson For His 1,000th Collegiate Victory.

3033.title: Commend educational legacy of Dr. Lynn Weathersby on his retirement as Superintendent of Education of Rankin County Schools.
3033.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Legacy Of Educational Opportunities For Students Achieved By Dr. Charles Lynn Weathersby Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Superintendent Of Education For Rankin County Schools.

3034.title: Recognize legacy of Executive Director of Department of Rehabilitation Services and former Legislator Butch McMillan on his retirement.
3034.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Legacy Of Achievement Of The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Rehabilitation Services And Former Legislator H.s. "butch" Mcmillan On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3035.title: Commend Bay Springs High School "Bulldogs" Boys Basketball Team for first State Title.
3035.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Bay Springs High School "bulldogs" Boys Basketball Team And Head Coach Corey Mackey For Winning Their First Mhsaa Class 2a State Championship.

3036.title: Mourn the loss of Deputy U.S. Marshal Josie Lamar Wells of Jackson County, Mississippi, in the line of duty.
3036.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Deputy United States Marshal Josie Lamar Wells Of Jackson County, Mississippi, Who Died In The Line Of Duty On March 10, 2015, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3037.title: Designate March 2015 as "Women's History Month in Mississippi."
3037.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 2015 As "women's History Month In Mississippi" With Its Theme "weaving The Stories Of Women's Lives," Celebrating The 35th Anniversary Of The Women's History Movement.

3038.title: Commend Clinton High School's Attach
3038.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Clinton High School "attach

3039.title: Expressing the intent of the Legislature to require the use of "SOUND SCIENCE" in evaluating crop protection chemistries and nutrients.
3039.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing The Intent Of The Mississippi Legislature For The Support Of Federal Regulations Requiring The Use Of "sound Science" In Evaluating Crop Protection Chemistries And Nutrients.

3040.title: Designate April 13-17, 2015, as "Undergraduate Research Week in Mississippi."
3040.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating April 13-17, 2015, As "undergraduate Research Week In Mississippi" To Emphasize The Value Of Independent Scholarly Activity At Our Universities To Foster Professional Growth.

3041.title: Recognize 150th Business Anniversary of O'Keefe Funeral Homes in Ocean Springs, Mississippi.
3041.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Sesquicentennial Business Anniversary Of O'keefe Funeral Homes In Ocean Springs, Mississippi, And Designating April 9, 2015, As "o'keefe Funeral Homes Day In Mississippi."

3042.title: Recognize and commend leadership and service of University of Mississippi School of Law Dean Richard Gershon.
3042.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Leadership And Service Of University Of Mississippi School Of Law Dean Richard Gershon As He Returns To Full-time Teaching.

3043.title: Thank Bob Owens for service as outgoing President of the Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
3043.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Record Of Achievement Of Robert (bob) Owens Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Outgoing President Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And Thanking Him For His Service.

3044.title: Recognize the "Mississippi Year of Women" celebration of the legacies of Eudora Welty, Margaret Walker and Marie Hull.
3044.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The "mississippi Year Of Women" Celebration Of The Legacies Of Respected Artists And Authors Eudora Welty, Margaret Walker And Marie Hull.

3045.title: Urge federal transfer of public lands to the states.
3045.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing Support For The Federal Transfer Of Public Lands To The States.

3046.title: Suspend rules for drafting, etc.; amend Constitution to provide for a State University System and local Boards of Trustees.
3046.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Resolution Entitled "a Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The 8 Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi, To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The 8 Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi, To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi, To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System, To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System And To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes."

3047.title: Suspend rules for drafting, etc.; provide for a State University System and local Boards of Trustees.
3047.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 37-101-1, 37-101-2, 37-101-3, 37-101-5, 37-101-7, 37-101-9, 37-101-11, 37-101-13, 37-101-15, 37-101-16, 37-101-19, 37-101-21, 37-101-23, 37-101-27, 37-101-28, 37-101-29, 37-101-30, 37-103-1 And 37-103-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Responsibility For The Administration Of The State University System Established Under The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Selection Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System And To Prescribe Its Powers And Duties, To Clarify The Powers And Duties Of The Legislature Relating To The State University System, To Provide For The Selection Of A Chancellor Of The State University System By The Board Of Governors And Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Chancellor, To Provide For The Selection Of The Local University Boards Of Trustees And To Prescribe Their Powers And Duties, To Provide For The Selection Of University Presidents And Prescribe Their Powers And Duties; And For Related Purposes."

3048.title: Commend civic contributions and advocacy of Annie Lee Burt of Jackson, Mississippi.
3048.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Civic Contributions, Charity And Advocacy For Those In Poverty Exemplified By Annie Lee Burt Of Jackson, Mississippi, And Extending The Thanks Of The Legislature.

3049.title: Mourn the passing of Social Justice Advocate Stephanie Parker-Weaver of Jackson, Mississippi.
3049.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Social Justice Advocate And Civil Rights Activist Stephanie Parker-weaver Of Jackson, Mississippi.

3050.title: Recognize Mississippi historical contributions of Bill Minor.
3050.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Thanking Syndicated Columnist Bill Minor For His Contributions To Mississippi History And To The Mississippi Legislative Process.

3051.title: Recognize Jackie Lett on her retirement as longtime President of the Mississippi Association of Broadcasting.
3051.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Career And Service Of Respected Advertising Executive Jackie M. Lett Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement As President Of The Mississippi Association Of Broadcasting.

3052.title: Commend Tupelo High School "Synergy" Show Choir for Grand Championship.
3052.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Tupelo High School "synergy" Show Choir And Director Danielle Frerer For Their Grand Champion Victory And Outstanding 2014-2015 Competition Season.

3053.title: Acknowledge "National Doctors' Day" in Mississippi and recognize service of Doctors of the Day during the 2015 Regular Session.
3053.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Acknowledge That March 30, 2015, Is "national Doctors' Day" And To Recognize The Service Of The Doctors Of The Day Serving The Mississippi Legislature During The 2015 Regular Session.

3054.title: Commend Shaw High School "Hawks" Boys Basketball Team and Coach Davis for capturing their second 1A State Championship.
3054.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Shaw High School "hawks" Boys Basketball Team And Coach Anthony Davis For Capturing Back-to-back 1a State Championships.

3055.title: Recognize Madison Central High School for leading in National Merit Semifinalists.
3055.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Madison Central High School For Leading The State In National Merit Semifinalists.

3056.title: Recognize career and public service of youth court reform advocate Judge John N. Hudson.
3056.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Career And Public Service Of Youth Court Reform Advocate Judge John N. Hudson Of Natchez, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3057.title: Recognize longtime Chickasaw County Chancery Clerk Wanda Sweeney on her retirement after 32 years serving at the courthouse.
3057.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Dedicated Public Service Of Wanda Sweeney On The Occasion Of Her Retirement As Chickasaw County Chancery Clerk And For 32 Years Of Courthouse Service.

3058.title: Recognize longtime Chickasaw County Sheriff Jimmy Simmons on his retirement after 32 years of public service.
3058.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Chickasaw County Sheriff Jimmy Simmons On The Occasion Of His Retirement For 32 Years Of Dedicated Law Enforcement And Military Service.

3059.title: Commend Hannah Williams for winning "Miss Mississippi United States 2015".
3059.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Hannah Williams Of Jackson, Mississippi, For Attaining The "miss Mississippi United States 2015" Title And Extend The Best Wishes Of The Mississippi Legislature As She Competes In The National Pageant In Washington, D.c.

3060.title: Urge the U.S. Dept. of the Treasury to place a woman's face on our paper currency in honor of 100th Anniversary of Women's Suffrage.
3060.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The United States Department Of The Treasury To Place A Woman's Face On Our Paper Currency In Honor Of The 100th Anniversary Of The Women's Suffrage Constitutional Amendment In 2020.

3061.title: Recognize Co-Lin Lady Wolves Basketball Team for State Championship.
3061.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Hard Work And Dedication Of The 2014-2015 Copiah-lincoln Community College "lady Wolves" Basketball Team, Head Coach Gwyn Young And Assistant Coach Nikki Williams For Winning The 2015 Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior Colleges State Women's Basketball Championship.

3062.title: Commend Kossuth High School "Lady Aggies" Bowling Team for winning MHSAA State Championship.
3062.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Kossuth High School "lady Aggies" Bowling Team For Winning The State Bowling Championship.

3063.title: Recognize 50th Anniversary of Magnolia Regional Health Center in Corinth, Mississippi.
3063.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 50th Anniversary Of Magnolia Regional Health Center In Corinth, Mississippi.

3064.title: Suspend rules for further consideration of Conference Report on H.B 583; health care CON.
3064.description: A Concurrent Resolution Granting Permission Of The Legislature For Full And Immediate Consideration Of A Conference Report On House Bill No. 583, 2015 Regular Session, Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 33-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If There Is Significant Damage To A Health Care Facility By A Natural Disaster In An Area That Is Proclaimed A Disaster Area Or Subject To A State Of Emergency By The Governor Or By The President Of The United States, The Repair Or The Rebuilding Of Any Such Damaged Health Care Facility Within Three Miles Of The Pre-disaster Location Of The Damaged Facility Shall Be Exempt From All Of Requirements Of The Mississippi Health Care Certificate Of Need Law; To Define "significant Damage" For The Purposes Of This Act; And For Related Purposes."

3065.title: Recognize Clinton High School 2015 STAR Student Javarcia Ivory.
3065.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Clinton High School Senior And Former Senate Page Javarcia Ivory As The School's 2015 Student-teacher Achievement Recognition (star) Student, And Recognize Alix Williams As The Star Teacher Chosen By Javarcia Ivory.

3066.title: Commend Elizabeth Phillips for winning the 2015 Mississippi Prudential Spirit of Community Award as Distinguished Finalist.
3066.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Elizabeth Phillips, New Hope High School Senior Of Columbus, Mississippi, Upon Her Receipt Of The 2015 Prudential Spirit Of Community Award As A Distinguished Finalist.
